In the long term, she wishes to finish building her house with the comforts that her family deserves.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of hygenic service within her home

loans.name: Sadareddin

texts.en: Sadareddin H. is 32 years old, married, and has two small children. Sadareddin is the only breadwinner in the family, and he is very hard-working. He earns income running a shop in the village of Saatli. For the last eight years, he has been selling sugar and soft drinks at attractive prices. Therefore, Sadareddin's store has been very popular in the neighborhood and has assured a steady income for his family. However, Sadareddin currently needs a loan of US$1,000 to be able to expand the amount of inventory in the store. He is thankful for everyone's support and promises to repay the loan within 15 months.

loans.use: Store inventory expansion

loans.name: Akos

texts.fr: Akos N. est une revendeuse ambulante de pagnes à Wome, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 22 ans, Akos est une célibataire et exerce cette activité bientôt 2 ans. Elle désire par ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant plus de pagnes et aussi louer un magasin pour l’exposition de ses marchandises
texts.en:
Akos N., 22, is an ambulant salesperson in Womé, a village situated about 130 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Akos is single and she has been selling "pagnes" (brightly colored lengths of African cloth that are used as sarongs, head wraps etc.) for almost 2 years. She would like to use this loan to grow her business by buying more "pagnes" and also to rent a store where she could display her wares.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase more "pagnes" and rent a store

loans.name: Prisca Joachim

texts.en: Prisca Joachim M. is a Tanzanian businesswoman. She runs a boutique and beauty salon in Kariakoo business center in Dar es Salaam. She has been in this business for more than 6 years. She purchases the business items from wholesale shops in Kariakoo; some are imported from China, India, and Dubai and supplied to customers in Dar es Salaam. From the business she has managed to build her own house and pay school fees for her brothers and sisters. She requests a loan of Tshs1,450,000 to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her salon

loans.name: Phoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Phoeurn L. is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is three years old. Her husband is on the right of the photo. Her husband, Mr. Rin Ruon, is a construction worker and also helps his wife in the plantation. Mrs. Phoeurn L. is a farmer in Krodas Kor village in Kampong Cham province. She owns land but she does not have enough money to purchase fertilizers to support the field.  Mrs. Phoeurn L. asks for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to support the field.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
La señora Basilia, pertenece al banco comunal “Las Fronterizas” distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 39 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con 5 hijos, y estudios de primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 8 años, su negocio es la panadería (elaboración y comercialización de panes) y frutas, para lo cual inicio con un préstamo de 300 soles. 
A fin de generar mayores ingresos, ella requiere un préstamo de 2000 soles, con lo cual adquirirá insumos y materia prima (harina, manteca, levadura, sal, leña, etc) para mejorar la elaboración de panes en volumen y calidad; de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias y ampliar su mercado; los ingresos generados servirán para ayudar a los estudios de sus hijos, ampliar su negocio y para pagar inicialmente y puntualmente sus respectivas cuotas.
texts.en:
Basilia belongs to the Las Fronterizas community bank on the Desaguadero district of the Chucuito province, in the department of Puno. She is a married woman who is 39 years old with 5 children and a high school education. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for the last 8 years, and runs a commercial baking and fruit business which she started with an initial loan of 300 soles. In order to increase sales, Basilia is requesting a 2000 sol loan which she will use to purchase supplies and basic ingredients (flour, lard, yeast, salt, firewood, etc) to improve the volume and quality of the bread she bakes. This will allow her to increase her income and broaden her market. The additional income will allow her to assist with the schooling of her children, expand her business, and to pay her bills early and on time.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and basic ingredients, (Flour, lard, salt, yeast, firewood)

loans.name: Mrs. Tom Mil Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of nine people, is located in Hang Chhouk village in the Kampong Chhnang province. All of the members will use this loan for different purposes. Mrs. Tom M. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. Kham Sophal, are farmers who own a small piece of land and cultivates rice. The plantation has been yielding a smaller crop due to the infertile soil. To rectify with this problem, Mrs. Tom M. has decided to request a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and make her crop more productive. Mrs. Tom M. is 41 years old and the mother of six children two of whom are employed in a garment factory, three are attending the local school and the youngest one is only five years old.

Seven members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to support the field and make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Sun's Group

texts.en:
S. H. is the leader of this group of three borrowers. She has three children, all of whom are in school. She is married to Sophea, 49, who has a public service job. S. H. has sold different kinds of vegetables (such as cucumbers, potatoes, mushrooms, and so forth) since 2000. She is a struggling mother and a responsible seller; she earns a good income from her business because her store is in the busy market. To meet her family's needs, S. H. wants to increase the income from this business. So she is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables for her store. 

The other members of her group are: 
H., 44, who sells vegetables in bulk to the sellers in the whole market. She is looking for a loan to invest in her business. 
N., 49, who sells vegetables in retail. She is applying for a loan to renovate her store. 

All three entrepreneurs live in Battambang Province.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for her store

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es:
La señora Blanca M. es una persona muy trabajadora cuya labor es la venta de alimentos en su localidad en la ciudad de León donde vende en las afueras de la calle alimentos y gaseosas. 

La razón por la cual espera en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la materia prima y por esta razón es que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel esperando que su crédito sea otorgado y así mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y seguir desarrollándose.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca M. is a very hard working person whose business is the sale of food in her area of the city of Leon where she sells groceries and sodas from a street stand. She is turning to Ceprodel wanting to be granted a loan for the purchase of raw materials and for this is wishing that her loan be approved and she can improve the condition of her business and continue to develop.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Eugenie Goussi

texts.fr:
H. Eugenie Goussi est née le 15/01/1974 à Allada au Sud du Bénin. Eugenie Goussi est mariée KOUDAFOKE Alain mécanicien de profession. Eugenie Goussi est mère de trois enfants dont deux sont scolarisés. Eugenie Goussi vit avec sa famille à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Eugenie Goussi
vend des fruits: orange, ananas, papaye, bananes, etc. Eugenie Goussi achète ses fruits dans les villages du Bénin auprès de paysans. Eugenie Goussi revient à Cotonou pour livrer ses fruits aux semi grossistes qui à leur tour, les revendent aux détaillants. Pour mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle,  Eugenie Goussi veut renforcer son fonds de commerce. C'est la raison pour laquelle Eugenie Goussi sollicite de prêt à ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Eugenie Goussi H. was born on January 15, 1974, in Allada in South Benin. She's married to Alain KOUDAFOKE, a trained mechanic. Eugenie Goussi is the mother of three children, out of which two attend school. She lives with her family in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She sells fruits : oranges, pineapples, papayas, bananas, etc. She buys her fruits from farmers in the villages of Benin. She then sells the fruits to semi-wholesalers who, in turn, sell them to retailers. In order to better meet customer demand, Eugenie Goussi wants to bolster her working capital. This is why she's seeking this loan from Kiva's partner, Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large quantities of pineapples

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita es socia del Banco Comunal Chacco.
Juanita es casada, tiene 42 años y 7 hijos, Juanita junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura de verduras en su comunidad de Chacco y también papa en la comunidad de Iguain, sus productos los comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Juanita necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono, peones.
Juanita sueña con tener más capital y brindar buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juanita is a member of the Chacco communal bank. Juanita is married, 42 years old and has 7 children. Together with her husband, Juanita is dedicated to growing vegetables in her community of Chacco and also potatoes in the Iguain community. She sells her products in the market in the city of Ayachucho. Juanita needs a loan of 900 soles that will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer, and to pay for workers. Juanita dreams of having more capital and providing a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of fertilizer, payment of workers

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia es una mujer que a sus 54 años de edad sigue teniendo fuerzas para progresar, es soltera, y aunque no tiene hijos, ese espacio lo compensa con el amor que le brinda a su sobrina que cría desde muy niña. Cuando era joven, se dedica a la panadería, actividad muy sacrificada, pero que le dejaba muy buenas ganancias que le permitieron adquirir su casa. Pero debido a dolencias físicas cambio este negocio por la venta de comestibles en una tienda que implementó en su casa. Aunque con forme fueron pasando los años, la competencia fue aumentando, Celia se mantuvo firme con su bodega, negocio que le ha dado muchas satisfacciones, por ello se levanta muy temprano para hacer la limpieza de todos los andamios de su local, y comprar los panecillos calientes para ofrecer a sus clientes. En todos estos años ha ganado mucha experiencia, aprendió a que el trato a sus clientes es muy importante en este negocio, y con ello ha sabido incrementar su clientela regular. Las ganancias que obtiene son para su propio sostenimiento y para cubrir la educación de su sobrina, a quien sostiene como a su propia hija. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, cabe recalcar que Celia es una de las fundadoras de su banco comunal y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente muy puntual, por ello que es muy respetada por los demás integrantes. Con los 800 soles que solicita comprará mercadería para surtir su negocio y hacer de su bodega una tienda más atractiva.
texts.en:
Celia is a 54 year old woman who has the force to improve her life. She is single and although she doesn’t have children, in this space she compensates with the love she brings to the niece that she has raised since she was very young. When she was a child, she worked at a bakery, a very hard activity, but it gave her a good profit and enabled her to rent her home. But due to physical pain, she changed this business to sell food in a store that she began in her home. Although the years were passing, she improved her skills. Celia maintained herself well in the shop, a business that has given her much satisfaction. For this she gets up very early to do the cleaning of all the scaffolding in her location and to buy the hot breads to offer to her clients. In all these years she has gained much experience, learning that the treatment of her clients is very important in this business, and with this she has been able to increase her regular clients. The earnings that she gets are for her own sustenance, and to cover the education of her niece, whom she supports as her own daughter. This is her ninth loan with MFP. It should be emphasized that Celia is one of the founders of her community bank, and in all this time she has demonstrated herself as a very punctual client. Because of this she is very respected by all the members. With the 800 soles that she is asking for, she would buy merchandise to stock her business and to make her store more attractive.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock Celia's Store

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad is 33 years old and lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife. Ziad has been working as a furniture painter for seven years. Ziad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and paint, as well as generator for his work. This is his second cycle; he paid the first loan on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve his work by purchasing new tools. Ziad is respected because he does the job well and he is punctual. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Ziad decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business in order to improve his financial situation.

loans.use: Ziad will use the loan to purchase tools and paint, as well as generator for his work.

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Juana S. C. tiene 43 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene solamente un hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, además de poseer este negocio, por las noches elabora comida en su vivienda, ella inicio su negocio con capital propio y con la ayuda de su familia que siempre la apoyaba con el negocio de la ropa. El financiamiento que solicita Juana es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa como pantalones, camisas, ropa para niños. El sueño de Juana es brindarles a sus hijos las mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Juana S. C. is a 43 year old single mother. She sells clothes for a living, which she's done for the past 10 years. In addition, she also makes food at home to sell at night. Juana started this food business with her own money, and with the support of her family, who always supported her clothing business. Juana is asking for a loan to purchase clothes, such as pants, shirts, and children's clothing. Juana's dream is to give her children better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is 42 years old. She is married and the mother of five children, who are all in school. She sells smoked fishes. She started her fish sales business twenty years ago at the community market near where she lives. She buys stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana, and from the fish mongers sometimes when demand is high. She prepares very tasty and good quality fish to serve her customers, and because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She has a large customer base as a result of her moderate prices and her good reception towards her customers.

She is requesting a loan to upgrade her stock of fishes. She dreams to give her children a quality education through the proceeds from her business, and she would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more smoked and dried fish

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Préstamo Anterior: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=102244&_tpos=1&_tpg=1
Rosario es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino, se dedica a la venta de ropa y  calzado  de segunda y nuevo al crédito. También  con su hijo han puesto un  negocio de vidriería  en su casa.
Rosario necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, para la compra de ropa zapatos e invertir en vidrios.
Los préstamos han ayudado a surgir en su negocio, ella solo saca lo que puede pagar. 
El sueño de Rosario es tener un puesto de ferretería.
texts.en:
Rosario is a member of the Village Bank "Niño Divino." She sells used and new clothing and footwear on credit. Additionally, with her son she has a glass workshop in her house. Rosario needs a loan of 1400 soles to buy clothes, shoes, and invest in more glass. The loans have helped her to develop her business and she never borrows more than she can afford. Rosario's dream is to have her own hardware store. Her earlier loan can be found at: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=102244&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing and shoes and investing in glass

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La señora Irene, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 48 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Tiene años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, brindando servicios de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su esposo se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos, poco a poco fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando repuestos, para mejorar el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad.

 Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00,  comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente.
Hoy en día es una mujer independiente, y es ella y su esposo quienes toman las decisiones y administran su negocio.

Irene nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irene belongs to "Banco Comunal "Los Eucaliptos", District of Tarapoto, Province San Martin, Department of San Martin. She lives with her partner, she is 48 years old and the mother of 2 school-going children who still depend on her.

She has been offering urban transportation for years with her motorcycle. Her husband is in charge of driving it around different areas of the city. She started with the first loan from Manuela Ramos, little by little she saved money to buy spare parts in order to improve service to the inhabitants of the community.

With this loan of S/.1,000.00 she will buy spare parts and oils such as lubricants, "bocamasas", and spark plugs in order to offer better service to her customers. Today she is an independent lady and together with her husband they make the decisions and administer their business.

Irene tells us that belonging to a group of women has helped her to know her rights better and together they have made them be respected.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts and oils such as lubricants, "bocamasas" and spark plugs.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
I can say that Victoria Z. is a tough woman, because at the age of 59, she is already a widow but still continues on with her life. Her husband passed away, but she continues living for her children. She is now living with them. Some of them are now employed, which provides the family's income. But, as ordinary employees in a company their combined salaries are not enough for the expenses of the whole family. That’s why Victoria runs a hog fattening, or the raising of pigs, business that can provide them extra income.

Her business started with two pigs and later on increased in number. Now she wants to buy additional pigs to raise and to buy feed for them. So she joined the Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), so that she can borrow the money she needs for growing her business. She hopes that through her determination her business will succeed.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and feed for them

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella B. is from the village of Taboc Norte. She is 50 years old and is married.

Estrella owns and operates a fancy jewelry business, operating a specialized retail store selling fancy jewelry in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Estrella joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC.

Estrella is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 1st loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is forty – nine years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Akosua is a trader. She trades in plantain. She buys from nearby towns and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. She also treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. Akosua has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy plantain

loans.name: Aissatou Taty

texts.fr: Aïssatou est une femme de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants qui sont tous à l'école. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE CENTRE depuis 4 ans et y a bénéficié de 8 prêts qu'elle a remboursés sans difficulté. Elle achète du maïs et le transforme en couscous pour le vendre. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aïssatou, 53, is married and the mother of 4 children who are all enrolled in school. She has been a member of the Village Bank of BOUCOTTE CENTRE for 4 years and has received 8 loans which she has repaid without difficulty. She buys maize and transforms it into couscous to sell. Her profit permits her to participate in the improvement of living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her business

loans.name: Reun

texts.en: Reun R., 58, lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She earns a living by selling grocery inventory from her house, selling items such as cooked food and sweets for children. She is experienced and has been in this business for a long time. Reun R. is married andcurrently takes care of two school-aged children, with three other children already married. Her husband sells water to the neighbors for a profit. In the past, Reun R. always hired a taxi at a considerable cost for traveling purposes. She right now hopes to reduce those expenses by using a Kiva loan to purchase a motorcycle for her and her family's commuting needs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her and her family's commuting needs

loans.name: Silvia Filomena

texts.es: Doña Silvia Filomena S. su negocio es el alquiler de cuartos, tiene doce años en este negocio el cual ha logrado hacer mejoras a las habitaciones, para dar un mejor servicio, procreo tres hijos, dos están en los Estados Unidos de América los cuales le envían remesas para sus necesidades, y medicamentos y el otro  esta trabajando aquí, el cual vive con ella. Los cuartos son alquilados por extranjeros. Tiene 61 años de edad, y vive en un reparto de Mostatepe, con este préstamo quiere dar mantenimiento a los cuartos de pintura, baños, puertas. Con el fin de poder pedir un buen precio en donde pueda pagar los gastos básicos como: Agua, luz, pago de limpieza. A si como poder estar en mejores condiciones de vida. Su mayor anhelo es poder ver a sus hijos pronto ya que ellos  emigraron con el fin de poder encontrar un mejor trabajo para ganar mejor y poder ayudarse económicamente. Como madre me siento contenta pero se han quedado allá en donde hay mejores oportunidades de empleo,  y se han  formalizado con su familia. Es por eso no vienen seguido al país.
texts.en:
Silvia Filomena S.’s business is the rental of rooms, she’s had this business for 12 years and has done betterments to the rooms to provide a better service. She has three children, two are in the United States of America and send her money for her needs and medicine, the third children lives with her. The rooms are rented to foreigners. She is 61 years old and lives in Mostatepe, with this loan she wants to give maintenance to the rooms such as painting, bathrooms and doors. This is also with the objective to be able to charge a good price that would be sufficient to pay the basic utilities such as: water, power and cleaning services. In addition, she wants to have better living conditions. Her big wish is to be able to see her children soon, they emigrated with the purpose of finding a better job to make better money; as a mother she feels happy because they are in a place with better work opportunities and have established a family. This is why they don’t travel back to the country often.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar pintura para pintar cuartos, reparar inodoro y puertas

loans.name: Aklsdfj

texts.es: lsdf
texts.en:
lsdf

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: alsd

loans.name: Rock Of Ages Group

texts.en: Simon is forty-six years-old. He is married, and the father of five children who are currently pursuing education in senior, junior and primary schools. He lives with his family in their own house in a farming community. Simon runs a grocery store and is also a taxi driver. These are his main source of income with which to support his family. He is the leader of a village trust bank group called Rock of Ages. The members are all traders and food vendors who support their families through these businesses. They want to use the loan to purchase stock in bulk to avoid price hikes and also cut down on frequent travels. They are expecting to make higher profits this season to help pay their kids school fees. Your support would enable them grow their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Judith Atieno

texts.en:
Judith Atieno O. runs two kinds of businesses: a salon and a clothing business, both in Kisumu, Kenya.

Judith is separated from her husband and is the mother of two children, besides being a guardian to two orphans. Before she ventured into business, she was a housewife and solely depended on her husband.

Judith’s future plan is to buy a parcel of land and build a home for herself and her children. She would like a loan of Kshs 20,000 to initiate the expansion of her businesses.

loans.use: To expand her salon and clothing businesses

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: 50-year-old Helen is living in Norala, South Cotabato and has a rice-farming business. She started tilling her farm back in 1980. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and has requested a loan of Php 15,000.  The loan will be helpful to expand her business so it can become sustainable in the future.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
La señora Celestina G. V., tiene 47 años de edad vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte, es madre de tres hijos, todos son casados y le apoyan económicamente, así también recibe un apoyo de su esposo el cual es albañil. Ella se dedica a la venta ambulante de Cd y DVD.

Ella solicito un préstamo para el entechado del porche de su casa y embaldosarlo, de esta manera  poco a poco irá dándole forma a su humilde morada, asegurándola así también de los delincuentes que amenazan con el robo de su mercadería, debido a  que ella vive en una zona en donde los índices de delincuencia son altos, espera que se le apoye para idealizar este sueño y poder de esta manera mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Celestina Gonzáles V. is 47 years old, lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood, and has three children, all of whom are married and support her financially. Her husband, who works as a bricklayer, also helps her out. She sells CDs and DVDs door to door. She has requested a loan in order to finish the roof of, and tile her home's porch in order to give shape to her humble abode. This also ensures her safety, as there are many who threaten to steal her merchandise. She lives in a high-crime area and she hopes to receive the support she needs to realize her dreams and improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a roof for and tiling a room in her home

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora S. T., tiene la edad de 63 años, está casada, y vive con el esposo  y un nieto. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ropa para venderla. Desea tener un inventario más variado de prendas de vestir, para ampliar su negocio. Hace aproximadamente 2 años que empezó este negocio viendo la necesidad de aportar a la economía de su hogar. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Flora S. T. is 63, is married, and lives with her husband and one grandson. She wants this credit to buy clothing to sell. She hopes to have a more varied inventory of clothing so she can expand her business. She started this business approximately 2 years ago because she saw it necessary to support her home economically. This isn't the first time that she has had a loan with FUDECOSUR, and she is very happy with the terms they have always offered her. She hopes to offer her family a better quality of life and economic stability in the future and to keep growing as a person and a businesswoman. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en: Eduardo R. Sr. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 49 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Eduardo owns and operates a business providing motorela (a motorcycle encased in a carriage with two rows of seats facing each other) services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Eduardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Eduardo is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his 2nd from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Yèyinou

texts.fr: Née en 1969 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, H. Yèyinou vit depuis 35 ans à Agbato, un quartier de Cotonou. Yèyinou est mariée à HOUNSA Grégoire avec qui elle a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Yèyinou n’a plus aucun enfant à sa charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Yèyinou et son mari partagent ensemble les dépenses familiales. Pour apporter sa part contributive, Yèyinou exerce comme activité, la vente de crevettes fumées. Yèyinou s’approvisionne sur le lac de Agbato. Yèyinou effectue la vente de ses produits à son domicile et également à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Cela fait déjà 20 ans que Yèyinou mène cette activité, mais elle n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Yèyinou est une cliente fidèle de ALIDé car elle a déjà obtenu cinq crédits et ces crédits on tous été bien remboursés. Dans le souci constant de renforcer son activité, Yèyinou souhaite bénéficier d’un sixième prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1969 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Ms. H. Yèyinou has been living for 35 years in Agbato, a district of Cotonou.  She is married to Mr. HOUNSA Grégoire, with whom she has three children, who all attended school.  She no longer has any children to support. The couple live together with their children.  Together, she and her husband share in covering household expenses.  As for her share, Yèyinou has a business selling smoked shrimp.  She gets her supplies from Agbato Lake.  She sells her goods out of her home and also at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She has been in this business for twenty years already, but she has never attended school.  Yèyinou is a loyal ALIDé client because she has already had five loans, which have all been repaid.  Constantly concerned about enhancing her business, she would like to obtain a sixth loan from ALIDé. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fresh shrimp

loans.name: Asman's Group

texts.en:
Asman lives in a city named Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. Asman owns a two room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past three years.  

Asman is an uneducated lady, but she doesn’t want to pass along the same destiny to her kids. For this reason she has encouraged her kids to concentrate on their studies. She has three sons. Her elder son is 18 years old and he started doing work after completing the 10th standard. The others are enrolled in school and are getting an education. 

Her husband's name is M. J.. He works as a driver in a company and earns a meager income. That income doesn’t allow him to fulfill the needs of his family. With mutual discussion with the family, they have decided to start a grocery shop at their house. They have chosen this business because the other grocery shops are located in the main markets and there’s no grocery shop in the community. Therefore, Asman is applying for a loan to buy groceries, such as rice, flour, and cooking oil, to start a grocery shop.

loans.use: Purchase groceries to start a grocery shop.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en: Clement I. is a talented young man. He is 28 years old, single and without children. I. produces and sells wooden combs to plait hair. He is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more materials to boost his wooden comb production. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to boost his wooden comb production

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 49-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and four children. One of her children and her husband also work to support the household. Her husband works as a blacksmith. 

She has been working in the sewing industry for almost 20 years. She has run her sewing business from her home since 1991. She lives in an area that is famous for its hand-made clothes and jewelry. She uses the profits from her business to support her family, including paying for her children’s school fees.

She is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. She plans to use the loan to buy material for her business. 

Women still make up a small percentage of the labor market in Lebanon. A 2008 report by the International Finance Corporation notes that women make up about 29 percent of the country’s labor force. Ameen s.a.l. offers additional incentives to loan officers for offering microloans to prospective clients as well for recruiting female clients.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To buy material for her sewing business

loans.name: Gaviotas Blancas Group

texts.es:
Esta foto fue tomada en el negocio de la Sra. Oliva P. C., un integrante del grupo Gaviotas Blancas, que está ubicado en la comunidad de Ajalpan en el Estado de Puebla en México.  En la foto se puede apreciar su tipo de negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado para dama que inició hace 10 años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra ropa y calzado. Sus clientas dicen que en su negocio pueden encontrar modelos muy bonitos y económicos con pagos accesibles. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente con la seguridad de poder incrementar sus ventas.  Tiene 46 años, estudió hasta el quinto año de primaria, es soltera y tiene en total 3 hijos (1 mujer y  2 varones) de los cuales solo uno depende económicamente de ella ya que los otros 2 ya cuentan con la mayoría de edad.  Quiere este crédito para comprar mayor mercancía y poder incluir en su negocio la venta de accesorios para dama.   También espera que con sus ganancias pueda solventar las necesidades económicas que requiere ella y su hijo así como también poder comprar un mueble donde pueda exhibir mejor su mercancía

María del Rocío García B. es la presidente del grupo. Tiene 38 años, es licenciada en pedagogía, casada y tiene un hijo.  Ella se dedica en sus tiempos libre a la venta de cosméticos.  Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cosméticos y perfumes. 

El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicita  un crédito a CrediComún.  Los otros integrantes son:

Margarita C. L.				Vta. De materiales para construcción
María Robertina C. C.			Vta. De tacos.
Modesta Yolanda P. O.		Vta. De medicamentos.  
María del Carmen B. D.			Vta. De calzado.
Cristina B. F.				Vta. De pan y fruta de temporada.
Laura Ramón González				Vta. De canastas.
Sonia Esther C. Gómez			Vta. De ropa.
Juana Inés C. Sánchez			Vta. De tortillas.
Silvia Rodríguez Márquez			Vta. De comida
Emilia Ramón González				Vta. De canastas
texts.en:
This picture was taken in Ms. Olivia P. C.'s shop. She is one of the members of the Grupo Gaviotas Blancas (White Seagulls Group), located in the municipality of Ajalpan, in the Mexican State of Puebla. In the picture it is possible to see what her business activity is: she sells women clothes and shoes, a business she started 10 years ago. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy clothes and shoes. According to her customers, in her shop one can find cheap and very nice models at affordable prices. In requesting this loan she is sure she will be able to increase her income. She is 46 years old, she completed the first five years of primary school, she is single and has three children (1n daughter and 2 sons): only one of them is economically dependent on her, as the other two have already come of age. She is requesting this loan to buy more products and to succeed in expand her business by selling women accessories as well. She also wishes to earn enough money to be able to pay for her son's economic necessities as well as her own, and to be able to buy a counter to better display her products. María del Rocío García B. is the president of the group. She is a 38 year-old woman with a Pedagogy degree, she is married and has one child. She sells cosmetics in her free time, and she is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics and perfumes. The group is composed of 12 members, and this is the first time they are requesting a loan to CrediComún. These are the other members: Margarita C. L.: selling of building materials. María Robertina C. C.: selling of tacos (meat and cheese sandwiches). Modesta Yolanda P. O.: selling of MEDICAMENTOS. María del Carmen B. D.: selling of shoes. Cristina B. F.: selling of bread and season fruit. Laura Ramón González: selling of baskets. Sonia Esther C. Gómez: clothes sales. Juana Inés C. Sánchez: selling of tortillas (a type of bread). Silvia Rodríguez Márquez: selling of meals. Emilia Ramón González: selling of baskets.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products to sell in the shop.

loans.name: Mirahror

texts.en: Mirahror A. is 44 years old. He is married with three children. Five years ago, Mirahror, with his mechanic skills, started to do work for his neighbors and acquaintances. He learned this skill at another shop, until he had the opportunity to begin his own business. With faith and enthusiasm, his auto-mechanic business started to grow little by little. Villagers who use machines for their business always come to have their machines repaired by him. Now, Mirahror is finding that the tools he has are not enough to work at his job with full speed. For this reason, he is seeking a loan of 7,500 Somoni. This loan will be use to buy tools and materials used to repair autos. With your help, Mirahror will be able to provide for his children's education and for the well-being of his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing tools and materials used to repair cars

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia B. is from the village of  Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old and married with two adult children. To make a living, Amalia runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products. Amalia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Amalia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amalia is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Amalia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Naseem akhtar is a citizen of a city called Borewala in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines.
  
Naseem is a very supportive and caring lady. She manages her household chores efficiently and takes care of her family.  She is a good-natured woman who likes to take care of people and loves to help those in need. Her group members appreciate this quality in her.
  
Her husband's name is A. A., and he is involved in a garment-selling business. He sells children's and men's garments in different areas of the community and to clothing shops as well. He purchases the garments from the city Lahore (famous for its new designs and variety). His clothing collection attracts more customers in his community. Now, by the grace of God, he has started getting good orders from the clothing shops and to fulfill the orders on time he needs to buy garments in bulk. 

Therefore, Naseem has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount he will buy garments in bulk and fulfill the orders from his customers and earn a good income.

loans.use: Purchase garments for fulfilling orders

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es: Honorata, de 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene seis hijos en su haber. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva tropical peruana, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tiene su propia casa. A Honorata siempre le ha gustado la idea de ser jefa de su propio negocio, desde luego que lo consiguió, pero recuerda que no todo fue fácil en un inicio. Actualmente vende cacao de manera considerable, desde luego que está muy contenta con la labor que viene realizando, además cuenta con más clientes que antes. Por lo general trabaja sola, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposo, pero en tiempos de cultivo y cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones con la finalidad de que lo puedan agilizar en un tiempo corto. Su punto de venta lo realiza normalmente en los centros de acopio de su localidad y sus planes a futuro es comprar nuevos terrenos de cultivo con el propósito de aumentar su productividad y de esa forma mejore la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además asevera que le brinda muchas ventajas al pertenecer a su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abonos para que lo dé un mantenimiento exhaustivo a sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Honorata is 44 years old, married, and has six children. They live together in their own home in the town of Santa Rosa, which is located in the beautiful tropical jungles of Peru. Honorata has always liked the idea of being the boss of her own business. However, everything was not easy at the beginning. She currently sells a significant amount of cacao and is very happy with the work that is being done. Honorata has many more customers than she did before. She usually works alone, but occasionally she will receive help from her husband. During the planting and harvesting seasons, she hires laborers so that all the work gets finished in a short amount of time. She normally sells her crops at the local collection centers. Her future plans include buying additional farmland so that she can increase her productivity and improve the quality of life for her family.

This is her seventh loan with MFP. Honorata promises to continue submitting her payments on time. She says she receives many benefits as a result of being a member of her Communal Bank. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase supplies and compost so that her cacao crops receive ongoing maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies & compost

loans.name: Nul

texts.en: Nul E., 36, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. E. sells animal food for an income of $20 US per day. Her husband is a famer, earning an income of $5 per day. E. is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a sewing machine to start a new business at the market. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her current business of selling animal food.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. E. appears in the photograph with her daughter.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is 23 years old and single. He practices dairy farming to earn a living. He sells milk to the Fresha Company (a well-known milk processing plant in Kenya). He also runs a retail shop to boost his income. He is a registered member of Faulu Kenya in the Gathaithi group. With his first loan from Faulu Kenya, he bought a dairy cow. He is now requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy another cow. He hopes to have more cows and become a famous dairy farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Safarmo

texts.ru: Ахмедова Сафармо проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст, 42 года. Замужем, имеет одного ребенка. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Имеет торговую точку, где продает конфеты и шоколад. В этом ей помогает муж. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en:
Safarmo A. lives in Qurgan-Tube. She is 42 years old, married, and has one child. She has a high school education. She has been trading in the market for more than five years. She has a shop where she sells candy and chocolate. Her husband helps her. She is taking out a loan to increase the variety of goods she sells.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing the variety of goods sold

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Destino de Crédito: Compra de una computadora para estudios de Diseño Grafico.
Mary  reside en vivienda propia en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, esta separada y tiene un hijo que estudia Diseño Grafico; Mary es profesora en una Unidad Educativa de esta ciudad, con los ingresos que obtienen mantienen a su familia.

El crédito que saco anteriormente fue para la refacción de pisos en su vivienda, es cliente de Impro con un historial de 5 créditos.  El préstamo que ahora solicita es para la compra de una computadora para su hijo, pues como el muchacho estudia Diseño gráfico, es muy importante que tenga una computadora donde pueda usar los programas relacionados a su profesión. Mary se encuentra satisfecha con los créditos que le otorgamos y esta vez el crédito será procesado a través de Kiva.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito se considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Loan use: To buy a computer for Graphic Design studies.  Mary lives in her own house in the Villa Nuevo Potosí area, on the west side of the city of La Paz.  She is separated and has one son who is studying Graphic Design.  Mary is a teacher at a school in this city, and she supports her family with her salary.

The last loan that she received was to refurbish the floors in her house.  She is a client of Impro and has received 5 loans in the past.  The current loan that she is requesting is to buy a computer for her son. Since he is studying Graphic Design, it’s very important that he have a computer where he can use programs related to his profession.  Mary is happy with the loans given her and this time the loan will be processed through Kiva.

By her credit history she qualifies to receive a new loan since she is considered a good client.

loans.use: To buy a computer for her son's studies in Graphic Design

loans.name: Ama Gladys

texts.en:
Ama Gladys G. W. is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Ama processes 'gari' for sale at Abura. She will use the loan to purchase large quantities of cassava to process for resale. Ama assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to build a house.

'Gari' is made from cassava. In this picture Ama is standing behind the machine used to grind the cassava.

loans.use: purchase large quantities of cassava to process for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose P. is from the village of Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years old. Rose is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she operates a direct selling business in the local community, selling cosmetics such as lotions and perfumes and also jewelry such as glasses and watches. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rose joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 49 años, es una madre de familia emprendedora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Después de realizar sus labores domesticas Sonia se dedica a la venta de sus productos de belleza, siendo estos productos ofrecidos a sus amigas y vecinas de su barrio, desde entonces, todas las tardes visita a sus clientes a ofrecer la mercadería que tiene, asimismo el pedido lo hacen por medio de catalogo. Siente que su trabajo es muy rentable, sobre todo en las campañas que realiza la empresa, ya que de pasar el monto de sus pedidos, es beneficiada con más productos de manera gratuita; de esa manera le permita tener ingresos adicionales.  Por ello, esta al pendiente de sus clientes, brindándoles una orientación apropiada de los productos que va utilizar. Con el tiempo, desea comprarse vitrinas y ampliar su negocio. Es su 11avo crédito con MFP y una vez más esta feliz por este aporte ya que así podrá desarrollar su negocio. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará más productos de belleza, para sí poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad para elegir.
texts.en:
Sonia is 49 years old.  She is an enterprising mother who lives in her own home with her husband and their 3 children.  After carrying out her housework, Sonia spends her time selling beauty products, offering these products to her friends and others in her neighborhood.  Every afternoon she visits her customers to offer the merchandise which she has.  Her customers make their orders through a catalog.  She feels that her work is very profitable, above all when it comes to the campaigns which the company runs because when she makes more than a certain number of orders she is rewarded with more products for free.  This allows her to make additional income.  For this reason, she is always attentive to her customers, providing them with appropriate guidance on the products which they are going to buy.  Over time, she would like to buy display cases and expand her business.  

This is Sonia's 11th loan with MFP and once more she is happy with the support since it will help her to develop her business.  She will use the loan to buy more beauty products so that she can offer her customers a better variety of products to choose from.

loans.use: To stock up with beauty products so that she has more variety to offer her customers

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita M. is from the village of Digkilaan, Iligan City. She is 56 years old, married, and has two adult children. To make a living, Anita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, instant noodles, and toothpaste in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Anita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Anita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products such as beverages and breads. This loan will be Anita's third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products such as beverages and breads

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo is fifty-two years old.  He lives along with his wife and their three children.  The family maintains a stable and a happy home.  They live in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura.  It is a semi-tropical region in which many small farmers own small fruit plantations or raise animals.

Arturo is a farmer.  He raises sheep and maintains two hectares of mango and lime fields.  He raises the sheep in corrals near his home.  He raises them for meat and other products and sells the animals in local markets when they reach the appropriate size and weight.  He harvests mangos and limes regularly from his fields, given the extended growing season in the region.  Between these two activities Arturo is able to maintain a relatively stable income and provide for his family.

The loan will be used to purchase additional balanced feed for his animals and make repairs to his corrals.  He hopes that this action will improve the health and production of his sheep, thus improving the profits of the business.  He dreams of having a larger herd and additional land to raise them on.  He hopes to be able to continue using his business to meet his family's needs and provide additional opportunities to his children.

loans.use: Purchase additional balanced feed for his animals and make repairs to his corrals

loans.name: Youba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Youba K. est âgé de 40 ans et vit dans une famille polygame avec ses quatre enfants et ses femmes dans la ville de Konobougou,  préfecture de BAROUELI, quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Monsieur Youba K.  fait de l’animation pendant les évènements sociaux et est très sollicité dans ce domaine. Youba, en plus de cette activité  fait également du commerce. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, il décida d’élargir son secteur avec la vente des appareils électroniques qu’il vend dans une boutique au bord du goudron à Konobougou surnommée « JAPAN ELECTRONIQUE » Il est à son deuxième prêt individuel, après  avoir  remboursé le premier prêt.
Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, des cartes mémoires pour téléphones portables et accessoires. 
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako à un prix abordable pour venir les revendre à une clientèle composée de toutes les catégories sociales de la ville.
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les dépenses de la famille et le reste investi dans les activités.
texts.en:
Monsieur Youba K. is 40 years old and he lives in a polygamous family with his four children and his wives in the town of Konobougou in the Barouéli prefecture in the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

He provides entertainment at social events and is in high demand in this area. In addition to this activity, he is also a trader.

In order to better satisfy his customers, he decided to broaden his sector by selling electronic devices in a shop called "Japan Electronique" beside the tarmac road in Konobougou. He is on his second individual loan, after having repaid the first loan.

Monsieur K. intends to use this loan to buy memory cards for cell phones and accessories.

He stocks up in Bamako at an affordable price and then resells to customers from of all social classes in the town.

He hopes to make an average monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA, which will be used for family expenses and the remainder invested in his business.

loans.use: To buy memory cards for cell phones and accessories

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita M. G. de 45 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador, en donde vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos de 15, 17 y 18 años de edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. Margarita posee una pupusería en su casa de habitación, en donde con el fin de poder brindarle ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, se dedica a la elaboración de pupusas, las cuales están hechas de masa de maíz o de arroz y así mismo son hechas de queso, frijoles y chicharrón, este platillo típico de este país, es el que mayor demanda posee, por lo que es un negocio bastante estable razón por la que Margarita desea invertir en el. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de pupusas, de manera que pueda atender a más clientes, lo que le permita contar con más ganancias.
texts.en:
Margarita Mendez Garcia is 45 years old and she lives in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband and their three children, aged 15, 17, and 18, and they are all in school. Margarita sells pupusas from her home with the goal of contributing with her husband towards the household expenses. 

She makes pupusas, traditionally made from corn dough or rice, containing cheese, beans, and pork. This is a traditional recipe of the country and it is the product that is in most demand.  It is a relatively stable business and it is the reason why Margarita wants to invest in it. She requests a loan to purchase a larger quantity of pupusas, and to be able to attend to more clients and so to improve her earnings.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make pupusas.

loans.name: Rahab Namunyak

texts.en:
Rahab Namunyak T., a 22-year-old married mother of four children, all in school, has been a hawker in Narok town for the last two years. She learned about KADET from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her first loan, with which she is planning to buy more stock, and hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her business.

An assiduous woman who is determined to achieve her goals, Rahab's dream is to educate her children to the university level and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of foodstuffs

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La Sra. Teodora M. de 54 años, es soltera, con 2 hijos.
Doña Teodora se dedica a este rubro hace más de 12 años, aproximadamente desde el año 1.998; comenzó con el capital que su hija le envió de España, comprando perfumes y habilitando una despensa, en la actualidad ya tiene muchas clientas por que vende a cuotas, una clientela ya formada.
Ella utilizaría este crédito para comprar más mercaderías(perfumes y comestibles para su despensa).
texts.en:
Teodora M., 54 years old, is single with two children.

Teodora has had her business for more than 12 years, since about 1998. She started with some money her daughter sent her from Spain, buying perfume and starting up a grocery store. Now she already has many customers because she sells on credit; she has a group of customers.

She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise (perfumes and food for her grocery store).

loans.use: Purchase perfume and food

loans.name: Mrs. Poeurk Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people who make up a village bank loan have selected Mrs. Poeurk to become the village bank leader. They will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Poeurk was born in 1972. She is the mother of four children, three of whom are employed in garment factories, while the youngest one is 11 years old.
 
She is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice. She sells some part of the rice and the other part of the rice she keeps to supports her famiL.. Her husband, Mr. Kan, is a battery seller. 

Since her husband’s business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So to achieve this purpose, Mrs. Poeurk is applying for a loan to buy more batteries to resell.

loans.use: To buy more batteries for resale

loans.name: 52 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Duyên N. Thị (82) is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Duyên is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 52 Quảng Hưng (18.02.52 Quảng Hưng).

Duyên is married and has 2 school-aged children. She owns and operates a food stall, selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. Duyên has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,100,000 VND a month from it.

In 2009, Duyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Duyên has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase fishes, shrimps...to resell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Duyên from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  N. Thị Hiền (84) is a 49-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  H. Thị Hợp (85) is a 48-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Duyên N. Thị (82) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Duyên là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 52 Quảng Hưng (18.02.52 Quảng Hưng).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hải sản như cá và tôm trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Duyên thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Duyên kiếm được khoảng 2,100,000 VND.  Vào 2009, Duyên đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Duyên đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Hiền (84) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  H. Thị Hợp (85) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase fish and shrip to sell.

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en:
Rocelyn is 39 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Rocelyn is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rocelyn has been in this business for 15 years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to do some house improvements.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a married woman with two children, all of whom are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past year, she has been operating a food stall business, selling fish from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanamkasi faces a major challenge in seasonality. During the rainy season, the availability of customers visiting her food stall is lower compared to the dry hot season when the demand is higher. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she is requesting, Mwanamkasi wants to purchase an ice cooler box to store fish to sell, 20 litres of cooking oil, and roofing materials (makuti) to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase an ice box to store fish, cooking oil, and roofing materials

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is the mother of four children who are between the ages of 5 and 15 years old. She is 44 years old. She owns a shop in which she sells different kinds of foodstuffs such as maize flour, rice, beans, etc. She runs the shop together with her husband. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs such as flour, rice, beans, etc., in order to make more profits. She has done this business for the past 10 years and it has enabled her to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs such as flour, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en:
Mr.Uuganbayar is 31 years-old and lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife looks after the kids at the moment. They live in their family house in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar.

Uuganbayar has been working for a power grid servicing company as an electrician for six years. He is a hardworking and self motivated person. Recently, he has been appointed as a team leader and had a pay raise. 

Two years ago, Uuganbayar built a family house but some parts of the house have not been completed yet due to a lack of funds. Now he wants to complete the unfinished parts of the house by taking a loan. The pay raise has increased his repayment capability and gives him a chance to complete his mission. The loan will be used to buy the necessary building materials and to complete the building project which he started two years ago.

loans.use: to buy building materials necessary to complete the family house project which he started two years ago.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy goats & sheep for resale.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 48-year-old married woman with three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Her husband works as a local administrator. To earn more money to support her family, in 2009 she started a grocery store that occupies the front of her house. Her store sells a small variety of goods. She intends to take a loan to buy a larger variety of different goods to stock her store and better meet her customers' needs.

She hopes that in the future she can save more money to improve her family's living conditions and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy stock for her store

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en:
Gurgen is 39 years old; he lives in Ddmashen village, Sevan area, with his mother, his wife and two under-age sons. 

Over 15 years Gurgen has engaged in farming: animal breeding and land cultivation. On his farm he rears cows, sheep and chickens. Gurgen’s wife and mother, who is already a pensioner, help him in his hard occupation and thus they are able to support their family. 

Gurgen wants to develop his farm, which will allow him to increase his family’s income in future. For his farm development, Gurgen is asking for a 1.000.000 AMD loan, which he is going to spend on10 sheep and fodder. This is his second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beer and drinks for sale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 29 years old and lives in the city of Otavalo in northern Ecuador. She is married and lives with her husband and their children. Her children are aged nine and four. 

Rosa is a serious person. She is also hard-working and responsible. In her business, she makes children’s pajamas. She began her own business three years ago with the intention of working to support her children while being able to keep them by her side as she worked. This is Rosa’s first loan and she will use it to invest in cloth for her business. She hopes that the loan will help her to economically provide for the well-being of her children. In the future, Rosa wants to expand her business and employ others.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to make children's pajamas.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
