Myrna, 54, lives in Zamora, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Myrna has a business selling snacks such as puto, bibingca, suman, hotcake, etc. She earns about 3,200 PHP each month doing this type of work. Myrna has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Myrna has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Myrna would like to continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been operating his tailoring shop for the last 20 years in Emali town. He is 62 years old and married, and he has five children.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. 

He has been loaned KES 50,000. He intends to use the loan to buy cloth materials and a sewing machine.

In the future, John hopes his business will prosper and grow, so as to uplift the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy cloth materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Adalgiza

texts.es: Adalgiza de 48 años vive en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 16 y 18 años respectivamente.  Adalgiza tiene desde  hace 10 años un negocio de vender mercancía variada, como cosméticos y ropa a través de revistas especializadas, con la cual promueve su venta y también comercializa productos de dulcería.   Su iniciativa surgió para apoyar la gestión de su hogar que hasta ese momento se encontraba a cargo de su esposo. Adalgiza inicialmente tuvo la experiencia de vender jugos y bolis (Congelados a base de frutas naturales), preparado por ella misma, pero gradualmente fue agregando a su mercado natural, mercancía variada, dulces y ahora hasta servicio de telecomunicaciones, actividad en la cual su hijo la apoya. Su sueño es ver convertidos a sus hijos en profesionales exitosos y esta es el impulso con el cual diariamente se levanta a trabajar. Con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, comprará cosméticos y dulces, y otras mercancías sobre pedidos, que han hecho sus clientes. Su mayor desafío es lograr capital de trabajo para comprar de contado y en mayor volumen y esto es justamente lo que resolverá con su financiamiento mediante la línea de Kiva. Sus clientes son los niños de los hogares infantiles, las madres comunitarias, vecinas y referidos que sus clientes envían constantemente.
texts.en:
Adalgiza, 48, lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias with her husband and two children who are 16 and 18 years old respectively.  Adalgiza has been selling assorted merchandise like cosmetics and clothing via catalogue sales for the last ten years; she also sells candy products.  

She was encouraged to start this in order to help with household expenses which up to then were entirely in her husband’s hands.  Adalgiza initially had the experience of selling juice and "bolis" (frozen fruit treats) that she, herself, made but gradually started adding to her natural market assorted merchandise, candy and now even telephone services, an activity her son helps her with.  Her dream is to see her children become accomplished professionals and this is what motivates her to get up every day and go to work.  

She will use her Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy cosmetics and candy and other merchandise to order that her customers have placed with her.  Her greatest challenge is having working capital to buy everything for cash and in large amounts and this is precisely what the Kiva loan will make possible for her.  Her customers are the children from day care centers, mothers in the community, neighbors and people her customers constantly refer to her.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, candy and other merchandise to order.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia is 50 years old and lives in Jacob Town.  She is married to a businessman with whom she has four children aged 14 to 31, all of whom are currently in school. For ten years she has been operating “Mimi’s” restaurant and selling used clothes right outside of her restaurant.  She makes a lot of profits and has more customers than she used to. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, pepper, some spices, and a carton of used clothes for her business.  She plans to build a house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, pepper, some spices, and a carton of used clothes for her business

loans.name: Claudia Simona

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos, es una persona luchadora y junto a su familia reside en la comunidad de Poncaya en el municipio de Catacamas.

Claudia se dedica a la compra-venta de ganado. Ella empezo a dedicarse a esta actividad cuando su esposo por dificultades economicas tuvo que salir del pais y se fue a buscar el sueño americano. Como mujer se le hace un tanto dificil el manejo del ganado pero aun asi no se deja vencer por las adversidades. Claudia se levanta todos los dias muy temprano por las mañanas para iniciar las actividades del cuidado del ganado y una vez que las vacas alcanzan un peso adecuado, las vende a comerciantes. 

Claudia necesita el prestamo para comprar vacas lecheras, ya que es temporada de lluvia y quiere aprovechar para vender leche y luego vender las vacas para destazo.

Su meta es sacar adelante su negocio para seguir dandole el estudio a sus dos hijas mayores y ahorrar un poco para cuando sus otros dos hijos crezcan y vayan a la escuela. Claudia tiene tres ciclos en FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente y espera hacerlo tambien con este prestamo.
texts.en:
Claudia is 32 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hardworking woman, and she lives with her family in the town of Poncaya, in the municipality of Catacamas. 

Claudia’s work is buying and selling cattle. She began this work when her spouse, due to financial hardship, had to leave the country and left to find the American dream. As a woman she finds livestock management a little difficult, but she is not one to give in to adversity. Claudia gets up early in the morning each day to begin her chores to care for the cattle, and as soon as they reach a healthy weight, she sells them to retailers. 

Claudia needs the loan to buy dairy cows because it’s the rainy season and she wants to use the milk and then sell the cows to be butchered. 

Her goal is to be successful in her business in order to continue sending her two older daughters to school and to save a little for when her other children grow up and go to school. Claudia has had three loan cycles with FAMA. She has been prompt in her repayments on time and hopes to do the same with this loan.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées dans de familles monogames avec en moyenne 45 ans et 3 enfants par femme. Elles habitent dans le camp militaire de Banankoroni Village dans la région de Ségou. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage,de parenté et font le petit commerce de céréales, grains d’arachide, poissons frais et fumé. 
Dans le but de faire des achats au comptant les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 10ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Fatoumata (2ème femme assise sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite)  a une grande réputation dans la vente du poisson frais de gros calibre dans le camp et même dans le village  de Banankoro. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 166 kg de poisson frais. Elle se ravitaille en poisson au bord du fleuve Niger dans le village avec les pêcheurs. La vente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile et en ambulant dans le village et dans le camp militaire à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Madame Fatoumata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les frais scolaires des enfants. Madame Fatoumata tout comme les autres membres du groupe Benkadi a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso. 
NB: Rouki  ne figure pas dans la photo pour cause de consultation à l’hôpital.
texts.en:
The six women of Benkadi Group are all married and live in monogamous families. They average 45 years of age and three children. They live in Banankoroni Village, a military camp in Ségou Region.

They got acquainted through bonds of neighborhood and kinship. They sell cereals, peanuts, fresh and smoked fish. In order to be able to buy supplies for cash, the members of the group joined Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso. They are now seeking their tenth solidarity loan (group loan). 

Mrs. Fatoumata (second woman from the left in the photograph) is a very much renowned reseller of big fresh fish, both inside the camp and in the village of Banankoro.

She intends to use her loan to buy 166 kg of fresh fish. She gets her fish supplies from fishermen in villages along the banks of Niger River. She sells for cash and on credit, at her home and as a traveling saleswoman, in the village and in the military camp, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

With this loan, Mrs. Fatoumata hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 45'000 (ca US$ 90). She will reinvest part of it in her business, and use the remainder to pay her children's school expenses.

Mrs. Fatoumata, along with the other members of the group, wants to bolster her business thanks to her collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.

Note: Mrs. Rouki does not appear in the photograph because she had an appointment at the hospital.

loans.use: to buy 166 kg of fresh fish

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en:
Alaa' is a 24-year-old young woman. She is married with one son. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Alaa' wants to improve her house conditions to live with her family in better living conditions by purchasing new home furniture such as living room seats, dining room furniture, etc., but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for the furniture, so she needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Alaa' gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase new home furniture and provide her family better home living conditions. 

Alaa' is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase home furniture to improve her family life conditions.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married mother with six children.  One is enrolled in school and the others are grown up.  She and her husband are also farmers.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Dama has operated a cereal selling business for the past 15 years.  Her clients are local residents.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality; during the dry seasons there is no harvest.  She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase more cereal for resale.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more cereal for resale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 46 years old and lives in Paynesville South, Liberia. She is a widow and has four children, ages 14 to 29. They are in school and live at home. For the past twenty years she has been selling rice and bread.

Martha is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and bread for her business. She says her main challenge is the location of her business. She started her business with a little money she received from her daughter, and she learned this business from her mother. She really likes her business because it helps her to support her children. She hopes to become an international businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and bread for her business.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is a 23-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and five siblings. One of them is still studying at university while all the family collaborate together to be able to cover their needs.

Asmaa has owned a scarves shop since 2010 and trying always to follow trendy and fashionable items. Today, she’s requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase her inventory of new scarves for the coming holidays. She notes that this will raise her sales to gain superior revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own scarves factory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of new scarves .

loans.name: Bongoline A Group

texts.en:
Francis is the facilitator of the Bongoline A group. Francis and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Francis takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to get One Acre Fund's low prices, to ensure food security for his family, and, later, to educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Francis had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Francis was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Francis and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Francis will educate his children and pay back his loans. 

In 2012, the members of Bongoline A group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land. 

In the photograph above, Francis is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase the stock in her clothing retail business

loans.name: Arok

texts.en: Arok, 45 years old, is married and has four children, three of them in school. She has operated a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for two years. Arok is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has three children, and has been doing this work for 22 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming is 'Being able to get food and income from agriculture to meet family needs'. Her biggest challenge is 'poor roads during the rainy season makes it costly to transport products to the market, and the fluctuation of weather patterns makes agribusiness unpredictable.' Animals on the farm have not been given names.

Rose was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, 'Chose Juhudi Kilimo following the success of another group member in the Juhudi Kilimo group.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session 'Learned how I could access financial services to acquire agricultural asset to boost family income.'

Her highest monthly expense is business related. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Rose replied 'Will purchase water tank and start a poultry project.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Rose owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and a water tank.

loans.name: Gilma

texts.en:
Grayzciel Joy is 17 years old and is sixth of eight children in the family. Her mother Gilma is a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and supports the family through her boarding house rental business in the Philippines.

Grayzciel Joy is studying Midwifery and is currently in the first year of this two year course.

Gilma is borrowing PHP 8,000 to pay for tuition fees of the school year 2014-2015/1st semester.

When she graduates, Grayzciel Joy plans to help her family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Beathe

texts.en:
Beathe aged 38 years. She is married with 4 children aged between 7 and 15 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 8 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Liberathe

texts.en:
Liberathe aged 32 years. She is married with 4 children aged between 2 and 9 years. 2 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 8 years. While her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers of maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a medical insurance and improve her family welfare. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers of maize.

loans.name: Peluce

texts.en: Peluce aged is a hardworking old married woman with two children living in Kasese,Uganda. She operates a retail shop and she got her start up capital after selling her cassava garden.Like most traders she is challenged by price fluctuation and inadequate capital while her dreams are to own a wholesale shop and open new outlets in nearby trading centers.Her personal goal is to ensure that her children attain degrees as minimum qualification.Peluce is in need of a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her hair salon business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.en:
Maria Candelaria lives in Escobedo, Nuevo Leon. She is married with 3 children who are 15, 17 & 19 years old. Her husband works in the railway industry for about 18 years, but the low pay that he receives is not enough to cover all the basic necessities for the family. Out of necessity, Maria started her own business by selling used clothes 3 years ago, then she began selling soft drinks/fruit juices out of her own house, but now she is selling at the local markets, where she has most of her clients. Her loyal commitment towards her husband and the love for her children motivate her to keep going strong every day.

Maria wants for her business to keep growing successfully but to do that she needs a loan of $375 USD to buy more merchandise to fulfill her clients’ needs. She has agreed to repay this amount over a period of 4-8 months. With your help, she will be able to grow her business and to better proviD. for her family. She thanks you for your support and generosity!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva volunteer.

En L. localidad D. Escobedo, Nuevo León es donD. vive Maria Candelaria, elL. es casada y tiene tres hijos, D. 15, 17 y 19 años D. edad, su esposo es ferrocarrilero desD. hace 18 años, pero el bajo salario que recibe es insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades D. su familia, ante esta necesidad, Maria inició su negocio con L. venta D. ropa usada desD. hace tres años, después incorporó L. venta D. jugos D. naranja, empezó en su propio domicilio pero ahora ya se instaL. en los mercados, donD. tiene un mayor número D. clientes. El fiel compromiso con su esposo y el amor hacia sus hijos L. han motivado a esforzase cada día.

Maria quiere que su negocio pueda desarrollarse exitosamente y para esto necesita un préstamo D. $375 dólares que empleará en L. compra D. mercancía para poder cubrir L. demanda D. sus clientes, elL. se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un plazo D. 4 a 8 meses. Con tu ayuda elL. podrá hacer crecer su negocio y salir adelante con su familia, por tu generosidad y apoyo, muchas gracias.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng K. is 41 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their five children. She works selling bananas and farming the family's land, and can earn about $3/day. Her husband helps with the farming, but they need a better way to water their crops. This loan will be used to purchase a waterpump to increase the yield from their land. In the future, she hopes her husband can handle the farming so she can open a clothing shop at the nearby open air market.

loans.use: Heng would like to purchase a water pump for her farm.

loans.name: Kamar

texts.en: I was born in Multan, a mid-sized city but moved to Vehari, a small town after my marriage. I am a mother of six, three sons and three daughters. Two of my daughters are married. Last year, one of my sons started a butcher shop with the help of his father. Now, my son wants to buy some tools and related equipment for his shop, for which he is asking for a loan of $175.  I think he can do well in this business because his elder brother is already running a butcher shop and has been assisting him in conducting his business successfully.

loans.use: need to buy tools used in butcher shop

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Sra. Alicia belongs to the Sol Naciente ("Rising Sun") community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ucayali. She is 53 years old and the mother of 2 children. Her husband is a construction worker but his income doesn't cover the family's expenses so Alicia decided, with her first loan from Manuela Ramos, to set up a small shop. She now earns a living from the shop. She gets up early to attend to household chores so that she can then tend the shop. Her children are now independent but they're very grateful for all their mother has done for them.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,300 (1,300 Peruvian soles or about US$433), to be repaid in 6 months, Alicia will expand the business and buy supplies of milk, rice, sugar, soft drinks, cooking oil and snacks.

Alicia is very happy to have healthy children and to have succeeded in ensuring that they both finished school. She's also happy knowing that she can help with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Alicia pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Naciente, Del Jr. Jhon F. Kenedy 990 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es Albañil, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza, es así que Alicia, con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos decide poner una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega, se levanta muy temprano para atender los quehaceres de la casa para luego atender la bodega, sus hijos ya se independizaron económicamente pero están muy agradecidos por todo lo que su madre hace por ellos.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,300 (US$ 433.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, ampliará el local del negocio y comprará 2 caja de leche, 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 5 cajas de gaseosa, 1 bidón de aceite, 3 paquetes de galletas.

Alicia está muy contenta de tener a sus hijos sanos y haber logrado que ellos terminen sus estudios, además se siente realizada por que puede apoyar económicamente en su hogar.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Beautiful and well-groomed, 25-year-old Zawadi is a good advertisement for her business. She runs a hair and beauty salon in the town of Kibaha, approximately 25 km outside of Dar es Salaam, where she cuts, curls, dyes, plaits, plucks, and files. Zawadi requires a loan of $450 to purchase additional stocks of hair and body products and continue beautifying her clients. She is married to husband Samatha and has one child, Sabrina, who is 4 years old.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation for women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase beauty and haircare products to use at her salon

loans.name: Nabweru South East 2036(Iii) Group

texts.en: Juliet is 34 years old and married with seven children. She has a small restaurant and bar. With the extra profits, she intends to educate her children and also buy a plot of land. Hadijah and Joyce sell fresh foods. Agnes and Aisha have retail shops amd want to purchase more stock with the loan. Note: This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a fridge and more catering equipment.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Mrs. Josefina is part of the Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, located on Jr. Comandante Suárez #318, Calleria distric, Ucayali department. She is 38 years old and is a mother of 2 children who are still dependents; she is separated from her husband. She decided to invest her first loan of $103 USD from Manuela Ramos in the buying and selling of fish. Currently she continues with the sale of fish and also owns a motokar. She gets up early to sell her fish and in the afternoons uses her time to do housework. She will use the loan of $688 USD to buy fish like tucunare, boquichico, marapate, paco, gamitana, doncella, jambina, etc. The loan will be paid back over the course of 5 months. Josefina is doing very well, and for that she is very grateful of all the support that the Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso and especially Manuela Ramos have provided her.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Josefina pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Suárez Nº 318, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años, es madre de 2 hijos que aún dependen de ella y es separada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decide invertir en la compra y venta de pescado. En la actualidad continúa con la venta de pescado, también cuenta con un motokar. Se levanta muy temprano para ir a vender su pescado y por las tardes se dedica a las labores de su hogar. Con el préstamo de S/ 2,000 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará pescados como tucunare, boquichico, maparate, paco, gamitana, doncella, jambina, etc. A Josefina le está yendo muy bien y es por ello que está muy agradecida al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso y sobre todo a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo que le brindan.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en: Gulsara is 48 years old. She is a divorced mother of 2 children. She has her own food shop and her main business is trading jewelry that she buys from suppliers in Turkey. She has two sellers, one at her shop, and one for jewelry. (In the photo she is the second from the right.) She gets good monthly profits from her business and her assets are increasing. She has a good turnover of her working capital and she wants to receive a loan to increase the volume of her goods.

loans.use: To expand her jewelry business

loans.name: Mwantumu's Umoja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.en:
Mwantumu is 35 years old and is a divorced woman with two children. Mwantumu owns a small food store, which she opened in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 2pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwanaally, who has a business in firewood sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en:
T. Mutabar lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan. It is the region where the agriculture and livestock are well-developed pursuits. Mrs. T. Mutabar has a large farm wth cows, bulls, and rams, and she also spins yarn and makes warm wool socks. She has 10 year of experience in this business.

Mrs. Mutabar is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 2100 STJ ($625 USD) for 8 months. She wants to purchase a spinning frame for making yarn.

loans.use: To purchase a spinning frame for making yarn.

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru:
Malika H. is a mother of two children. Her husband works in a company which manufactures wooden doors and windows. Malika has a specialized-secondary education and her specialization is a chief. She has been working as a chief in a prestigious restaurant called Piramida for the past ten years. She has a piece of land with an unfinished summer home and wants to get a loan to buy building materials, which has brought her to MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хайдарова Малика , мать двоих детей ,муж работает в фирме по производству деревянных окон и дверей.Сама Малика имеет средне- специальное образвание по специальности повара, теперь она уже 10 лет как работает поваром в престижном ресторане, под названием Пирамида.Она имеет дачный участок где стоит недостроенный дом , она взяв кредит хочет закупить строй материалы.Для этого обратилась в Микроинвест

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim, a 39-year-old father of three children, lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. Ibrahim owns a butcher shop and needs a loan of US$1,200 to increase and diversify his inventory. Indeed, at this time, Ibrahim’s shop cannot answer the demand of all clients in terms of the choices of meat he can offer.

This is the first time Ibrahim has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To increase and diversify inventory

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María has worked for two years as a domestic employee. One year ago, María started selling soft drinks and fruit lollipops in her house. She also makes tamales on the weekends, which she delivers to her neighbors and friends. Recently, she has started to sell clothing.

She has used the loans she has received to purchase the ingredients she needs to make tamales.

María would like to finish constructing her house and to open a store.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

María ha trabajado por dos años como empleada doméstica. Sin embargo, desde hace 1 año, María vende gaseosas y chupetes de frutas en su casa. Asimismo, ella también hace tamales los fines de semana, los cuales reparte a sus vecinos y amistades. Últimamente ha empezado a vender ropa por pedidos.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado en la compra de los ingredientes que necesita para hacer sus tamales.

A María le gustaría terminar de construir su casa y poner una tienda.

loans.use: To purchase the ingredients she needs to make tamales

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Jr. Coronel portillo Nº 285, distrito D. Callería, departamento D. Ucayali. Margarita tiene 73 años, es viuda y madre D. 4 hijos. El tiempo que tiene en Manuela Ramos es D. 5 años. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/ 300, deciD. invertir en la venta D. mercadería.

Hoy Margarita cuenta con el negocio D. alquiler D. habitaciones y mini departamentos, los cuales están construidas en su propia casa. Esta iniciativa es debido a que hay muchas personas que vienen D. otras ciudades y su casa queda en un lugar céntrico D. la ciudad. 
 
Con el préstamo D. S/. 3.000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra D. 4 espejos y algunos materiales D. construcción para remodelar y mejorar la infraestructura D. las habitaciones.
 
Margarita agradece muy cordialmente a la institución por la cual se siente muy contenta D. haber conocido a través del banquito a muchas señoras que ahora son sus amigas y con ellas disfruta momentos muy gratos, además tiene la oportunidad que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Señora Margarita is a member of the communal bank called "Women with Talent" located in the district of Calleria in the state of Ucayali. Margarita is 73 years old. She's a widow and has 4 children. She has been with Manuela Ramos for about 5 years. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to purchase merchandise. Currently, Margarita also rents rooms and small apartments which are located in her house. She began doing this because there are a lot of people that come from other cities and her house is located in a central location in the city. With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she wil purchase 4 mirrors and other construction materials to remodel the rooms. Margarita is very thankful to this lending institution because she has met other women which are now her riends and now they all have good times together. She also has the opportunity to improve and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase mirrors and construction materials

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys K. is a 40-year-old business woman and the mother of two children, who are currently in school. She trades in funeral clothes, lace materials and textile cloths. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to expand the sale of her stock. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. She wants to use the loan to purchase funeral clothes, lace materials, and textiles in bulk. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with quality educations. Gladys belongs to the community group called 'Mangor' (God is sweet) Trust Group. The group guarantees a loan through repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay – if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the repayment amount. Her picture was taken when she was at her meeting.

loans.use: Gladys would like to buy more supplies of cloth, textiles etc. for her business.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra T. est une revendeuse de poissons à Wome, un village situé au nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Mariée et mère de 3 enfants, Abra détient cette activité depuis 2 ans et espère relancer son commerce par ce crédit. Elle souhaite s’approvisionner auprès des gros fournisseurs afin de pouvoir augmenter sa marge commerciale. Cette opportunité lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Abra T. sells fish in Wome, a village situated northwest of Lomé, the Togolese capital. Married and the mother of 3 children, Abra has been involved in this activity for 2 years and hopes to reinvigorate her business with this loan. She hopes to buy from wholesalers so as to increase her profit margin. This opportunity will permit her to better support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase fish wholesale for re-sale

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel K. offers tailoring services in a stall he rents along Jubilee Street in Ibanda town. The business earns an average profit of 150,000 UGX per month. Keeping an eye on the market trends, Samuel forecasts an increased demand for clothes. To keep abreast of competition, he has requested a loan for purchasing more fabrics of various kinds so as to meet the rising demand and varying tastes and preferences of his customers.

This hard-working and caring father of 2 aspires to extend his business by opening up a fancy boutique in the capital that will offer a variety of designer wear imported from overseas. With a stable source of income, nothing can hinder Samuel from sending his children to the best schools in the country and offering his family a decent and modern home.

loans.use: purchasing more fabrics of various kinds

loans.name: Ngouv

texts.en: Ngouv S. is a 30 year old rice farmer. She owns and runs a plot of farmland for farming rice, growing rice and vegetables. She is a committed woman and works hard to earn money from her farming to support her two children, who are still young and need taking care of. Her husband,Mr.Min Mean, is 25 and farms with his wife. She is a good housewife and always saves money for building a house. S. requests a loan to add to her savings to purchase wood for building a house.

loans.use: to purchase wood for building a house

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier acaba de cumplir 30 años, lleva conviviendo con su pareja aproximadamente 12 años, su esposa y sus 3 hijos viven en la casa de su madre, vivienda que cuidan porque su madre vive en otra ciudad. Desde que migraron sus padres a otra ciudad se quedó ha cargo de todas las chacras, pero por falta de capital no puede sembrar como la hacia su padre, en grandes cantidades, pero tiene la ilusión de ir incrementando cada vez más sus cultivos de papa y arvejas.  Cultivar papa en esta temporada es muy bueno, pero como se ha elevado el precio de los fertilizantes ha sembrado solo 10 sacos de semilla, en esta próxima siembra sembrará 20 sacos, paralelo a acaba de sembrar una bolsa y media de arvejas, y ha guardado semilla para su otra chacra que va preparar, porque estos granos guardados mucho tiempo no producen bien. A Javier le agrada su actividad, la cual depende de las fechas en que siembran y cultivan para cosechar buenos frutos y sobre todo para que puedan tener buen precio. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, y ha juramentado en el cargo de secretario del banco comunal al que pertenece, comprometiendo a cumplir fielmente con todas las actividades, asimismo a incentivar que los demás socios efectúen los pagos en las fechas exactas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará 2 bolsas de semilla de arvejas y abono para la chacra de papa que tiene sembrada.
texts.en:
Javier just turned 30 years of age and has lived with his partner for about 12 years. His wife and his three children live in his mother's home, a home that they care for because his mother lives in another city. Since his parents moved to another city, he has been in charge of all of the farms, but, because of a lack of capital, he is not able to sow it like his father did, in large quantities. But, he has the hopes of increasing his potato and pea crops each time. It is very good to grow potatoes during this season, but, as the prices of fertilizers have increased, he has only sowed 10 sacks of seed. In this next season, he will sow 20 sacks. Aside from this, he just finished sowing one and a half bags of peas and he has kept seeds for his other farm that he is going to prepare because these grains do not produce well when kept for a long time. Javier enjoys his work which depends on the times when he sows and grows to harvest good products and, above all, to be able to have a good price. This is his fourth loan with MFP and he as been sworn in as the secretary of the community bank to which he belongs, committing to faithfully complete all of his activities and, at the same time, to motivate the other members to make their payments on time. With the money he is requesting, he will buy 2 bags of pea seeds and fertilizer for his father's farm that he has sown.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de semillas y abono

loans.name: Soli

texts.en:
Soli S., 56, is married with 8 children. She has 3 years of experience in the pig business. She sells to the public one day per week. She is requesting a loan to purchase a fence for her pig farm.

Soli has one previous loans with Kiva partner SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Soli’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase a fence for her pig farm.

loans.name: Nasim

texts.en:
H. Nasim is 47 years old. He is married and has two children. Nasim's goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. His dream is that God continues to provide him with more life to get ahead and to fulfill his goals. He is a taxi driver who drives the streets of Khujand city in search of customers. He has owned his business for four years. Nasim’s car needs a thorough repair, and he wants to borrow $600 USD for the term of 12 months. The financing will go towards general repairs of his vehicle. He thanks Kiva and all lenders who make this help possible.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, Tajikistan is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve their agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have access to sufficient capital to fund viable businesses. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: Eseta F. is 53 years old and is married with 7 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the Taro plantation business. Eseta sells to the school, village people and general public 5 days a week. She will use her loan to pay for her children’s school fees and also buy timber and cement for her house renovation. She has requested 1 loan previously from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 70 WST.  SPBD loans are Eseta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Pay for children’s school fees and purchase timber and cement for house renovation

loans.name: Olver

texts.es: Olver tiene 18 años de edad, es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres. Tras ver el liderazgo de su hermano en las diversas siembras que realizan sus padres, él se ha propuesto en seguir su ejemplo, sobre todo, tener sus propios ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de educación. Por ello, que a su padre le propuso que lo apoyara con unas tierras cultivables, con la finalidad de sembrar plantas de café para cumplir sus propósitos de culminar sus estudios técnicos. Olver estudia todos los días y los fines de cada semana se dedica a sus cultivos para no saturar las responsabilidades de su padre, él quiere ser independiente económicamente, por ello ya inició con las labores de la chacra haciendo las limpiezas y quitando la densa vegetación que hay en sus chacras. Posteriormente, con las ganancias obtenidas, quiere adquirir un auto para transportar su producción de la chacra a la ciudad. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está muy entusiasmado de trabajar en su banco comunal, y sobre todo cuenta con una buena predisposición de pagar cada una de las cuotas programadas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de plantitas de café, calcula que le costarán un aproximado de 500 soles, ya que cada mata está 2 soles.
texts.en:
Olver is 18 years old, single, and lives with his parents. After seeing the leadership of his brother with the various crops his parents cultivate, he has decided to follow his brother’s example in order to have his own salary and to pay for his education expenses. His father has offered him a job working on some land, planting coffee plants. This will help his achieve his goals of finishing technical school. Olver attends class every day and on the weekends he helps in the fields, in order to keep up with his responsibilities to his father. He wants to be economically independent and because of this he has already started cleaning up the fields and taking out the dense vegetation. Later, once he has the money, he wants to purchase a car to transport his crops to the city. This is his first loan with MFP and he is very excited to work with his community bank. He will pay all of the programmed payments and with the money, he will buy the coffee plants that he needs. He calculates that he will need approximately 500 soles, since each plant is 2 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy coffee plants

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No Seas Flojo en quechua.
Teofila es casada, tiene 49 años y 6 hijos, Teofila venD. hoja D. coca en las ferias D. la región a donD. viaja dos veces por semana, producto que adquiere D. la empresa D. la coca, además Teofila compra y venD. tara y cochinilla.
Teofila necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. tara, cochinilla.
Los sueños D. Teofila son educar a sus hijos y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the Communal Bank Amaquella, which means “Don’t Be Lazy” in Quechua. Teofila is married, 49 years old, and has 6 children. Teofila sells coca leaves at the regional markets that she travels to twice a week; she acquires this product from the coca company. Teofila also buys and sells Tara used as an ornamental plant and a source of tannins, and cochineal insects used for crimson-colored dye. Teofila needs a loan of 1050 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of Tara and cochineal insects. Teofila’s dreams are to educate her children and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase Tara (an ornamental plant and a source of tannins), and cochineal insects (used for crimson-colored dye).

loans.name: Lourdes Benita

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes Benita H. Ramírez, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Villa turística de Catac”, vive en la Av. 31 de Mayo Nº 414, Distrito de Catac, Provincia de Recuay, Departamento de Ancash. Es conviviente, tiene 28 años de edad y es madre de 03 niñas que dependen de ella, su esposo es constructor y le apoya en todo.
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 compró materiales para su centro de tipeos. Trabaja con Manuela Ramos desde hace un año.
En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, en el lugar donde vive, presta sus servicios a los estudiantes del lugar.
Con este préstamo de S/.  300.00 comprará 01 impresora multifuncional porque la que tenía se le ha malogrado.
Lourdes es Técnico en Enfermería y se siente orgullosa de haber logrado culminar su carrera apoyándose con los trabajos de tipeo que realiza.
Lourdes, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos porque le permitió valorarse como mujer y poder continuar sus estudios y así conducir bien su negocio.
texts.en:
Lourdes Benita H. Ramírez belongs to the “Villa turística de Catac” Communal Bank. She lives at Av. 31 de Mayo Nº 414 in the Catac District (Recuay Province, Department of Ancash). She is 28 years old, married, and takes care of her 3 daughters. Her husband is in construction and helps her with everything. With her first loan for S/. 300.00 she bought supplies for her typing service. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for a year. She still has the same business, located in her home, and she offers her service to local students. With this loan for S/. 300.00 she will buy a multifunctional printer because the one she had broke. Lourdes has an Associate's Degree in Nursing and is proud to have finished her studies by supporting herself with her typing services. Lourdes is grateful to Manuela Ramos because it allowed her to have pride in herself as a woman, to continue her studies, and to manage her business well.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase one printer

loans.name: Nicolay

texts.es:
Nicolay joven emprendedor que trabajaba como empleado, poco a poco se está independizando formando su propio taller de arreglo de frenos y balatas para movilidades; vive con su madre y un hermano mayor. Esta actividad de auto mecánica es su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su madre. Ellos viven en la casa de su abuela ubicada en la Zona 16 de julio de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinará para la compra materia prima (frenos y lubricantes) para su taller de frenos y de esa forma poder contar con mayor clientes.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Nicolay.
texts.en:
Nicolay is a young entrepreneur who used to be an employee. Little by little he is becoming independent with his new auto repair shop which specializes in fixing breaks and related pieces for automobiles. He lives with his mother and older brother. This auto repair business is the principal source of income of the household. They live in his grandmother's house, located in Zona 16 de julio in the city of El Alto. He will use the loan to buy supplies (brakes and lubricants) for his auto repair shop in order to increase his number of clients. This will be his first loan with IMPRO, which was approved based on his evaluation.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy brakes and lubricants for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.fr: Cette femme âgée de 35 est mariée et mère de 01 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’agoè qui est un quartier au nord de la ville de Lomé, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des articles de quincaillerie. Elle exerce ce commerce dans une boutique. Sa clientèle est composée d’entrepreneurs, les maçons et les peintres. Le stock dont elle dispose présentement ne lui permet pas de satisfaire ses clients, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 03 pots de peinture, 04 boîtes de vernis, 05 boîtes de faume, des carreaux et divers articles de quincaillerie.
texts.en:
This woman of 35 is married and the mother of one child. She lives with her family in the Agoè neighborhood which is a district in the north of the city of Lomé. She sells hardware to earn a living. She sells out of a shop. Her clientele is composed of entrepreneurs, masons, and painters.

The stock she presently has does not permit her to satisfy her customers, so she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 3 tins of paint, 4 tins of varnish, 5 tins of "faume", tiles, and various other items in the line of hardware.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hardware for resale

loans.name: Abuu

texts.en: Abuu A. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and a married man.  He runs a cosmetics shop at Yombo Kiwani in Dar es Salaam. He sells various cosmetics goods at his shop. He purchases the business goods from the wholesalers and retail shops at Kariakoo city shopping center and from other retail shops in Dar es Salaam. His business plan is to to run a wholesale shop as his business capital grows. He has been in the business for five years. His business income is used to capitalize the business and meet his daily family demands. He needs a loan of 1,000,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar Nasir Masih Group

texts.en:
Shamim Akhtar has completed 2 years with Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a third time to buy animals (goats) to improve her husband’s animal-selling business.

She has been a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan, for the past 32 years. Her husband's name is N. M.. She has 4 kids: 3 daughters and 1 son. She wants to give her children a good education; that’s why she enrolled her kids in school and they all are in kindergarten.

This loan consists of 4 additional people: Shahnaz wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Shamim, Naseem, and Razia each want a loan to buy donkey carts for loading.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Shamim is seated first from the right in this photo.

loans.use: To buy goats for an animal-selling business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda P. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, and married with three adult children. To make a living, Imelda owns and operates a bakery. The main source of income for the business comes from baking and selling bread in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Imelda joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional baking ingredients. This loan will be her eighth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional baking ingredients

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel C. is single and has one child. He has no educational background. Samuel goes to the forest, cuts weak trees and branches of old trees and sells them as firewood at Abrodzirum near Shama-Kedzi, which he has been doing since 2007.

Samuel uses his income for payment of fees for the child and payment of utility bills. Samuel will use the loan to pay for equipment to enable him to improve the efficiency of his work. With the new profits from his expanded business, Samuel plans to save to take care of his child’s education.

loans.use: To pay for equipment to improve the efficiency of his work.

loans.name: Mary-Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 26 years old and lives in Barangay Bantay Solana, Cagayan, where most people make a living in agriculture. She is married to Romulo, a local farmer, and they blessed with three children: Ronel, who is 9 years old, Roderick, who is 7 and Marielle, who is 2. They have a good family life and everyone is happy despite their poverty. 

For the last year, Mary Ann has made a living selling vegetables and raising chickens. She works hard and is patiently trying to expand both businesses so that her family has a better life. She uses some of the income she makes from selling vegetables to buy feed for her chickens. Mary Ann is applying for this loan to buy more of the supplies she needs to run both of her small businesses.

loans.use: To buy supplies to expand two small businesses

loans.name: Modesta Alicia

texts.es: Modesta Alicia S. tiene la edad de 86 años, su estado civil es viuda, ella tiene varios financiamientos con Fundación León 2000, por lo que a pesar de su edad ha logrado, salir adelante con su negocio y pagar en tiempo y forma.  La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la elaboración de cosa de horno, prisionero y queques, hace mas de 25 años que se dedica a  este negocio, inicio por cu4enta propia, ya que por medio de su familia adquirió este  negocio que le proporciono la fama en su cuadra. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo maíz, leña, queso, mantequilla, huevos entre otros productos útiles. Su deseo es seguir adelante con su negocio para sufragar todos sus gastos.
texts.en:
Modesta Alicia S. is 86 years old. She is a widow who has taken out several loans with Fundación León 2000. Despite her age, she has been able to succeed in her business and pay her loans on time. She produces baked goods, such as pastries and cakes, and has been managing her business from home for over 25 years. The business was acquired by her family and has an established reputation in the community.

This loan will be used as working capital to purchase corn, firewood, cheese, butter, eggs, and other useful products. Sra. Modesta hopes to continue her business so that she can cover her expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase ingredients & supplies

loans.name: Lita

texts.es: Lita es una mujer dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 41 años, madre de dos hijos menores de edad, se dedica a la venta de naranjas, mandarinas, toronjas y limones, ella trabaja junto con su esposo, el negocio lo tienen en el mercado de Bellavista de esta localidad. Es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Ucayalinas” desde hace dos años. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en telas, para coser blusas y venderlos, ahora Lita necesita un crédito de 2000 soles, que será utilizado para comprar  frutas al por mayor y posteriormente comercializarlas. La meta de Lita es tener una fuente de soda, y aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Lita is a dynamic woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, which is in the region of Ucayali. Lita is 41 years old and the mother of two dependent children. She sells oranges, tangerines, grapefruits, and lemons. She and her husband work together at their business located in the market at Bellavista.

Lita has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Ucayalinas” for two years. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles, which was used to buy fabric for making blouses that she sold herself. She is now requesting a loan of 2000 soles to purchase fruit in bulk to sell later at the market.

Lita’s goal is to open a soda fountain so that she can increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit in bulk

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 36 years old and is married with five children. All her children are in school and she hopes to give them a quality education.

Roseline sells tubers of yam at retail prices to her customers and has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to sell her tubers of yam at wholesale prices in the future when she becomes the sole distributor in her community.

Roseline requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is married with two teenage kids. He lives in Melitopol along with his family. Oleg owns a small business selling men’s outerwear in one of the local markets of his hometown. He has been in this business for eight years. Presently, he has 20,000 Grivnyas in inventory. His monthly net profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas.

Oleg is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to increase his working capital. He always jokes he has chosen this type of inventory because men are easier to please. Oleg is planning to expand his venture even further. He is hoping to be able to use available lending services in the future as well. Oleg is planning to use his newly generated profits to finish remodeling his apartment.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
La Sra. Miguelina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad del Dorado”, Distrito D. Moyobamba, Provincia D. Moyobamba, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 47 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, todos ya independientes.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas D. salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio D. venta D. emolientes que son bebidas calientes preparadas a base D. plantas y semillas medicinales,  para ofrecer sus producto se dirige, por las diferentes calles D. la ciudad, a partir D. las 6:00 am a 9:00 am, así D. esta manera, poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo D. actividad. Lleva 12 años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.

En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario consumen su producto y ella siempre atendiéndoles con el carisma y amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo D. S/ 2,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria D. emolientes como: alfalfa, cebada, uña D. gato, linaza, y otras plantas medicinales propias D. la región que los compra semanalmente. 

Esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Ms. Miguelina belongs to the Banco Comunal "La Amistad del Dorado", District of Moyobamba, Province of Moyobamba, Department of San Martin. She is married and 47 years old. She is the mother of 3 children, all now independent. The fighting spirit that has always characterized her and the wish to get ahead by her own means have served her to start her own business. She sells emolientes, which are hot drinks prepared with a base of plants and medicinal seeds. To offer her products, she makes her way through the different streets of the city, from 6:00 a.m. to 9:00 a.m. In this way, little by little, she has maD. herself very well known to her customers and today she tells us that this activity is going very well for her. She has been working at this business for 12 years and she feels very happy with what she does. At present, despite all the time that has passed, she continues with the same business. She now has a faithful clientele that consumes her product daily and she always serves them with the charisma and friendliness that characterize her. With this loan of S/2,000.00, she will buy ingredients for the daily preparation of emolientes, such as: alfalfa, barley, cat's claw, linseed, and other medicinal plants of the region which she purchases weekly. She is ready for anything and still feels a lot of strength to continue working and keep going ahead. She thanks the Movimiento Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase ingredients to prepare her emolientes.

loans.name: Santigie

texts.en:
Santigie B. is 38 years old. He is married with two children. His wife is a petty trader at the lorry park near her husband's store. Santigie deals in hardware tools and bicycle parts and has been in this business since he left school 15 years ago.  

He believes that his turnover is small because of the small amount of working capital employed in the business; however, the potential for increased sales for the type of goods in which he deals is very high. Sometimes he has to direct some of his customers to other dealers in the town especially when the gadget required is not in his store.

Because of the aforementioned, he wants to take out a loan from ARD so that he can increase his working capital. Santigie is believed to be honest and hardworking by his suppliers and friends. He wants to rent a bigger store at the lorry park when he gets the loan he is requesting.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. sells the hide of a cow locally called “wele” by Ghanaians. It is normally used in the preparation of soups and sauces; she also sells dried salted fish also called “koobi" or "kaco” that is also used for preparing sauces and soups. She sells at Elmina market near Cape Coast. Rose has received junior high education. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a fisherman.

Rose has been in this business since 1999. She helps her husband in the payment of utility bills and school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh cow hide and dried fish for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business for additional capital.

loans.use: to buy more fresh cow hide and dried fish for sale

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita P. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. She is 50 years old. Rosita is separated from her spouse and has three adult children. To make a living, she operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling scrap metal and other used products in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Rosita from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rodrigo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Rodrigo Antonio J. H. tiene 32 años, es casado y su esposa trabaja como  guarda de seguridad la empresa de C Y B, ellos tienen dos hijos y viven en el Barrio Laureles Norte este es un barrio conocido por los altos índice de delincuencia que atacan a la comunidad que habita allí.

Agradecen el apoyo que les ha brindado los fondos Kiva este sería su segundo préstamo y lo solicitan para realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda debido a que hay una pared que es de plycem y la desea reconstruir de bloque, esto le dará a la familia una mayor seguridad para todos, es gracias a los fondos de Kiva que el señor J. ha podido componer poco a poco su hogar.
texts.en:
Rodrigo Antonio J. H. is 32 and married. His wife works as a security guard for the C Y B company. They have two children, and they live in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. This neighborhood is known for the high levels of delinquency, which attacks the community that lives there. They are grateful for the help of the funds that Kiva has given them. This will be their second loan. They are asking for the loan to make improvements to their house. There is a wall of cement board that he wants to rebuild with concrete block. This will give the family better security for all. Thanks to the funds from Kiva, Mr. J. has been able to repair his house little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a cement block wall

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda M. is a 42-year-old married woman who lives in Luke Wright St., Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by providing multimedia services to her clients.

Rhoda’s husband, Rafael, is a 41-year-old computer technician who helps his wife manage their computer-based business. They have three children who are between 5 and 10 years old. The two older children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Rhoda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in multimedia services. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000 from her business activities.

Rhoda is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 was used to fund operations of her multimedia services business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her ninth loan for PHP 20,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital in her multimedia services business. Rhoda is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. In the picture, Rhoda is with her husband at their business.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Туракулов Бахтиёр проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 37 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. У него среднее образование. Более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Имеет небольшой земельный участок, где сажает дыню и арбуз. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений. Он хочет посеить и получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en:
Bahtiyor T. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 37 years old, married and has 3 children. He has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for over 10 years. Bahtiyor has a small plot of land, where he plants honeydew and watermelon. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers. He wants to plant and obtain a good harvest for sale.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 49 years old and married with seven children.  They range in age from one to 22 years old.  Five of them are currently enrolled in school.  He has run a farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, for the past ten years.  His primary source of income comes by selling maize, beans and meat, at the local market to middlemen.  He also operates his own butchery for extra income.  Overall, his main challenges are competition from other meat suppliers and access to good preservation equipment such as fridges. 

Justus requested this loan, his first through Juhudi Kilimo, for Kes. 31,200 to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He says that the extra income from this loan will improve his family by getting milk for home consumption and selling the surplus. Justus wants to be the main meat and milk supplier in his area.

loans.use: Purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Darleen

texts.en:
Darleen B. is from the village of Santiago, Gerona, Tarlac. She is 29 years old, married, and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Darleen owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Darleen has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Darleen joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Darleen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more baby items and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées dans des familles monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent dans le camp de garde de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues dans le camp à travers des relations de service (leurs maris sont des gardes), de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le grand marché de Ségou. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Djenebou C. veut utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 400kg d’échalote en gros à Niono avec les producteurs. Elle revend à domicile et au grand marché de Ségou, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23 000FCFA qui sera utilisé à l’instar des autres membres du groupe pour  épargner et réinvestir dans leurs activités génératrices de revenus afin de devenir grossistes dans ce qu’elles vendent.
texts.en:
The members of this Benkadi group are all married and living in monogamous families. Their average age is 32 and they have, on average, 4 children. They live in the watchstanders' camp in Ségou (4the administrative region of Mali) and they met each other in the camp because all their husbands are watchstanders, but also through being neighbors. They also all work at income-generating activities at the big open-air market of Ségou. Wishing to grow their working capital, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third solidarity loan. Mrs. Djenebou C. wants to use her loan to buy 400 kg of shallots wholesale at Niono from the farmers. She resells them out of her home and at the big open-air market of Ségou, for cash or credit to a clientele composed essentially of women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 23,000 F CFA which will be used, following the example of the other members of the group, to put aside savings to reinvest in their income-generating activities so as to become wholesalers of the goods they sell.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shallots wholesale

loans.name: Sope Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SOPE MAME DIARRA est créé il y a de cela 6 mois, il est composé de 08 femmes issues toutes du même village et âgées moyennement de cinquante ans exceptées les deux femmes accroupies Awa Michel D. et Dior S. âgées respectivement de 30 et 32 ans. Elles sont mères d'au moins de 2 enfants. Dans le village se trouve un grand marché hebdomadaire qui draine des milliers de personnes par semaine. Ce qui fait que l'activité commerciale est permanente dans le village et contribue au développement économique de la localité et ses environs. Le nouveau crédit du groupe de solidarité lui permettra de renforcer ses activités économiques et de les diversifier. Leurs activités s’articulent au tour de la vente de céréales locales, de produits halieutiques, d’arachide et de crème glacée pour les détentrices de réfrigérateur. 

Madame Fatou D., la présidente du groupe de solidarité, à droite de la photo en grand boubou bleu-fleurette est âgée de 56 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants. Elle est très dynamique et ne se lasse d’inculquer à chaque fois un esprit de solidarité de dans le groupe. Elle est vendeuse de produits halieutiques tels des poissons séchés, des poissons fumés, des huîtres et du charbon de bois.
