Nasreen baji’s husband’s name is M. and he operates a fruit-selling business. He has 6 years of experience in this business. Nasreen baji is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her husband’s fruit-selling business. Nasreen baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Mussarat shamim baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit-selling business. Hurmat baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits for her husband's business

loans.name: Gloria Angelica

texts.es:
Gloria  es socia del Bancomunal El Triunfo. 
Gloria es soltera tiene 39 años, no tiene hijos.
Siempre se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa, y le va muy bien por eso hasta ahora sigue  vendiendo  y tiene más clientes. 
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para invertir en mercadería de ropa.
Desde que está en Finca, los préstamos le han ayudado para poder invertir en  la mercadería que sus clientas le hacen. 
El sueño de Gloria es tener una tienda para vender su ropa y seguir prosperando.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the El Triunfo communal bank. She is single, 39 years old, and has no children. She has always worked selling clothing; it has treated her well, so she continues to do so and gain more customers. Gloria needs a loan of 1,000 soles to invest in clothing merchandise. Since she has joined Finca, the loans have helped her be able to invest in the merchandise her customers want. Gloria's dream is to have a store where she can sell her clothing and to continue prospering.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in clothing merchandise

loans.name: Rodrigo Antonio

texts.es:
Don Rodrigo J. tiene 31 años de edad, soltero y habita en laureles Norte en la capital de Managua,  con dos hijos que su esposa le tiene
Con los prestamos en afodenic ha realizado poco a poco la construcción de su vivienda, ya que sus planes es ir superándose y al paso del tiempo tener  mejor comodidad  en su casa. Este préstamo que solicita en Afodenic es para la realización de entechar y enladrillar comprando los materiales necesarios tales como: ladrillos, cemento y láminas de zinc para hacer las mejoras. Sus planes a futuro es apoyar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Rodrigo J., 31, is single and lives with his two children in Laureles Norte, Managua. With loans from Afodenic he has, little by little, been doing construction on his house. His plans are to keep improving and, in time, have a more comfortable home. The loan he is asking Afodenic for is to put a roof and bricks on his house. To make these improvements he will buy the necessary materials like bricks, cement, and zinc sheets. His future plans are to support his children in their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to change the roof on his house

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es una mujer muy trabajadora, los motivos que tiene para progresar son la superación de sus hijos, por quienes se esfuerza día a día, junto a su esposo. La posibilidad de tener su propia su casa le dio la oportunidad de iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comida, pues la ubicación de su domicilio la beneficia. Esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años junto a sus hijos, quienes la apoyan para atender a sus clientes hasta altas horas de la noche, sobre todo los fines de semana, ya que las reuniones sociales elevan el nivel de ventas. Mercedes está ambientando su casa para ofrecer mejores atenciones, ya que hasta la fecha  sólo ha podido atender en la puerta, pero pronto tendrá un lugar adecuado y cómodo para que puedan disfrutar de los deliciosos platillos que prepara con mucha dedicación y cuidado, pues una de las cosas que quiere brindar a sus clientes es garantía de salubridad. Los años que tiene con MFP le sirvieron para desarrollarse como persona y como parte importante dentro de su grupo, ya que la participación solidaria es una de las características de su banco comunal. Los 1700 soles que solicita los usará para comprar alimentos de primera necesidad para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a hard-working woman, she is motivated to progress because of her children, for whom she and her spouse put in a lot of effort every day. The possibility of having her own house gave her the opportunity to start her own business, in food sales, since the location of her home lends itself well to this. She has been doing this for 5 years together with her children, who help her serve her customers until late at night every weekend, since the social meetings increase sales. Mercedes is adapting her house to better serve her customers, because currently she can only serve them at the door, but soon she will have an adequate and comfortable place so that they can enjoy the dishes she prepares with such dedication and care, since one of the things she wants to offer her customers is a guaranty of health sanitation. In the time she has been with MFP, they have helped her develop as a person and as an important part of their group, since supportive participations is one of the characteristics of their communal bank. The S./ 1700 that she requests will be used to buy basic foods for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing supplies for making her dishes

loans.name: Maribel Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Maribel del Carmen M. , tiene la edad  de 28 años , habita en el barrio las conchitas , ubicado en el departamento de Masaya , junto a su esposo , el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo , tres hijos , todos menores de edad, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyarlo siempre en sus estudios , doña Maribel desde hace 18 años se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , en un futuro quiere diversificar el cultivo . Con el préstamo obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y obtener mejores resultado. Da las gracias Afodenic por los beneficios adquirido para hacer las mejoras a su cultivos.
texts.en:
Maribel del Carmen M. is 28 years old and lives in the Conchitas neighborhood located in the department of Masaya. She lives with her husband who helps with household expenses and they have under their care three children, all whom are underage. They hope to improve their family’s living conditions and support their children in their studies. Since she was 18 years old Maribel has dedicated herself to agriculture; the biggest difficulty that she faces is a lack of financing. In the future she would like to diversify her crops. With the loan that she obtained she will purchase fertilizers and supplies to apply to her crop to obtain better results. She thanks Afodenic for the help it has given her to improve her crop.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilizers to apply to her crops.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia K. is thirty-eight years old. She is divorced and has given birth to one child, a girl, who is currently in the primary school. She lives with her daughter in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital.

Lydia is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew. She sells on a table at the lorry (truck) station in the mornings. She buys her goods from nearby communities and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. Lydia has been in business for ten years. She aspires to expand her business and give her child a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is 32 years old trader. She is married with three children who are in school. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty and, for that matter, she is very serious with her business.

Ama trades in foodstuffs like plantain and cocoyam (taro). She started this business five years ago and through this she has been very resourceful to her family.

She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of plantains and cocoyam to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She believes that with the loan, she can buy bunches of plantain and cocoyam from the farmers, circumventing middlemen who retail to her at a high price.

loans.use: To buy a supply of bunches of plantain

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar Mahboob Hussain Group

texts.en:
Naseem akhtar baji has been a citizen of Chichawatni, Pakistan, for the past eighteen years. Her husband’s name is M. H. and he is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver and has been driving it for the past five years.

Naseem baji is a very hardworking lady. She is working on a sewing machine in the photo. She operates her clothes-sewing business to share the financial burden of her husband and to pay the utilities. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw because, currently, her husband is driving a rented one and pays half the income to the owner.

This loan group consists of five additional people:

Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

Sugran baji wants a loan to buy vehicle engine oil to sell.

Khatoon baji and Farzana baji each want a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell.

Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Nerfa

texts.es:
La señora Nerfa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 47 años, 03 hijos que aun depende de ella.

Nerfa, lleva 12 años dedicándose a la venta de ropa y zapatos, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo implementar su taller de confección de vestidos y teniendo habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo Manuela Ramos decidió implementar su propio negocio ubicado en su misma casa.
Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.

En la actualidad continua con sus confecciones de vestidos y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su casa para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Nerfa, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.

loans.use: Comprará telas en metros, agujas, tijeras.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia D. is a hardworking woman. She is married to Rogelio, who is a farmer. Their primary activity is agriculture, producing rice and corn. They also plant vegetables in order to make their farm prosper and, aside from that, Cecilia is maintaining a hog raising business. She is requesting additional assistance from Kiva lenders to support the business for her family's needs and her children’s education.

In this regard, she is requesting a loan from Kiva of 7,000 PHP to purchase a supply of hog feed. Her three children are all currently studying, and she hopes to give them a bright future someday through hard work and perseverance.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Beverly G. is from the village of Taboc Norte. She is 32 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Beverly owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has newly engaged in her business just this year. In 2009, Beverly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to buy materials for the construction of her store. This loan will be her first from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy materials for the construction of her store

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es socia del Banco Comunal Las Margaritas.
Silvia es casada, tiene 34 años y 3 hijos, Silvia vende pescado fresco, actividad que realiza los días sábados en la tienda de su mama. Además Silvia brinda el servicio de bordados de correas.
Silvia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado.
Los sueños de Silvia son comprar un terreno y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Silvia is a partner of the Banco Comunal Las Margaritas. She is married, 34 years old, and has 3 children. On Saturdays, she sells fresh fish in her mother's store. Furthermore, she provides the service of embroidering belts. She needs a loan of 1,000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of fish. Silvia's dreams are to buy a plot of land and to help her children get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of fish.

loans.name: Mosses

texts.en: Mosses T. is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to invest in his business. Mosses bakes and sells breads. He has been doing this business for ten years now. With this loan, he will be able to buy ingredients like bags of flour and sugar. Mosses was born in Mayossoh village in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have ten children.

loans.use: Buy bags of flour and sugar

loans.name: Diannah

texts.en: Diannah N. is a thirty years old business lady. She is married with seven children, all attending school. N. has a retail grocery shop in Kalisizo town which she has been operating for over six years. She is requesting for the loan purposely for business expansion. She wants to buy more bags of sugar, dry cells, salt, and a fridge. Her dream is to expand her business, increase her daily average sales and earn more profits. Diannah also dreams of becoming the best business lady in her area as in supplying in whole sale to earn more profit and so educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, dry cells, salt, and a fridge.

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en: Raisa is married with two children. She runs a small cafe. Raisa just started this business about a year ago. Her desire is to develop it and make it a stable source of income for her family. Raisa needs a loan of 10,000 Ukrainian grivna to purchase equipment for her cafe. She is sure that she can make this business a success with affordable prices, good food and a nice setting.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en la casa de unos familiares.
Desde hace 2 años tiene un restaurante ubicado cerca a una universidad de su localidad. Cada día, con la ayuda de su cuñada preparan las comidas y atienden a sus comensales durante todo el día. Este trabajo, aunque duro, tiene su recompensa y eso motiva a Nora a continuar, y también a planear la mejora de su  local.

Esta es la tercera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella se siente muy a gusto en su banco comunal y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará para comprar manteles y espejos para adornar su restaurante, pero también adquirirá comestibles al por mayor para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Nora is 29 years old. She lives with her husband and their three children in one of their relative's houses. For two years, they've had a restaurant located near the university in their area. Every day, with the help of her sister-in-law, she prepares food and serves their guests during the day. This work, although hard, has its benefits and this motivates Nora to continue and also to plan improvements for her business. This is the third opportunity to have a loan from MFP. She feels very comfortable with her community bank and she promises to be punctual with her payments. The money that she is requesting now will be used to buy tablecloths and mirrors to decorate the restaurant, but also to acquire provisions at wholesale for the preparation of their dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix up her business and purchase provisions.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is fifty-three years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Grace works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves -- often accompanied by fried fish). She sells by the roadside. Grace is also a fish monger. She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities. She has been in business for over eighteen years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Wilton Francisco

texts.es:
Wilton A. de 46 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, tiene solo agua como servicio básico, su esposa trabaja como costurera con ella tiene dos hijos uno de 14 años y otro de 15 años los dos estudiando en una escuela particular. 

Wilton comenzó su negocio hace 12 años atrás vendiendo solo pescados. Poco a poco comenzó a implementar en su negocio mariscos como camarones, conchas. Ahora Wilton trabaja en un triciclo todos los días desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer vendiendo pescados, camarones, conchas etc. Una de las mayores dificultades son las lluvias.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mariscos como pescados, camarones, conchas para tener más variedad. En el futuro quiere poner ya un puesto fijo de mariscos y tener una distribuidora de mariscos.
texts.en:
Wilton Francisco is 46 years old and lives in the edge of the city of Guayaquil. He has only running water as a basic utility in his home. His wife is a seamstress. He has two children with her, a 14-year old and a 15-year old. Both children go to a private school.

Wilton Francisco started his fish selling business 12 years ago. Little by little, he started to also sell shrimp and shellfish. Wilton Franciso now works in a tricycle selling fish, shrimp and shellfish from dusk until dawn. One of the biggest hardships is the rain.

He wants to buy seafood such as fish, shrimp and shellfish with the loan, so that he will have more variety. In the future he wants to establish a storefront to sell seafood and a seafood distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish, seafood

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda M. is from the city of Naawan in Misamis Oriental. She is 59 years old. Yolanda is single and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Yolanda sells dried fish in the local community. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Yolanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to expand her business. This will be Yolanda's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
El señor José Antonio S. C., tiene 38 años de edad es casado y con su esposa y sus 4 hijos habitan en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla su esposa aporta a los gastos del hogar debido a que es comerciante y él trabaja como transportista desde hace 3 años e inicio su negocio con su esfuerzo propio.

Dentro de los principales planes a futuro de la familia están el mejorar la infraestructura del hogar, para esto solicito un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción y así continuar con las remodelaciones del hogar. Ellos gozan del respeto de la comunidad por ser una familia unida que con sus propios meritos han logrado salir adelante, este préstamo les brindaría la posibilidad de vivir en un lugar más optimo y seguro para todos.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose is 38 years old, is married and with his wife he has four children. He lives in the “Juan Ramon Padilla” neighborhood. His wife helps with the household expenses as a businesswoman. Ramon has worked as a driver for the past three years and has taken the initiative to start his own business. His plans for his family’s future are to improve the structure of his home. He is asking for a loan to buy construction materials in order to continue remodeling his home. His family enjoys the respect of the community. They are a united family that has continued to progress. This loan will allow them the opportunity to live in a better home that is more secure for everyone.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, de 35 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Iván de 40 años y sus tres menores hijos, a los que desea dar una mejor vida.

Junto a su esposo trabaja todos los días en sus cultivos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y ahora siembra de todo, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de calidad. Principalmente siembra alverja, ya que esta menestra se está vendiendo muy bien en el mercado.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad.
Para el futuro de su negocio, espera juntar el dinero necesario para tener un puesto de venta en el mercado mayorista, ya que actualmente vende de forma ambulatoria.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Julia con MFP, siente que este crédito le ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgullosa. Los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en mejorar sus cultivos, para ello comprará abono e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Julia, 35, is a hardworking and loving mother who lives in a rented home with her husband Ivan, 40, and their 3 minor children. She wants to give her children a better life. She works with her husband each day on the crops they are growing. With a lot of effort, they have managed to make their lands very productive and now they cultivate everything, since they know that all of the products they obtain will be of a good quality. They mainly plant peas, since pea stew is selling very well in the markets. What she likes most about her work is to care for the crops so they can avoid the pests that can affect them. She has been doing this work for 10 years and what she considers most difficult is to transport her harvested crops to the wholesale market of the city. For the future, she hopes to gather together the money to have a stall in the wholesale market, since currently she sells as a street vendor. This is Julia's 6th loan with MFP, and she feels that this loan will be a great help in developing her business. In her communal bank she is proud of the fact that she is a very responsible member. The 2,000 Peruvian soles requested will be used to improve her cultivations; to do this she will buy fertilizer and insecticides.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy cement

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is a 24-year-old married man who has completed the primary level of eduction. He has a workshop for repairing automobiles and wanted a loan to buy spare parts for cars.

He has borrowed this money to develop his shop in the industrial zone where there are many workshops. He will be able to expand his shop because of this loan. He has a good reputation in the market. He has acquired a great deal of experience in his work field. His income has also been raised and he is hoping to get more clients, benefit from his experience, and expand his shop more in the future.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for cars

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma S. is from the village of Brgy. La Torre North, Bayombong, Neuva Vizcaya. She is 54 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Wilma owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP every cropping season.
In 2007, Wilma joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 28,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 29,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila tiene 39 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 5 años que posee una tienda, en donde vende productos básicos de consumo humano, además vende también animales, previamente cebados durante 3 meses. De esta manera abastece a sus vecinos y clientes con productos de primera necesidad y los fines de semana se va a la feria ganadera para vender sus animales, en ocasiones le ayudan sus hijos, ya que el transportar estos animales le resulta muy pesado. Ella se encuentra muy satisfecha con la actividad que realiza, puesto que las ganancias que obtiene lo derivarán para comprar mercadería para su tienda. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, por tanto será muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Además considera que este aporte será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. El crédito que solicita, comprará mercadería en conservas y productos enlatados, asimismo desea comprar ovejas para cebarlos y venderlos a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 39 years old, and lives in her own house with her 3 children. For more than 5 years she has had a store where she sells basic necessities. In addition, she also sells animals that were previously fattened over a 3-month period. In this way, she meets the needs of her neighbors and customers for basic necessities, and on the weekends she goes to the livestock market to sell her animals. Occasionally her children help her, since transporting the animals is very difficult. She is very satisfied with the work that she does; she uses the earnings she gets to purchase more merchandise for her store. This is her 9th loan with MFP; therefore she will be very responsible with her payments. In addition, she feels that this support will help her to make progress with her business. The loan she requests will be used to buy canned goods. In addition, she wants to buy sheep to fatten and later sell at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to stock her store with a variety of canned goods, and also to buy a sheep.

loans.name: Snezhana

texts.en:
Snezhana is married and has one son. Two years ago she started a retail business selling shoes at an open market in Mukachevo city. She is a hard working person and has lots of energy to develop her business further by starting new locations.

Snezhana would like to purchase a boiler to heat water in her apartment. She does not want to take money out from her business. That is why she would like to get a loan. She needs 6,500 UAH to purchase the boiler that will allow her family to have hot water any time they need it!

loans.use: To purchase a boiler.

loans.name: Pachapaccari Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Pachapaccari está formado por personas luchadoras, alegres y carismáticas que buscan día a día la manera de salir adelante con sus familias y viven en la ciudad del Cusco.  El nombre del banco comunal “Pachapacari” es proveniente de la lengua quechua y traducida al castellano significa “Amanecer”. Entre sus actividades económicas sobresale el comercio minorista y también brindar servicios como por ejemplos: venta de artesanía, venta de alimento de cuyes, venta de ropa, venta de comida, empleado de hotel, electricista, venta de carne, tipeos en computadoras y panadería. Las zonas más pobres de la ciudad del Cusco son los distrito de Santiago, San Jerónimo y San Sebastián de donde provienen los socios, ellos no tienen muchas oportunidad de trabajo, los salarios son bajos y  las autoridades muy poco hacen por apoyarlos y por esos motivos la mayoría de los pobladores empezaron a formar sus propios negocios y de esta  manera poder darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y educación. 

El socio Cesar tiene 55 años y es el presidente del banco comunal, el es natural de la ciudad de Lima y tiene cuatro hijos. Su actividad económica principal es la industria y la transformación de papel, el tiene una tienda de imprenta llamada “Dadis’s Imprenta” en la avenida San Andrés que está cerca a la plaza de armas de la ciudad del Cusco.  El  socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más material de trabajo como por ejemplo papel y tintes.    

(El socio Cesar es el que esta levantado la mano).
texts.en:
The Pachapaccari community bank is made up of charismatic, happy, and strong-spirited people from the city of Cusco who are searching day in and day out for ways to come out ahead with their families. The name of the community bank, “Pachapacari,” comes from the Quechua language, and in English it means “Dawn.” Of all their economic activities, retail and services stand out, for example: hotel work, electric work, word processing, baking, and the sale of artisan crafts, meat, clothing, guinea pig feed, and food items. The poorest zones in the city of Cusco are the Santiago, San Jerónimo, and San Sebastián districts where the community members are from. They do not have many work opportunities, the salaries are low in these areas, and the authorities do very little to help them. For these reasons, the majority of residents have begun to form their own businesses to give their children a better education and quality of life. Cesar is 55 years old and is the president of the community bank; he is a native of the city of Lima and has four sons. His principal economic activity is the production of paper products, and he has a print shop called “Dadi’s Imprenta” on San Andrés Avenue, which is close to the Plaza de Armas in the city of Cusco. He is requesting this loan to buy more materials for his work, such as paper and dyes. (Cesar is member of the group who is raising his hand)

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of work materials, such as paper and ink

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley is 54 years old and a married father of six children between the ages of 15 and 30. All his children, except one, have completed school.
Wesley is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for 30 years and has two employees. His main product is milk, which he sells to the local market. He is also a cash crop farmer and sells his tea to the local market. He also operates a retail shop in the same area. Wesley's biggest challenge in farming is lack of animal feed and water since there is no piped water and he has to rely on rain water and water from the wells.
Wesley recently completed his previous loan from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, for 60,000 KES and has requested this new loan for 80,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will assist him in paying school fees for his youngest son and improving his family's living standards. In the future, he would like to have a pure bred and build a dairy unit.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Saodatjon

texts.en:
J. Saodatjon is 52 years old and a widow with three children. She makes dried apricots and processes the stones to sell at the local market. This is her main income and it provides a steady cash flow. She always makes very productive use of her capital, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is requesting a loan which will be used to restock her inventory of dried apricots. Saodatjon will be happy if she can get this loan. It would help raise her family income, which is really necessary for her. She deeply appreciates your support and would like to thank all of you.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to restock her inventory of dried apricots

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita I. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung Cagayan. She is 45 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she will start a business venture in the retail sector running a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She is just starting this business.

In 2005, Leonita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. Leonita is requesting a new loan of 27,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be her 8th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis solicito  850 $us, para la compra de una maquina  bordadora, es soltero no tiene  hijos;  el destino del crédito es la compra de una maquina bordadora  y así ampliar los ofertas de servicio de costura con que trabaja; es el primer crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva.  Luis es soltero y vive en la ciudad de El Alto.
texts.en:
Luis requests a loan of $850 US to purchase an embroidery machine. He is single and he does not have children. This loan will be used to purchase an embroidery machine so that he can expand the variety of services he offers in his tailoring shop. This is the first loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner). Luis is single and he lives in the city of El Alto.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique was born in 1981 and is single. She takes care of two dependents; the first is 19 and the second is one year old. These dependents are relatives. In the family of Angelique there is one member who works as technician.  Angelique owns a small business selling various products such as: soft drinks, cosmetics, biscuits, and so on.  This is her 2nd year of successful operation in business. The hours of her daily activities are from 6 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day.  She employs one person from her community as a helper so that her business runs well.

Angelique is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing an additional products for her store. This expansion will allow her to attract more customers which will make her more effective and more efficient.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Andrea Xiomara

texts.es: Andrea Xiomara tiene 31, su actividad económica es la compra y venta de combustible, hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que esta actividad se dio con la intención, de sufragar los gastos del hogar no es el primer financiamiento que realiza pues ha sido muy importante para ella mantener su negocio activo. A pesar de que su Papa ha tenido problemas  de salud, ha buscado la forma de brindar una muy buena atención a sus clientes. Este financiamiento es para la compra combustible pues actualmente tiene una gran demanda.
texts.en:
Andrea Xiomara is 31 years old. For the past 4 years she has been buying and selling fuel for a living. She started this business with the intention of defraying her household expenses. This is not her first loan. The previous loans have been very helpful in keeping her business going. In spite of the fact that her father has had health problems, she is constantly looking for ways to provide good customer service. This loan will be used to buy fuel that is currently in high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fuel to supply her customers

loans.name: United Sisters Group

texts.en:
Miatta K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called United Sisters.  She is 47 years old, married, and has five children who are between the ages of twelve to twenty-two years. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial constraints. 

For five years, she has been operating a mini-restaurant in Via Town, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 25,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 63,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of rice, pepper, meat, fish, tomatoes, onions, etc. 

She describes herself as an honest woman whose goals are to improve her business and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: buying rice, pepper, meat, fish, tomatoes, onions, etc.

loans.name: Libra Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Libra, actualmente radican en la colonia Providencia, Estado de México. Están muy contentas porque ya llevan cinco ciclos con Fundación Realidad y esperan seguir con nosotros durante mucho tiempo. Las cuatro integrantes son amas de casa a quienes les gusta sentirse útiles y dar un servicio a la comunidad y se sienten muy contentas de lo que han logrado como personas y sobre todo de haber entrado en el programa de Kiva . 

María Elena S. de 49 años de edad, orgullosamente del estado de Veracruz. Ella se dedica a la venta de fundas para electrodomésticos. María comenzó trabajando en una fábrica de costura en donde duro cuatro años aproximadamente, pero a medida que sus gastos iban aumentado vio que era mejor comenzar su propia actividad, al principio para ella fue difícil aclientarse, pero con sus esfuerzos y sus ganas de salir adelante logro hacer buenas ventas, Hoy en día hay gente que llega hasta su domicilio para hacer sus pedidos de cortinas, manteles, etc.,. Siempre trata de tener variedad de fundas y de comprar sus telas a tiempo, sus ventas son durante todo el año pero bajan un poco en época de inscripciones escolares pero aun así lucha diariamente. Con el crédito va a comprar diferentes tipos de telas, encajes, bies e hilos, y principalmente poder darle mantenimiento a su máquina de coser. Con las ganancias que obtenga desea poder iniciar con una nueva actividad. 

Las demás integrantes son: 
Yolanda R. C.  (venta de ropa de niña y bisutería)
Diana Karina R. (venta de calzado por catalogo) 
María de Jesús D. S. (venta de Frutas y Verduras).
texts.en:
This group is called Libra, currently living in the colony of Providence, State of Mexico.  They are very happy to have been with the Reality Foundation for five cycles already and hope to continue with us for a long time. Four members are housewives who like to feel useful and provide a service to the community and are very happy of what they have achieved as individuals and especially as Kiva program participants.

María Elena S. is 29 years old and proudly from the state of Veracruz.  She sells covers for appliances.  María began working in a sewing factory where she stayed on approximately four years, but as her expenses rose she saw that it would be better to start her own business.  At first it was hard for her to find customers, but with her efforts and her desire to succeed she was able to achieve good sales volumes.  Today people come to her home to place orders for curtains, tablecloths, etc.  She always trys to have a variety of slipcovers and to buy fabrics ahead of time.  Sales occur throughout the year but decrease a bit during school enrollment; even so, it is a daily struggle. With the loan proceeds, she is going to buy different types of fabrics, lace, trimming and threads and have maintenance performed on her sewing machine. With the earnings she would like to be able to begin a new activity.

The other members are:

Yolanda R. C.  (selling girls' clothing and imitation jewelry) 
Diana Karina R. (selling shoes by catalog) 
María de Jesús D. S. (selling fruits and vegetables).

loans.use: To buy fabric, lace, trimming, elastics, threads, needles, etc.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.en:
Humberto is 42 years old. He lives along with his partner and parents in a home that is shared by all. They live in the district of Tambogrande, a rural area in northern Peru that consists primarily of small farms.

Humberto and his father work together on a farm that is owned by the father. They raise mango and limes on their property, working long hours to protect the crop from pests and to maintain the attractive appearance of the fruit that is so prized in the international market. Additionally, they raise sheep and cattle, an activity that helps to stabilize the family income. They have worked the land and raised animals for many years and are very well respected in the area for their products.

Humberto’s father is over 70 years old and has limited access to credit due to worries about his health.  Humberto is therefore the primary borrower and his father is acting as a guaranty. They plan to invest the funds in their farm in order to maintain production and improve their product.

loans.use: To invest in the farm to maintain production

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina C. is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Josefina is married and has six grown children. To make a living, Josefina owns and operates a retail store, selling daily use products such as canned goods, sugar, milk, coffee, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Josefina has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Josefina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken by Josefina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kuña  Rory Group

texts.es:
Este comité se denomina “Kuña Rory”, se encuentra dentro del 10 ciclo del Programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Todas las integrantes son señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, ellas se dedican diversas actividades .
     Algunas de las integrantes ya contaban con trabajo antes de formar parte del comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y se integraron para lograr mejorar su emprendimiento, otras sin embargo comienzan con su primera actividad ajena a los que  se refiere su familia.
     Las mujeres Agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya por la iniciativa ya que mediante ella logramos desarrollar bastante nuestra capacidad de trabajo.
     Todas realizan actividades independientes, pero con ayuda y esfuerzo lo realizan en forma conjunta.
El comité lo conforman mujeres muy sacrificadas que han luchado toda su vida para llevar adelante a sus familiares a pesar de los obstáculos que siempre existen.
 Se puede comentar el caso de la Sra  Dionicia  quien se dedica hace varios años a la venta de leche y verduras, ella se levanta muy temprano a ordeñar  su vaca para salir a vender.
 La venta lo realiza en la ciudad de Carapegua en donde tiene un puesto de venta de verduras. 
La Sra. Dionicia agradece de manera especial a la Fundación por que mediante el apoyo brindado por la misma  ella pudo adquirir más capital y así poder agrandar su negocio porque ahora cuenta con más mercaderías y así también con una congeladora.
texts.en:
This committee is called "Kuña Rory" and is in its tenth loan cycle with the Enterprising Women's Committee Program. All the members are very responsible and hardworking women who work at a variety of businesses. 

Some of the members already had work before becoming part of the Enterprising Women's Committee and joined up in order to be able to make improvements in their enterprises. Others however are just starting up their first business activity apart from their responsibilities to family. 

The women appreciate the Fundación Paraguaya for the initiative since it is through the initiative that we are able to see considerable development in our ability to work. 

They all maintain separate businesses but with help and effort they are doing it jointly. 

The committee is made up of self-sacrificing women who have struggled their whole lives to get their families ahead in spite of the obstacles which always exist. 

We may comment on the case of Dionicia who for a number of years has worked selling milk and produce. She gets up very early to milk her cow in order to go out and sell the milk. She sells in the city of Carapegua where she has a vegetable stand. 

Dionicia especially appreciates the Fundación because by means of their support she was able to acquire more capital and thus could expand her business. She now has more merchandise and also a freezer.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and a freezer

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng B., 38 years old, is a humble villager living in the province of Kompong Chhnang. Chheng B. makes his living by working in the construction field as a building worker and has a proper salary every month. He has been married for many years but he doesn’t have any children yet.  His wife is a seller.  

From most of the products which Chheng B.’s wife sells such as soft drink and fast food, she can earn an income of approximately $2 per day. Currently, Chheng B.’s wife hopes to enlarge her business by purchasing more pessary items to sell to earn extra revenue. To encourage his wife’s business, Chheng B. will use his loan for his wife to purchase more fast food and soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: To purchase food and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Merlyn T. is from the Barangay of Gotocan Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Merlyn is the group leader of a two member group loan offered by Kiva partner PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Merlyn T.’s Group. 

Merlyn T. is 37 years-old and married to Dexter T.. They are blessed with two children who are school age. To make a living, she is presently engaged in banana production. Her husband is also giving her regular support from his income as a motor “jabal-jabal” driver. She’s been engaged in her business for ten years. She earns an average amount of not less than Php 2,000.00 a month from sales from this business. 

In the year 2007, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn, as an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities, has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php 10,000.00. She is now requesting a loan of Php 40,000.00 as her sixth loan. This loan will be used to purchase a second hand motorcycle. The future income from this business will be used to meet their basic needs, make loan repayments and pay for the children’s education. She also joined PAGLAUM MPC because of the savings and insurance program offered by PAGLAUM MPC to its members. 

 About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of 2nd hand motorcycle unit

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora B. is from the village of Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Flora is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she raises goats to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $20 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Flora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. 

Flora is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 5th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 40 years old, married, and supports her family by operating two business ventures: hog raising and a frozen products business. She lives in Bago City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of $186. 

Juliet is borrowing 28,000 PHP so that she can fund her operations. This will be her 27th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 25,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Juliet aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem S. is a 32-year-old married woman and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Cham Province. Sem S. has five children, all of whom are single and still live with her. 

She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow rice and vegetable crops. 

Her husband is currently a recycling seller. He buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The used goods he deals in are mostly leftover electrical wires and plastic. 

Currently, he use his bicycle to pick up his products and it takes too long and he cannot use it in distant places. Because of this problem, Sem S. decided to request a loan to purchase a used motorcycle for supporting her husband’s business. 

Sem S. and her young child are in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle

loans.name: Beldad

texts.es:
La Sra. Beldad, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 45 años y es madre de 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella.

Beldad es una mujer luchadora, eso siempre le ha caracterizado, las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio, ubicado en un campo deportivo cerca su casa, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad, ya que el lugar donde vende, es un lugar con mucho movimiento.  Sus ventas las realiza  diariamente  a partir de las 6:00pm. Lleva varios años trabajando en este tipo de actividad y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace. 
 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes y  pensionistas.

Beldad se siente muy orgullosa y contenta del trabajo que realiza día a día. Agradece mucho al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Beldad is a member of the communal bank “Los Eucaliptos”, in Tarapoto District, San Martin Province. She is 45, married and the has two dependent children.  Beldad has always been a hardworking woman and has opened a business serving food in the eveinings near an athletic field in her town, and has gained a following among local clients and those using the sports field.  She has been running her business for several years and is very pleased with the results.

With a credit of S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, she plans to buy foodstuffs such as rice, eggs, chickens and chicken parts to prepare meals, as well as utensils to better serve her customers.  Beldad is proud of her work and grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her to achieve her dreams and goals.

loans.use: To buy rice, eggs, chickens and cooking utensils

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg, 32, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Arhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they have owned for the past 29 years. Altantsesteg used to work for someone selling clothes at a stall with her husband, but began her own business in 2010. She prepares food at home and sells it at the market. Her husband and children help her with the cooking and preparation. 

Her business has become more stable due to the increase in regular customers. In the beginning she started her business with a working capital of 40,000 MNT and her current working capital exceeds 300,000 MNT. She wants to expand her business and increase her working capital. She says, "I would like to expand my business and give a good education to my children." She is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to buy groceries and food ingredients for her cooking business.

loans.use: To buy groceries and food ingredients

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married and has one child. She has operated a business selling clothes from home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. Regina faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Regina plans to use this KES 15,000 loan to purchase bundles of women's dresses and baby clothing. Regina dreams of establishing her own shop instead of selling from door-to-door. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans and expand her business to satisfy her customers’ needs.

loans.use: to purchase women's dresses and baby clothing.

loans.name: Ludina

texts.en:
Ludina E. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 45 years old. Ludina is married and has eight school-aged children. Ludina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, junk food, shampoo, soap, biscuits & beverages in the local community. Ludina has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Ludina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 14,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital.

Ludina is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase additional canned goods, junk food & beverages. This loan will be her fifth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk food, & beverages

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Abdul Rahman

texts.en:
This is Abdul Rahman K.. He is 48 years old, married, and has five children aged 16, 14, 12, 6 and 4. He has three additional dependents, who live with him because they are his late wife’s relatives.
In 2010, Abdul established his timber business. He began this business because he wanted to be self-employed and become self-reliant. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like to request a loan of 5,000,000 SLL. With this loan, he will buy a new power saw for more timber production. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 400,000 SLL. In the future, Abdul plans to educate his children to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy another machine for timber processing

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu Z. is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. They live in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a crisp-making business. (Crisps are like chips and can be made of potatoes, cassava, etc.) She sells crisps from home and door to door to her neighbors and passersby. In addition Zainabu also operates a restaurant business which contributes another source of income. 

She faces a major challenge of competition from other chip business operators in the area. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of cassavas and mangoes.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of cassavas and mangoes.

loans.name: Hezron

texts.en: Hezron, a 41-year-old, sells maize to earn a living for his family. He has been in the business for ten years. He hopes to buy a lorry for transporting maize to the marketplace because of the expense of hiring a vehicle.  Hezron has become more confident in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya, because he knows that he can access business loans easily.  He has requested 35,000 KES to buy maize.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a 52-year-old married woman living in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur.  Violeta is a farmer and has been growing rice for 6 years. This business earns 4,600 PHP per month.

This loan will be used to purchase 4 bags of fertilizer and additional farm inputs. This will help Violeta improve her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase 4 bags of fertilizer and additional farm inputs

loans.name: Uktam

texts.en:
Uktam is married and has 6 children. His wife is a housewife. Uktam sells different household accessories such as columns, lamps, batteries, chargers, flashlights, etc. He has successfully operated this business for 11 years. His current working capital is 40,000 TJS.

Uktam travels four times a month to the city of Dushanbe, where he purchases goods amounting, on average, to 6,000 TJS. All his taxes are paid on time and he has regular customers. Uktam would like to get a loan of 12,500 TJS to purchase more columns, lamps, batteries, chargers, flashlights, etc. in order to expand his business and to make a good profit. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy columns, lamps, batteries, chargers, flashlights, etc.

loans.name: Gameli

texts.fr: Revendeur de portables depuis 2005, Gameli sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des portables au Grand Marché afin d’assurer sa future vie maritale. Il est célibataire.
texts.en: Gameli has sold mobile phones for a living since 2005 and is seeking a loan in order to buy more stock from Togo's main market. He is currently single, but is hoping that by boosting his business he will be able to cater for future married life.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones

loans.name: Ma. Elma

texts.en: Ma.Elma is 34 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family by running a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items like biscuits and groceries to sell in her store. She has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her store for 5 years and also earns income from making and selling food. Ma.Elma wants to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like biscuits and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 38-year-old divorced woman with four children and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility to take care of the family rests on her and her dream is to educate her children up to university. She has been in retail with a charcoal shop for four years and she got her initial capital from selling clothes. Her hardship is the high commodity prices and her vision is a wholesale business plus building a house.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is 54 years old, married to Ruth and they have three children.

He operates his retail shop in Naivasha town and has been doing the business for twenty-three years. He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He plans to use the loan to buy flour, sugar and cooking fat in bulk, which he will then re-pack and sell in small quantities.

In future, Johnson hopes to grow his retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and cooking fat in bulk

loans.name: Las Dulcineas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS DULCINEAS.” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Cielo. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: kiosco de café, artesanías en alpaca, venta de sábanas, venta de edredones, penta de productos AVON y venta de productos YAMBAL

La señora Cielo, indica que hace es la primera ves que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de café, que lo realiza en un kiosco.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de pan, carne, etc.) ya que implementará un nuevo servicio, que es la venta de hamburguesas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Dulcineas” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo II Community Center. The group consists of six members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Cielo. The members of the Communal Bank engage in various businesses in order to get ahead such as operating a coffee kiosk, making crafts from alpaca wool, selling bed sheets, selling quilts, selling AVON products, and selling Yanbal products.

Sra. Cielo says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined after receiving an invitation from a friend. Cielo currently manages a business selling coffee from a kiosk.

The loan she is now receiving will be used to increase her capital for buying bread, meat, and other supplies so that she can start a new service of selling hamburgers. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family as much as possible. Cielo is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Cielo said that she enjoys the health services.

loans.use: to buy bread, meat, and other supplies for selling hamburgers.

loans.name: Gloria María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gloria, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 12, 11 y 9 años de edad, todos estudian en escuela. Su esposo ebanista.

Nuestra amiga realiza el crédito para el negocio de su esposo el cual tiene taller de ebanistería en su casa, allí el transforma la madera en bellísimas obras tales como muebles en todas las formas y modelos, puertas, camas, ventanas entre otras muchas cosas más, nos cuenta que el trabaja a base de pedidos que le realizan sus clientes que siempre lo visitan por la calidad de su trabajo y porque es muy puntual en sus entregas. Tiene muy buena clientela por lo cual nunca le ha faltado trabajo en los 15 años que tiene su negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar madera, clavos, lacas, pega, lijas y otras materias primas para elaborar sus obras. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque es muy fácil conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos y que nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in La Sequita Parish belonging to Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí, that’s full of hardworking, dedicated people who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose inhabitants are honest people who only know how to work and be devoted to their families.  We met Gloria, 30, here.  She’s married and has three children who are 12, 11 and 9 years of age; all of them are in school.  Her husband’s a cabinet maker.

Our friend took out this loan for her husband’s business.  He has a home-based cabinet making shop where he transforms wood into beautiful works like all shapes and models of furniture, doors, beds, windows and many other things.  She tells us that he works based on prior orders placed by his customers that always come by to see him because of the quality of his work and because he’s always very punctual with his deliveries.  He has quite a good clientele so he’s not lacked work for the fifteen years he’s been in business.

This loan is to buy wood, nails, lacquer, adhesive, sand paper and other raw materials to manufacture his items.  This is the communal bank’s second cycle and she likes it because getting loans is very easy.  Her dream is to provide her children with the best and that they never lack anything.

loans.use: to buy lumber, nails, lacquer, files, etc.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: la señora Modesta pertenece al banco Dalias  se amino para tener su crédito individual  se dedica ala artesanía D. aguayos ella los hila en unos telares artesanalmente y después los lleva para coser a la maquina y lo terminan  es muy una persona muy  responsable vive por la zona bajo Llojeta, los aguayos los venD. mas que todo por la ciudad D. Viacha en el alto el crédito lo saco para incrementar su mercadería compra D. hilos ya que por mayor le sale mas barato es viuda sus hijos ya son mayores ya no tiene responsabilidad D. esa parte pero con esta actividad ella sola se mantiene ya que es su único ingreso económico.
texts.en: Modesta belongs to the Dalias bank. She has decided to have an individual loan. She does artisanal crafts, making aguayo cloth. She weaves artisanally them on looms and later takes the fabric to be sewn  and finished on machines. She is a very responsible person. She lives in the Bajo Llojeta area. She sells the aguayo cloth throughout the city of Viacha en el Alto. She took out the loan ton increase her merchandise by buying thread, since buying it wholesale is cheaper. She is a widow and her children are grown and not her responsibility now but with this activity she supports her self on her own and it is her only financial income.   el crédito lo saco para incrementar su mercadería compra D. hilos ya que por mayor le sale mas barato es viuda sus hijos ya son mayores ya no tiene responsabilidad D. esa parte pero con esta actividad ella sola se mantiene ya que es su único ingreso económico.

loans.use: to buy thread.

loans.name: Teratai Indah Group

texts.en:
Like many Balinese women, Sayu Komang and the other members of the Teratai Indah group raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families 'incomes. Through many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize income. Sayu Komang hopes that, through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan Program, she will not only get capital but will also get training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs. 

Sayu Komang will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork. With her profits, she will help support her family of three by supplementing the income of her husband, who works as a farmer. Ultimately, Sayu Komang hopes that increased income will enable her to pay school fees.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Hened

texts.en: Hened is a 47-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children, two of whom are still attending school. In 2007, she opened her own store where she started to sell home products. She also sells lingerie from her shop where she has prepared a small corner for that purpose. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional home products to sell. She plans to reinforce her business operation, and her only target is to focus on one industry in order to be successful and earn satisfactory income.

loans.use: to purchase additional home products to sell

loans.name: Mohinisso

texts.ru: Мохиниссо швея. Она замужем, муж электрик, у них двое детей. У нее небольшой швейный цех и три ученицы. Она занимается пошивом женской одежды. Мохиниссо хочет нанимать больше учениц и таким образом расширить свой бизнес. Поэтому ей необходимо займ для покупки дополнительных швейных машин. Она надеется на вашу помощь, и заранее благодарна вам.
texts.en: Mohinisso is a seamstress.  She is married, her husband is an electrician, and they have two children.  She has a small garment factory and employs three apprentices.  She is involved in sewing women's clothing.  Mohinisso wants to hire more apprentices and, thus, expand her business.  This is why she needs a loan to buy additional sewing machines.  She hopes to receive your help and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase additional sewing machines

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
