Alexei is married and has a two year old son.  He runs a family business growing tomatoes, cucumbers and radishes in greenhouses.  His wife and her parents help Alexei with the business. 

Alexei started this business seven years ago.  Vegetables are in high demand in this area and the business is successful.  Recently Alexei bought a second piece of land and put another greenhouse there.  He needs a loan of 20,000 UAH to purchase seeds, film and water systems for his greenhouses.

Alexei's goal is to fix his house and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, film, and water systems.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married with 6 children aged 6 to 18. He has been a maize farmer for 15 years. He would like a loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides to grow his crop. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production: he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides to grow his crop.

loans.name: Cerro Poty Group

texts.es:
Las señoras del comité Cerro Poty, son personas muy trabajadoras, ellas están muy agradecidas con la fundación y con kiva por la oportunidad de progreso que les da. Actualmente está integrado por 15 mujeres, quienes trabajan muy a gusto dentro del programa, quieres salir adelante y de esa forma ayudar a sus familias.
La presidenta, la Sra. María Lourdes vive con su marido e hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de confites, es decir de masitas dulces, tiene su negocio en el centro de la cuidad de Caacupé. Comenta que tiene buena venta, y nos dice que una de sus metas es seguir creciendo para que de esa forma pueda seguir ayudando a su marido para mantener la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, dulces y demás insumos con los cuales elabora los confites que vende. Ella junto con sus compañeras realizan constantes actividades y de ese modo fomentar la integración entre las compañeras y tratar de adelantar sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The women of Cerro Poty Committee are hard working people. They are very grateful to the foundation and to kiva for the opportunity of progress that they have given them. Currently it is made up of 15 women who work very happily in the program and want to get ahead and thus help their families.
The president, María Lourdes, lives with her husband and children. She sells sweets for a living, i.e. sweet pastries. She has her business in the downtown of the city of Caacupé. She comments that she has good sales and tells us that one of her goals is to continue growing so that in this way she can continue helping her husband to keep the house.
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of flour, sugar, sweets and additional ingredients which produce the sweets that she sells. She, together with her partners, constantly conduct activities and thereby promote integration among the partners and try to continue with their payments.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, sweets and additional ingredients.

loans.name: Yors

texts.en: Mrs. Yors is in two businesses: she is a fish seller and a crop farmer. She is now 57 years old and a widow, living in Baray district with a daughter who is already married. Her daughter always helps her in both businesses. During season, Mrs. Yors usually starts growing dry-season rice crops and bean crops. However, she really needs some funds from HKL and Kiva to purchase rice seeds and bean seeds for this project. She is very appreciative to all lenders who support her business. With the increase in income, she will save some money to expand her farmland in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and bean seeds for farming.

loans.name: Ana Daisy

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, vive con su familia, su esposo y sus hijos, ella administra este negocio en compañía de su esposo ya que le colabora en muchas labores diarias, trabajan en lo propio la granja está en su vivienda, no tiene horario para el mantenimiento de la misma. Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra de un cerdo macho y un cerdo hembra, ya que con ellos podrá aumentar la crianza de los cerdos.

Ana espera que después de esta inversión su negocio prospere y aumente el número de cerdos en la granja para tener mayores posibilidades de venta.
texts.en:
Ana is dedicated to raising pigs. She lives with her family, her husband and her children.

She manages the business with her husband who takes part in many daily chores. Since they work on a farm which is also their home, there is no timetable for maintenance work.

She needs a loan to buy a boar and a sow, so that she may increase her pig-breeding activity.

Ana hopes that following this investment her business will thrive with an increasing number of pigs on the farm, thus providing greater sales potential.

loans.use: Purchase pigs.

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan is 47 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children in Imishli city.  Elshan is a farmer who raises and sells fruits and vegetables from his garden. He has 10 years of experience in crop raising.  The most popular product he sells is pomegranate, which is in high demand in Azerbaijan.  People use it to make fresh juice, which is good for health, as well as using it in national dishes like pilau and dolma.  His father helps him to irrigate trees and land and to run the business. His monthly profit is 300 AZN. Elshan applied for a 1300 AZN loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Ramón tiene 54 años de edad, esta casado con dos hijos.

Él se dedica a la agricultura, a la ganadería y al comercio de carne de cerdo, desde que era niño. Fue su papá quien le enseño esta actividad. Don Ramón manifiesta que la actividad que más le gusta por la demanda que tiene es la comercialización de carne de cerdo.

El señor Ramón, compra todo lo necesario para la producción en una ciudad que esta a tres kilómetros de su casa. Para transportar los productos a su casa, tiene que llevarlos en vehiculo o en autobús hasta la parada más cercana de su casa, luego él junto con sus hijas y sus nietos los cargan en la espalda hasta su vivienda. 

Él solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para pagar el alquiler de la tierra donde cultiva, ya que él no tiene suficiente espacio, además le servirá para pagarle a una persona  que le ayude junto con sus hijos. Así él tendrá más semilla para su consumo y si es posible para la venta.

Don Ramón, desea brindarle lo mejor a su familia, que sus hijos y nietos aprendan su trabajo, ya que a él le gustan mucho estas actividades que le ayudan a sobrevivir.
texts.en:
Señor Ramón, who is 54 years old, is married, with two children.

He works in farming, raising livestock, and selling pork, and has been doing this work since he was a child. It was his father who taught him this work. Don Ramón declares that the activity that he likes most, because of the demand for it, is selling pork.

Señor Ramon buys everything he needs for production in a city that is three kilometers from his house. To transport the products to his house, he has to carry them in a vehicle or bus to the stop that is closest to his house, then he and his children and grandchildren carry them on their backs to his home.

He is applying to Fundación Campo for a loan to pay to rent the land where he grows his crops, since he does not have sufficient space. It addition, it will serve to pay someone who will help him and his children. This way he will have more seeds for his use and, if possible, for sale.

Don Ramón wants to offer the best to his family and wants his children and grandchildren to learn his work, since he very much likes these activities, which help him to survive.

loans.use: to pay rent for the land where he grows his crops and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is a 37-year-old married woman with five children; two of the children are in school. She has had a business selling from a food stall in Bor, South Sudan, for three years.

Achol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: La Bonté Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LA BONTÉ est composé de trois personnes qui résident  dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Bidjonissè félicité (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 36 ans a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Bidjonissè félicité est veuve, et mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Bidjonissè félicité vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par dame Bidjonissè félicité. Pour cette raison, Bidjonissè félicité vend des des fruits de saison depuis quatre ans. Bidjonissè félicité s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité. Bidjonissè félicité ensemble avec les membres du groupe LA BONTÉ sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des fruits de saison.

loans.name: Mawudjlo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAWUDJLO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Fifamè Pulcherie, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 24  ans ne vit plus avec son mari. Fifamè Pulcherie a un enfant, scolarisé et à la charge du couple. Fifamè Pulcherie vit seule avec son enfant. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Fifamè Pulcherie et son mari. Elisabeth a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Pour cette raison, Fifamè Pulcherie vend des céréales à son domicile depuis huit ans. Fifamè Pulcherie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Fifamè Pulcherie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAWUDJLO un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de maïs.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 33-years-old married with two children. She earns a living by Duck raising in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP GDMPC in order to buy many ducks.

Mercy has been Duck raising for 1 year, and she also earns income from  Duck raising and selling eggs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business, repair her family's home and to send their children in school.

loans.use: to buy many ducks

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantal D., born in 1972 in Gbodjomé in the Prefecture des Lacs in southwest Togo, is single with two (02) children and one sister in her care. She comes from a very poor family and did not have the chance to pursue thorough studies. She became involved then, by her own means, in the trade of basic need food products. To strengthen her business, she benefitted from a loan of $350, which she managed well and repaid without incident. Today, this business continues to grow and necessitates increased loan capital which is unavailable.

To achieve this, Mrs. Chantal D. is asking for a loan of $1000 which will serve to build up sufficient stocks of food products regularly asked for by her customers; this will avoid stock shortages. She is a woman who has perfectly mastered her business and has the capacity to manage this loan, which will surely have a very positive impact on the profitability of her business and considerably improve her and her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame D. Chantal, née en 1972 à Gbodjomé dans la Préfecture des Lacs au Sud-est du Togo, est célibataire avec deux (02) enfants et une sœur à charge. Elle est issue d’une famille très pauvre et n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études poussées. Elle se lança alors dans le commerce des produits alimentaires de premières nécessités avec ses propres moyens. Pour renforcer ses activités, elle avait bénéficié d’un crédit de $350 qu’elle avait su bien gérer et rembourser sans incident. Aujourd’hui, cette activité prend de plus en plus de l’ampleur et nécessite un fonds de crédit plus important dont elle ne dispose pas.

Pour se faire, Madame D. Chantal, sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui servira à constituer suffisamment des stocks de produits alimentaires régulièrement demandés par sa clientèle afin d’éviter les ruptures de stock. C’est une femme qui maîtrise parfaitement son commerce, a la capacité de bien gérer ce prêt qui aura à coup sûr un impact très positif sur la rentabilité de son activité et améliorera considérablement les conditions de vie de sa familiale.

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Jane is a young woman of 28 with no children. She had her education to junior school level. She went into baking some 4 years ago using a brick oven that is fired with wood.

Having taken part in the 'TEACH' learning sessions of KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION, she decided to access the KIVA loan. Her objective is to acquire a gas oven to reduce the workload on her and also the cost of producing a loaf of bread. This she firmly believes would result in an increase in her income.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mr. Phan H. is 33 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province with his wife and their 3 children.  Phan H. produces mortars and pestles out of hard stone, and can earn $3/day doing this.  This loan will be used to purchase more hard stone to keep his business running.  In the future, he would like to build up his business so that he can send his children to university.

loans.use: To purchase hard stone for his mortar and pestle business

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: "I am proud to be a LAPO client." says Miss Blessing E., who lives in Obasuayi, Benin City. She styles hair and sells "weavons" (hair extensions). She is 27 years of age and has 3 years' experience in her business. Blessing hopes to buy more "weavons" and other hairdressing equipment for her little salon.

loans.use: purchase hair extensions etc. for her hairdressing business

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en:
Mr. Kamran is a low income vulnerable person. He is 40 and married with two children. He lives in Saatli town, in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan, in the Caucasus region.

Kamran has seven pedigree milk cows. He sells 150 litres of milk a day to a local milk processing shop. His children help him to graze the herd. The income is not sufficient for Kamran to save enough money to renovate his cow-shed. For that purpose, Kamran applied to Normicro's Saatli branch for a loan of $500. After he expands his cow-shed, he plans to apply for another loan to increase the number of cattle in his herd.

loans.use: To renovate his cow-shed

loans.name: Anghela Paola

texts.es:
Anghela is a happy and very enterprising young woman that lives with her dear aunt Leticia. Because of her delicious and unbeatable snacks, cakes and pies that she makes with utmost cleanliness and patience, she is very well known and requested in the city. She has a lot of orders, which is why she decided to take on this role without neglecting her studies at the prestigious institute in the city. Anghela and her brave aunt’s wish is to open a snack shop in a strategic location in their city, Juliaca. To make their dreams a reality, they are aware they will have to save and work hard. They are pleased because they know that the public’s welcome will be reflected in the new services they want to offer. At this time they are requesting a loan to invest in purchase of raw ingredients for the creation of their delicious cakes. They’ll also invest in quickly renovating the small sales stall they want to install to keep up with the high demand and satisfaction of their clients. Your collaboration will make their yearnings rapidly become realities.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Anghela es una joven alegre y muy emprendedora, vive junto a su querida tía Leticia, quién por sus deliciosos e insuperables bocaditos, pasteles y tortas que elabora con mucha paciencia e higiene es muy conocida y solicitada en su ciudad; es por esa razón tiene gran cantidad de pedidos y es por esta razón que ella decidió asociarse a este oficio sin descuidar sus estudios en un prestigioso instituto de su ciudad.El deseo de Anghela y su valerosa tía es abrir un snack en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad donde radican, Juliaca, para hacer realidad sus sueños, ambas son consientes que tienen ahorrar y esforzarse mucho y están muy contentas porque saben que la gran acogida del público se verá reflejada en el nuevo servicio que juntas desean ofrecer..En este momento solicitan un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus deliciosos pasteles y también para el acondicionamiento del pequeño espacio de ventas que desean instalar en poco tiempo para cumplir con la gran demanda y satisfacción de sus queridos clientes.“Tu colaboración hará que sus anhelos puedan hacerse realidad en poco tiempo

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for making snacks and renovation of a sales stall

loans.name: Holikul

texts.ru:
Holikul M. is 65, has a college degree in physics and mathematics, is married and has 9 children. Currently Holikul is retired and is in business of raising and selling cattle. With this loan he will be able to purchase and feed two animals. According to his calculations he will be able to sell animals each 40-45 days. He will purchase new animals and feed with the money he will obtain from the sale. He will use the remaining profit to supplement his small pension, which by itself is not always enough. He has been in this business for the past 7 years. He is planing to repay the loan withing 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Маджитов Холикул – 65 лет, образование высшее, по специальности физик – математик, женат, имеет 9-х детей. В настоящее время Холикул находится на пенсии и занимается разведением и продажей домашнего скота. Холикул на полученный кредит планирует приобрести 2 головы крупного рогатого скота и корма для них. После их откормки через каждые 40-45 дней он планирует их продавать, а на вырученный деньги приобретать новый молодняк и корм, оставшуюся прибыль использовать на удовлетворение потребностей семьи, так как он получает небольшую пенсию, которая не всегда хватает. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 7 лет. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase two animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Gennadyi

texts.en:
Gennadyi is married with two sons and two daughters. He and his family live in Kherson. Gennadyi owns a small business offering English language tutoring and translation services. He has been in this business for five years already. Gennadyi loves his job. His passion for languages has helped him grow his business and increase his financial indicators by up to 200% over the past five years.

Gennadyi has a perfect credit history. He has used four previous loans to promote his business and improve the quality of his services. Gennadyi is constantly improving his language skills and puts a lot of effort into each project he translates. Today he is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a new computer, some literature and materials, as well as do a small remodeling project in his office. We believe this loan will help Gennadyi achieve further success and gain sustainability in his business.

loans.use: Purchase a computer, books and remodel the interior

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more merchandise and set up an in-home store

loans.name: Couture Makafui Group

texts.en:
Makafui is a traditional Togolese word for "glorification of God" and is the name that 2 young women, Sossa E., 27, and Atodogla A., 29, decided to name their garment-making company. They are both married and are the mothers of 2 and 3 children, respectively. Both women have been in the sewing and garment-making business for 3 years and are recognized among the best in their trade in the region. The young womens’ shop is located in Aventonou, a small village about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With their loan, Sossa and Atodogla hope to buy 3 sewing machines and also to buy more fabrics to sell to their customers. These purchases will permit them to work more in order to earn more money to better their living conditions.

La Couture Makafui est créée par deux jeunes filles appelées Sossa E. et Atodogla A.. Elles sont âgées de 27 ans et 29 ans respectivement. Les deux sont mariées et ont respectivement 2 et 3 enfants. Sossa et Atodogla opère dans la couture depuis plus de 3 ans et sont comptées parmi les couturières les plus dévouées du milieu. L’atelier de nos jeunes femmes est situé à Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elles souhaitent avec ce crédit acheter 3 machines à coudre et aussi des tissus afin de les revendre aux clients. Ceci leur permettra de travailler plus et par là gagner plus afin d’améliorer leurs conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy 3 sewing machines and also to buy more fabrics to sell to their customers

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 36 years old man and is the father of two children. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh.

Marwan has a bakery. This is the second time he applies for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy a fridge for his business.

loans.use: To buy a fridge for his bakery.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George O. is a 26-year-old married father of two school-going children. He lives with his family in Nyalenda slums in Kisumu, Kenya. He operates a motorbike taxi business which he initiated last year. His taxi is able to generate a daily income of Kshs 800. He has applied for $800 to enable him to pay part of the purchase price of a new motorbike.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Pay part of the price for a new motorbike

loans.name: Hemal Parsotamo

texts.pt:
Hemal is 26 years old, was born in the city of Maputo, Mozambique and is single with no children. He is the youngest of two brothers and he provides for his brother who is visually impaired. He lives with his mother and brother.
Hemal completed high school and also took a course in Computer Science. He says he didn't continue his education due to his family's financial situation and has run his deceased father's store since 2006.

In 2006 he moved to Bela-Vista with his mother at his brother's request to help run the store. Bela-vista is the chief town of the District of Matutuine, in the Province of Maputo. All three now live in a house behind the store. Despite it being owned by all of them, Hemal is the primary manager of the store and opens from 8.30am until 7pm every day with no employees. He learnt how to do business from a wholesaler in Maputo where he was working until his brother asked for his help. The emphasis in the store is on everyday necessities and the daily income is 1200,00 MZN, which Hemal is going to start saving. His biggest challenge in trying to expand the business is having a vehicle with which to transport the merchandise.

He heard of Hluvuku through other merchants in the area and this is his first loan, be it with Hluvuku or any other institution. Hemal is confident he can improve his business with this loan and grow it well, given that he will be able to respond to his clients' demands.

In the future, he aims to sell a greater range of products and eventually open a computer repair workshop as none exist in the area.

Translated from Portuguese by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Hemal tem 26 anos e nasceu na cidade de Maputo, e é solteiro. Ele é o segundo entre dois irmãos, sustenta o irmão mais velho que tem problemas da vista e sua mãe ambos vivem na mesma casa e ele não tem filhos.

Hemal completou o ensino secundário (ate a 12a classe) também fez curso de informática, diz que não continuou por situação financeira da família e desde 2006 esta gerindo a loja do falecido pai. Em 2007 se mudou para Bela-vista junto com sua mãe a pedido do seu irmão para o ajudar na loja uma vez que o irmão tem problemas de vista, Bela-vista é uma vila sede do Distrito de Matutuine, Província de Maputo, onde Hemal vive com o irmão e sua mãe na casa aos fundos da loja do seu falecido pai.

Hemal é o principal gestor da loja embora sendo bem comum, tem um horário diário das 8:30h as 19:00h e não tem empregados. Aprendeu a fazer negocio numa loja grossista na cidade de Maputo onde se encontrava a trabalhar antes do irmão o solicitar para vir ajuda-lo a gerir a loja. Os produtos com destaque são da primeira necessidade, o rendimento diário é de 1200,00mt e diz que vai começar a poupar. Para ele o maior desafio para conseguir expandir o negocio é ter uma viatura para ajudar no transporte de mercadoria.

É primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e nunca teve nenhum empréstimo em nenhuma instituição e conheceu Hluvuku através de outros comerciantes da zona. Hemal esta confiante que com este empréstimo o negocio vai melhorar e vai crescer dado que poderá responder bem a clientela.

Os objetivos com o negocio daqui em diante são vender produtos diversificados e futuramente abrir uma oficina de reparação de computadores uma vez que na zona não existe nenhuma.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (to increase stock)

loans.name: Richard

texts.fr:
Richard Z. is 35 years old, is married and a father of 4 children. He is a textile artisan from Assahoun, a village located approximately 50 kilometers from Lome, the Togolese capital. He has carried on this activity for the past 5 years and the fruits of his work help him to provide for the needs of his family. With this loan, his second from FECECAV, Richard would like to buy strings for his textile work, and to arrange his workshop. This will enable him build his clientele and earn more money to provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Richard Z. est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Il est tisserand à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il exerce cette activité depuis 5 ans et les fruits de son travail lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Richard souhaite par ce crédit, le deuxième de FECECAV, acheter des ficelles lui permettant d’exécuter son travail, et aménager son atelier. Ceci lui permettra de conquérir beaucoup de clients et de gagner plus d’argent pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy strings for his workshop

loans.name: Aytan

texts.en: Aytan (her brother is pictured) is 24 years old. She is currently settled in the Absheron region. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Gubadli region in Azerbaijan. She has been in the general store business for two years. She would like a loan of $1200 to buy more goods for her store.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mr. Sopheap O., 26, and his wife, Mrs. Mom Kin, 27, live in a small village off of National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 2006 and have one daughter (shown in the picture with him).

Mr. Sopheap has been a construction worker for nine years. He does his work in the village and in a nearby province.  His wife has been a garment factory worker for five years. The couple is in the process of building their new house and lacks the money to finish the walls of the house. Therefore, Sopheap is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase cement to finish the walls of his house.

loans.use: To purchase cement to finish wall of his house.

loans.name: Mehrinisso

texts.en: S. Mehrinisso has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2005. She was able to improve her business thanks to the previous loans. She works with MicroInvest so she trusts its loan procedure. She started working from a small trade outlet, but now she has a better, larger trade outlet in the central bazaar, where she sells a good assortment of  meat and milk-sour products, cheese, sweets and confectionery. Mrs. S. Mehrinisso applies to KIVA for a business development loan of 2800 STJ (USD $825)  for 4 months, to purchase a large refrigerator.  Mrs. S. Mehrinisso thanks KIVA for its support and wishes you all the best.

loans.use: To purchase a large refrigerator

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 32-years-old, married and has four children. She has been very proactive in creating her business of selling kerosene to local people for use in their homes.

Josephine made a holding tank by fixing a pumping machine and writing “Kerosene for Sale” on the tank. She sells each liter for 64 naira (which is about 55 cents) and makes about ten cents of gross profit per liter. It takes a lot of time to get to a gas station to buy kerosene, which is why local households patronize her business.

Josephine is limited financially in her ability to purchase large quantities of kerosene that will fill her 7,000 liter tank, thus her reason for requesting the loan. She appreciates all of the people that help make this possible.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Ade

texts.en: Ade S. is a tailor who sews clothes of various styles for people in his community. He is 56 years old and married with 6 children. He needs the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell and to make his customers' clothing. He says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Samiha

texts.en: Samiha is a 50-year-old woman who lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon, with her husband. She has been selling bread for twenty years. She requested a loan of $800 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase flour and a new “saj.” The “saj” is the traditional Lebanese domed metal oven in which one bakes saj bread, or markouk ("thinned") bread, and doughy confections. This is the first time that Samiha has requested a loan. Samiha is special in her work because she sells different kinds of bread. Her clients are neighbors. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase flour and a new “saj” (oven)

loans.name: María Eva

texts.es:
La señora María Eva M. es originaria de la ciudad de León donde se dedica a laborar en el mercado la estación atendiendo su negocio de salón de belleza.

Es de suma importancia destacar que ella se ha desempeñado como excelente trabajadora en su negocio y es por esta razón que se esfuerza día a día para mejorar en este. Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de productos de belleza como cremas, tintes, peines, gelatinas, etc. Por este motivo espera que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta forma continuar desarrollándose en su negocio.
texts.en:
María Eva M. is from the city of León, where she runs a beauty salon in the La Estación market. It is very important to emphasise that works very hard and builds strength day by day to improve the business. She has approached Ceprodel for a loan in order to purchase beauty products such as creams, tints, combs, gels etc. She hopes to receive the loan in order to continue to develop her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products

loans.name: Janali

texts.en:
Janali A.  is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his parents. Janali is a market vendor. He sells women’s clothes in the local market of Imishli city. In 2006 Janali took a loan from AqroInvest and could start his business. Over two years of working at the market, Janali already has got enough experience to do his work successfully and has customers who always come to him.

Janali is trying to satisfy the needs of all his customers with various tastes and income levels. Today Janali is planning to increase his working capital in order to purchase new goods to sell. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting $1200 for a term of 15 months. Janali has successful loan history and this time promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting him. Your generosity can change their lives. Be an important part of the growth of Janali’s business!

loans.use: Purchase new goods to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Rocio

texts.es:
G.

Siendo madre de tres hijos de diecisiete, once y cinco años y con tan solo treinta y ocho años de edad, Maria del Rocío aspira a ser toda una ejecutiva de éxito con la venta de sus productos de belleza.

Como consultora de belleza ya lleva cuatro años. Empezó con la idea de solo probar como le iba. Antes de eso trabajo por el tiempo de tres años ara una señora, en un pequeño taller de manualidades. Sin embargo, como le iba bien con la venta de cosméticos decidió a dedicarse solo a esto.

Actualmente, ella esta postulando a la empresa de cosméticos para ser directora de una red de venta propia. De este modo, ella estaría a cargo de una pequeña  empresa, por lo cual necesita formalizarse. En esta empresa, Maria estaría a cargo de brindar capacitaciones a nuevas mujeres que deseen vender cosméticos.

Gracias a su trabajo puede ayudar a su esposo a mantener a sus hijos y pagar los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
The mother of three children--ages 17, 11 and 5--and only 38 years old, Maria del Rocío aspires to become a successful executive through her beauty product sales. She has been a beauty consultant for four years. She started with the idea of just trying it. Previously, she had worked for another woman in a small crafts workshop. Since her cosmetics sales went well, she decided to work solely on this. Now, she is applying to the cosmetics company to be the director of her own sales network. Thus, she would be in charge of her own small company, which she needs to formalize. In this endeavor, Maria would be in charge of providing training to new women who want to sell cosmetics. Thanks to her work, she is able to help her husband support their children and cover their household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Procedures to formalize company

loans.name: Sumina

texts.en:
Sumina lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. She is at one of the very busy bazaars of Lalitpur, and most of the people in this region are engaged in making metal kitchen utensils.

Sumina lives in a single family with her husband and two children. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade three and daughter is only a year old.

Her husband, Krishna S. makes different types of religious brass statues. He started this work more than 10 years ago. Now Sumina has also started doing this work. They make statues according to orders from dealers.

Now Sumina is requesting Rs25,000 to buy raw materials such as wax, bronze, etc. for statue making work.

loans.use: Buy raw materials for her work.

loans.name: Lilliam Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Lilliam labora como docente de la Escuela Cesar augusto Salinas Pinell en zona # 1 de zona Urbana de  Nueva Guinea desde  hace 15 años, es casada, tiene 2 hijos: el niño mayor  tiene 13 años estudia su 1er año de educación secundaria y la niña de 8 años estudia su 3er grado, su esposo  labora como director de una radio, viven en la zona # 1 de Nueva Guinea en un barrio creciente, ambos comparten los gastos familiares ya que son una familia bien unida que profesa la religion  evangelica, está solicitando  su 8vo refinanciamiento para invertirlo en  mejora de su vivienda como es repellar la casa.  Lilliam es una mujer profesional que ha luchado por seguir estudiando, actualmente esta terminando de estudiar una maestria en ciencias de la educacion,  se caracteriza por ser humilde responsable, honesta y con muncho deseos de superación profesional y laboral, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral, una vivienda bonita y que sus hijos estudien para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Dona Lilliam has worked as a teacher at the Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell school in the Urbana de Nueva Guinea neighborhood for 15 years. She is married and has 2 children, a 13 year old boy who is in his first year of high school and an 8 year old girl who is in the 3rd grade. Her husband is the director of a radio station. They live in the Nueva Guineau neighborhood, a growing area. They share family expenses because they're a close family, practicing evangelicals. She is applying for her 8th loan and will use it to improve her ramshackle house. Lilliam is a professional woman who has strived to continue her studies. She's now finishing a masters in education. She's humble, responsible, honest and strongly driven to exceed at work and her studies. Her dream is to have a steady job, a lovely house and that her children study to become people of note.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo.
Yolanda es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Yolanda viaja a la selva ayacuchana una vez por semana en donde vende abarrotes en  general y de allá trae café, cacao, maní que vende a los intermediarios.
Yolanda necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Yolanda sueña con mejorar su negocio, comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Desarrollo Microfinance Institute.

She is a 24-year-old with a live-in partner and two children. Yolanda travels to the Ayacucho jungle once a week to sell general provisions. From there, she brings coffee, cacao, and peanuts, which she then sells to middlemen.

Yolanda needs a 600.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing rice and sugar.

Yolanda dreams of improving her business and buying a plot of land so that she can have her house built.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap C. lives in Pour village in Takeo province and she is farmer. It is now the rainy season so she needs to cultivate rice. In order to grow rice, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farm. She would use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides and fuel to support her field.

Mrs. Sopheap C. is 27 years old and the mother of two children one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only four years old. Her husband, Mr. Nget Samith, is a grocer in the local village.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and fuel to support her field

loans.name: Natividad De Maria Group

texts.en:
The committee Natividad de Maria is in their second cycle and have a group savings of 800,000 Gs.  All of them are from the Guarambare zone at the center of San Lorenzo in Paraguay. They conduct many activities and meet weekly where they talk about their activities over the past week.  

1	Alicia D..	Cosmetic sales 
2	Emilia D..	Cosmetic sales 
3	Liz V..	General store and domestic employment 
4	Rufina G..	General store and food sales 
5	Pablina S..	Food sales 
6	Angelica M..	Cosmetic sales 
7	Eugenia T..	Food sales 
8	Maria S..	Diner 
9	Bilda Z..	Bar in a university 
10	Maria P..	General store 
11	Maria R. D..	Food sales 
12	De Jesus S..	Fabric store 
13	Lucila R. D..	Food sales 
14	Vidalia O..	Food sales 
15	Dorila G..	Cosmetic sales 
16	Doris O..	Milk sales 
17	Eugenia O..	Food sales

loans.use: Funds will go to the purchase of merchandise such as, vegetables, breads, milk, deodorants, various housewares, etc.

loans.name: Kwasi

texts.en:
Kwasi A. is forty-four years old. He is married and has three children: two sons and two daughters who are currently in the junior high and the primary schools. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. His wife is a trader.

Kwasi is also a trader, trading in cereals such as maize, etc. He buys his goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells at the market square in his community. He also treks to other markets to sell on their market days. He supplies to food vendors and retailers. He has been in business for over twelve years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. He aspires to expand his business and sponsor his children in school to the apex.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en: Adenike is 48 years old and married and with four children. She sells crates of drinks in retail and wholesale to her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thank you and promises to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Хамраев Уктам    -ему 40лет, живет с семьёй из 3их детей, женой, которая помогает ему в семейном деле. Они занимаются производством национальных лепешек на дому, у Уктама огромный тандыр,где он уже более 15 лет печёт лепёшки и продаёт их на базаре. В основном продавцы сами приходят и закупают всю лепёшку, а бывает что жена Рохатой  сама продаёт на базаре.Уктам закупает муку и дрова по оптовой цене и наш кредит очень помог ему при закупке сырья.Он рад что обратился в нашу организацию за кредитом.
texts.en:
Uktam H. is 40 years old. He lives with his family of 3 children and wife, who helps him with their family business. They make traditional flatbread at home and then sell it at a market. Uktam has a huge tandoori oven that he has used for over 15 years to bake flatbread. Usually retailers come and buy all of the flatbread from him, and sometimes Uktam's wife, Rohatoi, sells it herself at the market. Uktam buys flour and wood at a wholesale price, and our loan helped him with this purchase. He is glad that he came to our organization for a credit.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour and coal

loans.name: Nurjan's Group

texts.en:
The group’s leader, Nurjan, is forty-nine. She has raised three children. Her two daughters are married and live separately. Her son, 20, serves in the army.

Nurjan’s husband works as a director of rayon’s movie directorate. As for Nurjan, she is a housewife. However, even staying at home and doing her regular housewife’s duties; Nurjan manages to earn some money by selling milk. She sells up to ten liters daily, which allows her to make fifty dollars a month. It is a sizable amount of money, considering that they once invested just seventy dollars in buying a cow. And taking into account twenty years of a housewife’s life, it is largely due to these humble earnings of hers and of course her husband’s serious job that they have been able to refurnish their house, buy new domestic equipment, give their children a proper education and build a building opposite their house.

Nurjan has decided to diversify her daily routine by keeping sheep. She intends to fatten them and resell them. To do this, she is in need of a loan. Among her near-future plans is to marry off her son and build a new house.

Kamchybek, 37, is engaged in cattle breeding. He has a wife and three children. Even though his wife sells milk and thus contributes to the family’s budget, Kamchybek’s earnings are barely enough to support the whole family. He hopes to get a loan to buy materials for building a new shed.

Kalima, 57, is a mother of three children. Her spouse is a math teacher at school. Ten years ago, they bought a calf. Since then, Kalima has been selling milk. Kalima’s long-time dream has been to have a new bedroom suite. As Kalima earns a little, this loan might enable her dream to come true.

Asylkul, 52, is married. She has brought up four children. Currently she sells milk, making 85 dollars a month and otherwise stays at home. Her husband is a driver. Several years ago, she bought two lambs. After selling them Asylkul bought a calf and raised it. She needs a loan to buy five sheep.

====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to buy 5 sheep to fatten them and resell later

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 28 years old. She is the mother of two children. She is married to Jun-Jun T., who works as security guard somewhere in Bulacan. Their two children are Kristine, age 8, who is in grade 3, and John Benedict, age 6, who is in grade 2. They reside peacefully in Barangay Nungnungan in Cauayan City. 

Elizabeth has been managing a food processing business for 3 years. She processes sliced carabao (domesticated water buffalo) meat, from which she generates a weekly net income of PHP 1,500 that they use for their family's basic needs and for the education of their children. She has also been managing a livestock business for almost 8 years and also sometimes sells vegetables and fish in her vending stall. She wants to borrow  PHP 15,000 from Kiva lenders to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Lea

texts.en: Lea R., age 27, is married and resides with her two children in Kompong Chnang province, Cambodia. R. has a business selling fruit, earning approximately $2.50 of profit per day, while her husband has a business of providing transportation services to people in the town and other nearby local markets in the province, typically earning about US$5 per day. He also rents big speakers, amplifiers, and sound mixers to people in his village when they celebrate any ceremony. Their standard of living has improved since they have had these businesses, so they want to take out a loan to expand their businesses. R. wants to take out a loan of US $900 to purchase more speakers and sound mixers to rent in order to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy speakers and sound mixers.

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
Zenobia es socia del Banco Comunal Kallpanchik que significa Nuestra Fuerza en quechua.
Zenobia es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 4 hijos, Zenobia viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende abarrotes en general, sus productos los reparte por mayor a las tiendas.
Zenobia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Zenobia sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una tienda estable.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz y azúcar.

loans.name: Freda

texts.en: Freda is 45 years old and a married mother with three children. Her children are currently in school. Freda sells frozen foods in the local market to support her family.  She says demand for fish is high but she does not have sufficient operating capital to meet these demands. She wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of frozen foods like chicken, pork, beef, fishes to enable her raised enough income to support her children education.

loans.use: To purchase frozen foods in bulk.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 36 years old and married with five children. She is a focused, hard worker. She has a grocery at the front of her house where she sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Las rosquillas somoteñas son las mejores rosquillas de Nicaragua y son comercializadas tanto en Somoto como en los diferentes departamentos del país. En el mercado Mayoreo, la señora Candida R. se dedica a la venta de rosquillas somoteñas ofrecidas en su establecimiento donde diario es visitada por muchos clientes para comprar las rosquillas.

Ella solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de las rosquillas y de esta manera continuar ofreciéndolas para continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar compuesto por sus tres hijos ya que ella es viuda y tiene la responsabilidad de mantenerlos.
texts.en:
The rosquillas somoteñas (a ring-shaped cookie) are Nicaragua's best and they are available not only in Somoto as but in the other departments of the country as well. Candida R. daily sells rosquillas somoteñas in a stall she has in the Mayoreo market to many customers who visit her to buy rosquillas. She is requesting funding to buy the rosquillas so that she can continue to offer them for sale thus earning profits with which to support her family of three children since she is a widow and solely responsible for their support.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rosquillas (a ring-shaped cookie)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy palm nuts to process and sell palm oil

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Martha del Socorro O. B., tiene 37 años de edad vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte este es un Barrio que carece la seguridad y un buen ambiente familiar, ella es madre soltera de tres hijos, quienes tienen las edades de 21, 16 y 14 años de edad  el menor estudia y los otros dos trabajan por su cuenta, Doña Martha anhela el poder realizar mejoras en su hogar y así poder ofrecerles un ambiente optimo a toda su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 6 años, pues su modesto puesto de tortillas carece de las buenas condiciones para poder realizar su labores sobre todo cuando llega el invierno se moja toda y por esta razón solicito de un préstamo para poder realizar mejoras en su puesto de trabajo con el crédito planea comprar materiales de construcción tales como hierro, cemento y zinc. Esta será la primera etapa de estas mejoras que realizará, los beneficios que obtendrá tras estos cambios serian significativos puesto que podrá elaborar mas tortillas por que tendrá las facilidades para realizarlos, esto a largo plazo le beneficiara a todo la familia en un cambio sustancial económicamente y socialmente.
texts.en:
Martha del Socorro O. B. is 37 years of age and lives in the Barrio Laureles Norte district. This is a district with precarious security and it is not the ideal family environment. She is a single mother of three children ages 21, 16 and 14. The youngest is attending school, while the two eldest are self-employed. Martha would like to perform some house improvements and so be able to offer her family a more confortable place to live. She has sold tortillas for six years, but her tortillas stand is now in bad condition and not adequate for the business, in particular during the winter season, when she gets completely wet because of the weather conditions. She is now requesting a loan to improve her working place; she will use it to buy construction materials, such as iron, cement and zinc. This will be the first step towards improvement, as the new conditions of her working place will allow her to prepare more tortillas and in the long term this will lead to a substantial financial and social change for the entire family.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana A. M. de 33 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilopango, vive junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como conductor de pick up, los cuales hacen viajes hacia el lago de Ilopango; así mismo vive junto a sus dos hijas menores de edad, las cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tienda en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad, a pesar que cuenta con mucha competencia, Roxana no pierde la esperanza de poder mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, ya que ella cuenta con la necesidad de mejorar su economía familiar y poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijas. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos de primera necesidad, de manera que logre surtir en lo más posible la tienda y de esta manera ser la primera opción para todas las personas del lugar.
texts.en:
Roxana A. M., 33, lives in Ilopango with her husband, who is a pick-up driver, that makes trips towards Lake Ilopango. She has two, minor daughters, who are in schools. She has a grocery store where she sells basic needs items. Despite having a lot of competition, Roxana doesn't lose hope of being able to improve her business's condition because she needs to improve her family's economic situation to provide her daughters with all they need. For this reason, she is requesting funding to buy more stock items so that her store will be more productive and become the first choice for shoppers in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic needs items.

loans.name: Annielice's Group

texts.en: Annielice R. is from the village of Punit, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is 56 years old and is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Annielice R.' Group. Annielice is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling eggs in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Annielice joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Annielice is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: The Womens Bank To Build The Future Group

texts.en:
This group’s name translates as “The Womens Bank to Build the Future”. The group members live in Sarapiqui, Heredia, a rural region close to the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. The group members will use this loan for general investments in productive activities such as the rearing and selling of chickens and the purchase and sale of colognes and perfumes.

Christina A. V. is the president of this group. She is always busy and engages in many economically productive activities such as curtain sewing, nail painting, selling retail products and poultry. This loan will be used for the purchase of chicks as well as feed for the rearing and sale of her poultry.

Christina aspires to open a store one day where she can offer a range of services and products to her clients. She says her only obstacle is financial and that she works with her husband as a team: when Christina needs to work, her husband watches their daughter and vice versa (he is a taxi driver and farmer).

Dinia Gisselle G. G. is a 33-year-old mother who lives with her family in Sarapiqui. She has a business selling men’s and women’s colognes and perfumes in her community. She started her business with an initial investment of 100,000 colons. Her husband´s work requires him to travel to Panama roughly every fifteen days. In Panama the prices for quality perfume and cologne products is much less than in Sarapiqui. For example, a name brand perfume that sells for 12,000 colons in Panama sells for 22,000 colons in Sarapiqui.

Dinia has been selling perfumes and colognes for five years. She spends her days traveling to homes and restaurants in Sarapiqui, offering products to potential clients. She collects orders from her clients which she passes on to her husband who makes the necessary purchases when he arrives in Panama. Dinia says her business is growing; she wants to expand operations as the income she earns contributes significantly to her family’s standard of living.

Dinia knows that she faces much competition in her community; there are many women selling similar products. As a result, she strives to provide superior service to her clients by bringing them all the products they request.

Sometimes, Dinia’s clients have trouble paying for an item in full. In these cases Dinia organizes flexible payment schedules to suit the needs of her client. She hopes to one day open a store where she could sell not only perfumes and colognes, but clothing and cosmetics as well.

Dinia hopes that “The Womens Bank to Build the Future” will expand and acquire more members from the community.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Ronard

texts.en: Ronard is the 43-year-old father of five children who are in school. He owns a welding and fabrication business in Nairobi and says he has been doing well in his business. He has requested his first loan of Kes. 30,000 to buy a place to display his wares. He describes himself as a man of excellence and hopes to excel in business and get big contracts for his welding business.

loans.use: Buy a place to display his wares

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 33-year-old married man with 3 young children. He has been working as a taxi driver since 1998, servicing his town and its surroundings. In addition, he offers private transportation services upon request of his clients. He is always trying to work long hours to earn enough income to be able to pay for his children's school fees. 

Fadi has requested a loan of $1,000 to carry out maintenance work on his car. He wants to increase its safety features and offer comfortable transportation to his customers.

loans.use: To carry out maintenance work on his car

loans.name: Asca Bekyibei

texts.en:
Asca T., 56, is married and the mother of seven lovely children. She lives in Kipsangui, Eldoret area. She owns a ten acre plot where she plants maize for resale. Most of her customers are her neighbors. She has been in the farming business for three years now, however, she also sells milk and passion fruits. 

Asca was introduced to KADET by an existing client. She has applied for a loan which she will use to buy fertilizers and maize seedlings. 

Asca's immediate goal is to buy another ten acre plot of land to increase her production and, therefore, get more income with which to feed her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and maize seedlings.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa B., from the village of Upper Lamac Oroquieta City, is 48 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Narcisa owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling snacks and other delicacies such as rice cake and other foods in the local community. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 1200 PHP a month.

In 2007, Narcisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC, she is now requesting a new loan, her seventh, of 6000 PHP to further invest in her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Los Unicos Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimiento LOS UNICOS esta esta conformado 8 integrantes se encuentran en su primer ciclo, son nuevos todos viven en la misma zona en el barrio El Carmen, cuentan con negocio propio hace  dos años en el km 9 camino a Santa C..

La Sra. LIZETH es la presidenta dle banco fue elegida por su responsabilidad compañerismo y solidaridad que demostro en el trato a las socias, la Sra. Lizeth se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos por catalogo de una prestigios empresa a nivel Mundial, con el dinero del credito comprara cosmeticos que se  encuentran en promocion, las revistas sacan productos en promocion que se encuentran mas baratos que el precio original y siguiente publicacion el producto que estaba mas barato, en la nueva publicacion esta mas caro, y asi ella obtiene una ganancia extra.
 

Las socias de este banco de emprendimiento en su gran mayoria son Padres de Familia y son personas muy luchadoras ellos tienen el sueño de que sus negocios engrandesca y ser muy exitosos, y asi poder mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia, ellos se encuentran agradecidos con la institucion por brindarles la confianza en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The venture bank group Los Unicos is comprised of eight members in their first cycle. They all live in the same neighborhood in El Carmen, nine kilometers from Santa C.. They have had their own business for two years. Lizeth is the president of the bank group. She was chosen for her responsibility, camaraderie, and solidarity, which she has demonstrated in her treatment of the other members. Lizeth sells catalog cosmetics from a prestigious worldwide company. With this loan, she will buy cosmetics on sale. The magazines promote products much cheaper than their original prices, and in subsequent publications the cheaper products become much more expensive, and this is how she makes an extra profit. The majority of the members of this venture bank group are heads of family and they are fighters. They dream that their businesses will expand and be very successful, and then they will be able to improve the quality of life for all their families. They are grateful to the institution for having the confidence in them to loan them credit.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 35 years old. He is married to a business lady and they have six children. He is a member of Tushauriane Self Help Group where he gets his loans guaranteed.

Charles has been operating a retail shop in Nairobi for two years as well as a barber shop. He says that since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to save money.

Charles has requested a loan of Kes 50,000 to add stock to his retail shop such as sugar, flour, cooking fat and other products. He describes himself as hardworking and hopes to grow his business into a wholesale operation.

loans.use: To add to his stock of sugar, flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita L. is a 68-year old married woman who lives in San Francisco, Santa Catalina, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by engaging in a fishing business.

Florita’s 40 year old husband, Lowim, owns and manages his own bakery business. They have 3 adult children. 

Florita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a fishing business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP20,000 from her business activities.

Florita is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of PHP19,000 was used to fund the operations of her fishing business, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 18th cycle loan, the amount of PHP19,000, which she intends to use on her fishing business. Florita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Felicite

texts.en:
Felicite is 48 years old, married with 9 children who are between 7 and 28 years old.  Felicite is commonly known in the business of selling Irish potatoes, and she has been in this business for about three years.  Felicite starts her business from 7 am and goes to 4 pm every day.

After realizing her inefficiency at satisfying the demand of her customers, Felicite is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Felicite will hopefully earn more profit and this profit will allow her to reinvest more in her business.  Through the earned profits, Felicite will also start saving for her future as well as improving the lifestyle of her family.

loans.use: buying a large quantity of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Mazalou

texts.fr: G. mazalo est une femme mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de  sorad à Lomé. Son époux est un chauffeur. Depuis 2003 elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois. Elle s’approvisionne au nord du Togo car la bas le sac de charbon de bois est moins coûteux. Elle fait son commerce à la devanture de sa maison. Son stock est en baisse elle veut le rehausser et elle demande donc son deuxième prêt à WAGES afin de s’acheter  30 sacs de charbons de bois et assurer le transport de la marchandise.
texts.en:
Mazalo G. is married and has three children. She lives with her family in the Sorad neighborhood of Lome. Her husband is a driver. Since 2003 she has made her living selling charcoal. She buys it in northern Togo where it is cheaper. She sells by the roadside in front of her house. Since her stock is low, she wants to rebuild it. That is why she is asking for a second loan from WAGES to buy 30 sacks of charcoal and to pay for its transportation.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy charcoal

loans.name: Josphat Kauria

texts.en:
Josphat Kauria Mpurunyuk is 28 years old. He is married to Joyce and the father of three school-going children. He is a farmer and has been farming on his own piece of land for the last five years.

He learned about KADET from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his community. This will be his first loan which he is planning to use to buy fertilizer and chemicals for his potato farm. Potatoes have been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Josphat's dreams are to do large scale farming and also to start dairy farming. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chemicals for his potato farm

loans.name: Romel

texts.es: Romel solicito un  300 $us, para la compra de repuestos de movilidad.  y así  mejorar su servicio para con sus clientes, ya que por el constante uso  su minibús presenta fallas mecánicas; su esposa se dedica al cuidado de su hijo. Es el primer crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva. La familia vive en la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
Romel requests a loan of $300 US to purchase spare parts for his minibus, so that he will improve service to his clients. He is in constant use of the minibus and it is showing some mechanical problems. His wife is dedicated to the care of their son. This is his first loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner). The family lives in the city of La Paz.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To carry out maintenance repairs to his minibus.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
This is Jeanette S., a 41-year-old resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Precilo S., a mason. She is the mother of four children, one of whom is already working while the other three are still in school, one in college and the other two in high school. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her remaining children all the way through college - a dream for most Filipino parents like Jeanette as she herself was an elementary graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Jeanette operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from those round, palm-sized ones to the much larger doormats, braided quilts and bed sheets, and other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Besides rugs, Jeanette also retails bulk charcoal to her neighbors to be used as fuel for old-fashioned stoves. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and newspapers for patterns. She will also invest a portion of the loan to bulk buy sacks of charcoal to be repackaged and sold. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Jeanette dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and newspapers for patterns. She will also invest a portion of the loan to bulk buy sacks of charcoal to be repackaged and sold.

loans.name: Noe

texts.es: El señor Noe trabaja en una Maquiladora de la localidad y su esposa la señora Mayra, trabaja como empleada domestica en una casa habitación. Ellos tienen dos hijos pequeños. El señor Noe adquirió una vivienda de interés social y el motivo por el cual están solicitando este crédito es por que quieren ampliar el baño para la mejor comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Noe works in a factory in his region and his wife Mayra works in the private home cleaning industry. They have two small children. Noe was given a house from community housing and the reason he requests a loan is to improve their bathroom, for the family's greater comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bathroom.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariana de 37 años, es comerciante informal de ropa, vive con sus hijos de 16 y 14 años en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral rodeada del estero salado de Guayaquil. 

Hace 6 años atrás su esposo solventaba la economía de su casa mientas que ella estudiaba y atendía a sus hijos, pero el falleció y ella tubo que hacerse cargo de los gastos de su familia vendiendo ropa. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora vendiendo ropa como comerciante informal para poder mantener a sus hijos. las blusas las vende a $ 20.00, pantalones a $ 30.00 etc. 

Para seguir con su negocio de ropa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y otra parte dedicarla para mejorar su casa comprando cemento, bloques y pinturas.
texts.en:
Mariana, 37 years old, is an informal clothing merchant who lives with her children, ages 16 and 14, in an area called Perimetral, surrounded by Guayaquil's salt marsh. Some 6 years ago, her husband covered household expenses while she studied and cared for their children. But he died and she had to take charge of family costs by selling clothes. From that time until today, she has sold clothes as an informal merchant to be able to maintain her children. She sells blouses for $20, pants for $30, etc. To continue with her clothing business, she wishes, with this loan, to buy clothes to sell, and also, to buy materials to improve her house, including cement, blocks, and paint.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CEMENT AND PAINT FOR HER HOUSE AND CLOTHING TO SELL

loans.name: Señor Cautivo De Ayabaca Group

texts.es: La señora Nancy tiene 37 años y vive en la zona “F”, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales aun tiene a cargo a uno, es presidenta del Grupo: “Señor Cautivo de Ayabaca”  que está conformado por 10 vecinas y llevan 4 años trabajando con Edaprospo. Nancy tiene una bodega en la que vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, fideos, conservas y bebidas, comenzó desde hace tres años vendiendo queso y carne y poco ah poco lo ah ido implementando, con su esfuerzo y la ayuda de capital de Edaprospo ah comprado su propio terreno y mantenido su hogar, además de pagar los estudios de su hijo. En el futuro espera agrandar su negocio y poner una distribuidora de cerveza para mejorar la vida de su familia y comenzar la construcción de su casa, pero para esto necesita que Edaprospo le brinde más habilitaciones.
texts.en: Nancy is 37 years old and she lives in Zone F. She is single and she has 3 children, though only one is still in her care. She is the leader of the group named Senor Cautivo de Ayacaba. The group is made up of 10 neighbors that have worked for the past 4 years with Edaprospo (Kiva Field Partner). Nancy has a grocery store where she sells every day products such as rice, pasta, jams, and soft drinks. With a great deal of effort and with a capital fund loan from Edaprospo she has been able to purchase a plot of land and she has supported her family. She has also managed to pay the tuition expenses for her son. In the future she hopes to expand her business and set up a beer distribution company. She will improve the quality of life for her family and she will be able to start building a house for herself. But she will need continued support from Edaprospo to reach these goals.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Gereltsogt

texts.en:
Gereltsogt H. is a 34 year old widower who lives with his 8 year old daughter in Uvs province of Mongolia. He and his daughter live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian home tent. His wife passed away 3 years ago. The family had been happily living in the countryside, leading a nomadic lifestyle, until the tragic incident happened to his family.

After that, he sold all his livestock and moved to his current town. He began his taxi service in 2007, after purchasing a new car, and has built a stable operation over the years. Gereltsogt earns a monthly average profit of 180,000 MNT. With his earning, he was able to start building a house for his family. He works hard to finish construction of his house by next year. He is a very modest man and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase winter tires for his car and necessary materials for his house, which is under construction.

loans.use: To purchase winter tires and materials.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita S. is from Molicay, Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old. Perlita is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Perlita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Perlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Perlita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.
