This loan will be the second loan taken out by Perlita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: El Gran Esfuerzo 4 Group

texts.es:
Rosa es una de los miembros del Grupo El Gran Esfuerzo, localizado en La ciudad de Hato Mayor, cuya economia depende de la agricultura y es una de las ciudades mas rurales de República Dominicana, en donde como muchas hay escasez de agua potable y de energía electrica y con una poblacion de dominicanos y emigrantes haitianos. Sus actividades principales son las ventas de ropas. Rosa es madre de 1 hijo, y viven junto a ella y su padre. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil son seguir trabajando duro para poder estar tranquila y descansar cuando cumpla mas años y tambien poder ayudar a sus hijos. Le encanta asistir a la Iglesia.

Rosa está muy emocionada de recibir su Decimo préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente su préstamos anteriores y asi haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 10 años, el cual inició con un pequeño ahorro, que guardaba para fines de negocio. Está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de diferentes modelos y estilos de ropa. Planea utilizar sus ganancias para comprar cosas que necesita y hacer mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is one of the members of 'El Gran Esfuerzo' (The Big Effort) group which is located in the town of Hato Mayor.  The town's economy depends on farming and it is one of the most rural towns in the Dominican Republic.  As in many other towns, there is a scarcity of drinking water and electricity and a population of Dominicans and emigrant Haitians.  The group's main business activity is selling clothes.

Rosa has one child and they live together with her father.  She tells us that her greatest challenges are to continue working hard so that she can be relaxed and rest when she is older, and also to help her children.  She loves going to church.

Rosa is very excited to be receiving her tenth loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having satisfactorily paid off her previous loans and thereby given a step forward in the growth of her business.  She has had her business for around 10 years.  She set up her business with a small amount of savings which she was keeping for business purposes.  She is planning to invest her new loan in buying different styles of clothes.  She plans to use her profits to buy things which she needs and make improvements to her home.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Inda

texts.en:
Inda I. is a married woman who lives in Tagdalungon, Brgy. Rio-Tuba, Bataraza, Palawan. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  dried fish selling and food vending.  Her husband Abdurahman I., who is 57 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 6 children who are 10 to 25 years old. 

Inda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Inda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000 which she intends to use as additional capital for food processing so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and the education of her children. Inda I. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund operations of dried fish business

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand V. is from the village of Benito, Soliven, Isabela. He is 36 years old. Ferdinand is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ferdinand owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Ferdinand has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 32,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Ferdinand joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ferdinand has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Ferdinand is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ferdinand from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About the Kiva's Field Partner, ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 42 years old and married with three school-aged children who all attend school. He is a farmer from Murang'a town in central Kenya where he has been farming for 20 years and employs five farmhands. His mixed farm produces coffee, horticultural products and milk which he sells to the local market and through Kenya Co-operative Creameries. He depends solely on the income from his farming activities to cater for his family's basic needs.

He has requested this loan of 53,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve his family's livelihood. He faces the challenge of a lack of veterinary services. He hopes to acquire five more high-yielding dairy cows in future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Merha May

texts.en:
Merha May S. is from the village of Gata Daku Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Merha May is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Merha May owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Merha May has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 30000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Merha May joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merha May has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Merha May is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP which will be used to repair her motorcycle to provide better service. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Merha May from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Khaled

texts.ar:
خالد في عمر 37 سنة متزوج وله 5 اولاد يعمل في محل لبيع خردوات السيارات له في عمله 15 سنة يحب عمله ويريد تطويره
يسعى وراء لقمة العيش وتحسين وضع اولاده وتطوير نفسه في المجتمع يتميز بالتوسع في العمل حيث انك تلقى لديه جميع قطع السيارات
يريد طلب قرض من المجموعة بهدف توسيع المحل وتركيب استندات + سقف للمحل بهدف زيادة الخردوات في المحل
texts.en: Khaled, 37, is married with 5 children. He works at a shop that sells auto accessories. He likes his business, where he has been working for 15 years. He works hard to earn his living, in order to improve his own status as well as his children's in society. He works in various types of auto accessories. Khaled wants to get a loan from A. Majmoua to expand his shop and install a roof as well as shelves so that he can increase his products.

loans.use: Install a roof and shelves for his shop

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.en: Guillermina is 60 years old, married, and has seven children who are all in school. She is using her loan of 1,500 PEN towards the construction of a new house. She is a member of the communal bank "Kausachun" and has been with FINCA Peru for one year, after being introduced by her sister. She has used past loans to purchase grocery products to sell in her store in Pueblo Sucre, several hours outsiD. of Ayacucho.

loans.use: Construction materials for a new house

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita H. de 65 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, ubicado en el departamento de Morazán, ella es una mujer casada quien vive únicamente junto a su esposo. A su edad, Felicita debe esforzarse a diario por poder salir adelante, por lo que se dedica a la venta de perfumes para hombres y mujeres, cremas y desodorantes, los cuales comercializa en su casa de habitación, y así mismo los comercializa de forma ambulante, con sus vecinos y amigos, entre los cuales ya cuenta con varios clientes fijos. Felicita solicita un préstamo a Integral con el enorme deseo de mejorar su negocio, surtiéndolo con cantidad de marcas de perfumes en diversidad de precios, de forma que pueda contar con un mercado más amplio y de esta manera aumentar sus ventas, lo cual es muy importante para ella.
texts.en:
65-year old Felicita H. lives in San Francisco Gotera which is located in Morazán department with her husband. Even at her age, Felicita makes an effort to make progress in life so she sells colognes and perfumes for men and women as well as lotions and deodorants from her home. She also goes house to house selling to neighbours and friends amongst whom she has many regular customers.

Felicita is seeking a loan from Kiva partner Apoyo Integral as she has a great desire to improve her business by stocking it with a range of brands at different prices. This way she would have a wider market and be able to increase sales--which is very important to her.

loans.use: purchase of more perfumes to sell

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Eleloh

texts.en:
Eleloh is married and has 3 children, all of whom attend school. His wife operates a food stall and supports the upbringing of the children. Eleloh has been operating a butcher shop for the last 3 years; his local residents are his potential customers. 

With the loan he is requesting, Eleoh wants to start a barber shop business and purchase a hair-cutting machine to increase his monthly profits. Eleloh dreams of establishing a beauty salon in the future. He decided to work with Yehu because of its loan efficiency.

loans.use: to start a barber shop business and purchase a hair-cutting machine

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo S. Jr. is from the village of Santo Niño, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. He is 30 years old. Rodrigo is married and has an infant child. Rodrigo owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorela or habal-habal (motorcycle transport) services to local community members. Rodrigo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Rodrigo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. He has successfully repaid his last loan from HSPFI, which was for 5,000 PHP and was used to purchase tools needed to provide service.

This loan will be his second from HSPFI. Rodrigo is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase tools & utilities needed for the maintenance of the service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools & utilities needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is 28 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom go to school. She is currently in the business of selling fish. Flora has taken a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is married and has one child. For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She sells lesos (kangas), the Kenyan women's attire wrapped around the waist. Najma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent bills. She dreams of prospering in her business and building her own house. 

Najma is requesting a loans for 40,000 KES, which she will use to purchase bundles of lesos (kangas), cloth materials, and curtains. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of lesos (kangas), cloth materials, and curtains.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 29 years old and is a married woman. She has two children aged 10 and 3. Her husband works as a farmer and security guard.

Marites is also a farmer. She helps her husband till their farm where they grow rice crops. According to Marites, their current earnings are about $150 per month. She does her best to keep their farm productive. She applied for a loan and plans to use it to purchase three sacks of seed and six sacks of fertilizers. Marites hopes for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of seeds and 6 sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
35-year-old Linda earns a living through farming. She tills her own land where she grows rice crops to sell. She earns about $150 per month from doing this farming. Her loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Linda works hard to support her family. She has five children, the oldest of whom is only 12 years old. Linda hopes for her children to have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Vladimer

texts.en:
Vladimer comes from the village of Martkopi, Gardabani District. He is married and lives with his wife Nina, son and mother. Nina works as a teacher in a local school. Vladimer’s son is a joiner and works in his own workshop. Vladimer has a minibus; he drives passengers on the Martkopi – Lilo line. This line is always crowded, because Lilo is a wholesale centre of East Georgia and people from Martkopi and nearby villages often travel there for shopping purposes. Recently, Vladimer’s minibus had some problems and he had to stop work. He needs to repair his minibus in order to continue provision of quality transportation services to villagers.
Vladimer has requested credit to repair his minibus, which is an important source of income for him and his family. A small part of the credit will be used to renovate part of his house.

loans.use: to pay for minibus repairs and materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Degnon Group

texts.fr: DEGNON est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la  présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Valérie. Les membres du groupe appartiennent à la même Eglise. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Valérie est née le 07 Avril 1972 au Bénin. Valérie est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Victorin. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et vivant ensemble avec eux. Après avoir arrêté l’école au cours secondaire, Valérie a commencer depuis treize ans, la vente de charbon de bois à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Valérie vend des biscuits. Valérie s'approvisionne dans l'un des marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à ainsi assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Ce troisième prêt permettra certainement à Valérie et aux autres membres du groupe DEGNON de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
DEGNON is a group made up of three people whose president (the one who is raising her hand in the photo) is called Valérie. The members of the group belong to the same church. In order to grow their working capital, this group is asking for their third loan from ALIDé. 

Valérie was born on April 7, 1972 in Bénin. She is married to a carpenter named Victorin. The couple have two children, both enrolled in school, and live together with their children. Valérie began selling charcoal at her home 13 years ago. Secondarily, she sells cookies. She buys her supplies in a market in Bénin. This activity generates revenue that she uses to help support the family. This third loan will certainly permit Valérie and the other members of the group called DEGNON to expand their business and grow their clientele and their revenue.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Bon Berger Group

texts.fr: La cliente Odette, vice présidente du groupe d’affaire « Bon berger »,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 45 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants, tous étudient et d’autres ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Elle est  vendeuse de beignet et sociétaire d’un publiphone. Son mari est un technicien électricien indépendant. Elle vend ses marchandises au long de la route principale Goma-Sake, à proximité d’une buvette. Il y a 10 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  6 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  2 sacs de farine, 2 bidons d’huile végétales, 50 kg de sucres, les unités flash de 100 dollars rechargeables.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et acheter une parcelle pour y construire confortablement.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Bon berger » est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: The client Odette, vice president of the "Good Shepherd" business group is a 45 year old married entrepreneur, and the mother of 6 children all of whom are educated and some of whom already have their own households.  She sells fritters and is a co-owner of a payphone.  Her husband is an independent electrical technician.  She sells her merchandise along the principal route, Goma-Sake, near a refreshment are.  She has run this business for ten years.  She has fulfilled six loans cycles through loans from Hekima.  This new loan will allow her to stock up with 2 bags of flour, 2 drums of vegetable oil, 50 kg of sugar, and rechargeable calling cards in 100 dollar units.  Moreover, she hopes to educated her children and buy a plot of land to construct a home comfortably.  The client thanks Hekima for its actions to help poor women who are normally excluded by classic banks.  It may be noted that the "Good Shepherd" business group is made up, for the most part, of women..

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of flour, 2 drums of vegetable oil, 50 kg of sugar and rechargeable cards cards in 100 dollars units.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su esposa y 3 hijos en una comunidad en vías de desarrollo perteneciente a la provincia de Morropón en Piura.

Cesar se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas, desde hace 2 años. Esta labor la realiza en su comunidad y en los centros poblados alrededor de esta. Cesar cuenta con clientela establecida y este negocio le ha traído ganancias que le han  permitido ir mejorando su calidad de vida.

Él solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para invertir en su negocio, comprando fruta al contado. Además realizará algunos arreglos al interior de su casa.

Este préstamo le sería de gran ayuda y Cesar estaría muy agradecido de concedérselo.
texts.en:
Cesar is 49 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a developing community in Morropón Province in Piura.

He has been buying and selling fruits for two years. Cesar works in his community and in the surrounding areas. He has an established customer base and the income generated from his business enables him to improve his quality of life.

Cesar is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that he can invest in his business. He plans to buy fruit and pay with cash. In addition, he plans to make a few repairs to the interior of his house. This loan will be a great help and Cesar is very grateful.

loans.use: to buy fruit and to make a few home repairs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, 46, is from Victory Sur Santiago City. She has three children and she owns a small, home-based retail store. She’s gradually been reinvesting her profits into it. She’s been acquiring new customers and now her store is profitable. She has run this business for almost five years and she earns about PHP 15,000 a month. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy inventory such as assorted biscuits, shampoo, oils, milk, soft drinks and sugar for her retail shop business. She wants to use this investment to keep the store well-stocked to meet customer demand and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as assorted biscuits, shampoo, oils, milk, soft drinks and sugar for her retail shop business.

loans.name: Ángel Bolívar

texts.es:
Ángel Bolívar  tiene 52 años soltero tiene una hija pero no vive con él, vive en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVA UNION se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao, arroz, naranja, plátano, café.

 Ángel Bolívar se dedica al cultivo de cacao, maíz,  arroz y plátano. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo cada fin de semana. 

Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos e insumos, fertilizantes, abonos agrícolas. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es  comprar mas terreno para seguir cultivando y aumentar los ingresos.

Le gusta  salir de paseo con la hija y festejar las fiestas del recinto.
texts.en:
Ángel Bolívar, 52, is single.  He has a daughter but she doesn’t live with him.  He lives in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Nueva Unión” (New Union) communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish belonging to Chillanes Canton.  The members of this communal bank are farmers, especially of corn, cocoa beans, rice, oranges, bananas and coffee.

Ángel Bolívar grows cocoa beans, corn, rice and bananas.  He makes his purchases and his sales at the San José del Tambo market every weekend.

He requests the loan to buy farming supplies: fertilizer and manure.  The loan will help him meet his economic needs and improve his farming activities.  He faces challenges like the fall in price of the products he sells and dealing with middlemen. 

His dream is to buy more land to continue farming and increasing income.  He enjoys going on outings with his daughter and celebrating the hamlet’s festivals.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Yon is an old father of three children living in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Presently, he is a farmer. He is married to Keo who has been generating her income by selling soft drinks and groceries. From this business, his wife gains about $2 each day. His wife wants to expand her business but she lacks capital, so she has decided with him to request some funds through HKL's partner Kiva to purchase more soft drinks and groceries. His wife believes that this loan will make her business grow, gain more profit and meet prosperity.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and groceries.

loans.name: Julia Esperanza

texts.es:
Julia, vive con una hija D. 19 años D. edad, administra una tienda donD. ofrece artículos D. primera necesidad, ella tiene 20 años D. estar administrando el negocio, este surgió por iniciativa propia y con el apoyo D. su esposo, el horario es D. 7:00am a 7:00pm.
Actualmente necesita comprar mercadería como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, pan y huevos, esta inversión aumentara el inventario y mejorara la atención a los clientes.
Su aspiración es que el negocio sea cada día más rentable, que se pueda sostener y brindar lo necesario para su familia.
texts.en:
Julia lives with a 19 year old daughter and runs a shop offering basic products. She has been running the business for 20 years and it was her own initiative with the support of her husband. The shop is open from 7am to 7pm.
Currently she needs to buy merchandise such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, bread and eggs. This investment will increase her stock and improve her customer service.
Her ambition is for her business to be more profitable every day, to allow her to support herself and afford what her family needs.

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, sugar, oil, bread and eggs for her business.

loans.name: 03.08.87 Thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Thuận works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future. She has been involved in this business for 9 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is 45 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in the Thiệu Hóa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.

In 2003, Thuận  joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 7 loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 87 Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

With her business profit, Thuận hopes to provide for her kid, to remodel her house, and to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 31-year-old married woman with three children. The family lives in a semi-permanent house. Joyce's dream is to set up a good home in a permanent house.
 
She has been selling used clothes for the last eight years. Joyce needs the loan to buy used clothes to resell.

Her challenge has been the rainy season, which damages her business. Her dream is to operate from enclosed premises.

loans.use: to buy used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Dolgorsuren is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a  ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Her husband works in the city and stays at home during winter. Her kids are school students. She started her vegetable trading business in 2007 by renting a counter in the market. In addition, she plants potatoes in 100m2 (100 square meters). Now that her business is stable enough, she wants to build a small warehouse to broaden her range of products to retail. She is a strong and diligent woman who says, "during winter time, vegetable prices will increase therefore, I need to build a small warehouse to store my supplies". She is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to build a warehouse.

loans.use: To build a warehouse to store her supplies

loans.name: Pierre Celestin

texts.en:
Pierre Celestin is married with 9 children. He has been a maize farmer for 25 years.  He would like a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides to grow his crop.

He will use the Kiva loan to cover labor costs and fertilizer costs during maize production. They need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production.
 
With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides to grow his crop.

loans.name: Luz Clarita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ CLARITA” iniciará su cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal German Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora María Isabel. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Tejido, venta de comida, tienda de estuco, venta de CD’s, tejido en macramé.

La señora María Isabel,  indica que hace dos años trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de promotores. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de estuco que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su esposo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de estuco) que comprara de las personas que le traen de provincia  y posteriormente lo venderá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.

En la fotografía acompaña al grupo la hija de una de las socias que se encuentra detras de la señora de manta verde
texts.en:
The communal bank "Luz Clarita" ("Clear Light") will take out their fourth loan cycle through Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch regional office.  The group is composed of eight members and is directed by a board led by Maria Isabel.  The businesses undertaken by the members of the communal bank are varied; they include weaving, sales of food, a stucco store, sales of CDs, and macrame.  

Maria Isabel says that she began working in Pro Mujer two years ago and that she became involved with the organization at the invitation of promoters.  She has a business that sells stucco, which she has been doing for years, learning the trade from her husband.

This loan is to increase her working capital (to purchase stucco), which she will buy from people who bring it from the province.  Afterward, she will sell it in her sales space.  This work allows her to earn income to support her family, as she lives with her partner and has five children.     

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Maria Isabel responds that she likes the subject of health.  

In the photograph, the daughter of one of the partners appears behind the woman in the green shawl.

loans.use: To buy stucco.

loans.name: Cyprian

texts.en:
Cyprian is 41 years old, married and has 6 children.  He lives in Hioma, Uganda.  Cyprian deals in charging batteries for vehicles and has been in this business for 5 years.  He is faced with a challenge of theft of batteries.  His business goal is to expand business into new markets and his personal goal is to educate his children.

Cyprian needs a loan to buy distilled water used in batteries.

loans.use: buy distilled water for batteries

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es:
Jose, se dedica a la venta de verduras, está soltero, el negocio lo administra en el mercado municipal, de manera ambulante, no tiene un horario establecido y sus ingresos depende únicamente de las ventas.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de verdura fresca como papas, tomates, cebollas, güisquiles, yuca, para fortalecer el negocio y tener la disponibilidad de productos frescos, aumentando la posibilidad de ganar más dinero por las ventas. El aspira en un futuro tener su propio hogar con una casa a su nombre y con un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Jose dedicates his time to selling vegetables. He is single and his business is located in the municipal market but he also sells in the streets.  His hours are not specific and his income depends solely on sales.

Jose is requesting a loan to buy fresh vegetables such as potatoes, tomatoes, onions, chayote squash, and manioc, in order to enhance his business by having fresh products available, increasing the possibility of making more money from sales.

Jose's aspirations for the future include having his own home – a house in his own name – and a larger business.

loans.use: buy potatoes, tomatoes, onions, chayote squash, and manioc to sell.

loans.name: Lena Nzasu

texts.en: Lena is 26 years old and is married to a teacher.  They have a son and a daughter, aged one and three. Lena is an ambitious woman. She runs a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, potatoes, onions and kales.  She has been in this business for the last four years. Her business challenge is insufficient funds. She hopes by using this loan of KES 10,000, she will be able to improve her grocery store business. Lena's hope and dream in the next five years is to be a supplier of potatoes and tomatoes in the nearby town.

loans.use: buy potatoes and cabbages

loans.name: Argemiro

texts.es: El señor Argemiro desde hace 20 años esta dedicado a la cerrajería, actividad con la cual genera los ingresos necesarios para el sustento de su esposa y sus dos hijos. Argemiro se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre pujante con ganas de sacar su familia adelante y es por esto que siempre busca que su negocio este creciendo. Brindarle una buena educación a sus 2 hijos es el sueño de Argemiro, y sabe que para poder lograrlo, necesita ofrecer mejores productos y con mayor calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Argemiro has been working as a metal worker for twenty years, an activity that generates the necessary income to support his wife and two children.  Argemiro is notable for being a dedicated man who very much wants to move his family forward and this is why he’s always looking to advance his business.  His dream is to provide his two children with a good education and knows that to do so he needs to offer better, higher quality products to his customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies and hand tools.

loans.name: Moureen

texts.en:
Moureen is a mother of 3 children, aged between 11 and 16 years, all in schooling. She has been in farming for 3 years and produces mainly eggs, vegetables and maize for the local market. She is aged 32.

Moureen has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the additional dairy cow will generate her more income, which she intends to use in improving her children's living standards. She aspires to have four dairy cows in five years.

She reiterates the challenge in farming remains the high costs of managing animal diseases.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elorde

texts.en: Elorde is a proud farmer within his locality.He was glad that with his hard work and patience he was able to manage it well.Elorde is a scout ranger before,now he enjoys cultivating his rice farm land.He is married and had five children.Three of his children finished their studies already while the other two left are still studying.His wife manage a small sari-sari store in their home.For him to have continuous smooth flow of his yields he is doing his best.He would like to take out for a loan of PHP15,000 to buy fertilizer,fuel for their machines used in their farm at the same time payment for hired laborer to fasten their work at farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, fuel for their machines used in their farm at the same time they need to hire laborer to fasten their work in farm

loans.name: Ahoéfa Célestine

texts.en:
Mrs. Ahoéfa Célestine S. is married and has three (03) children. She was born on May 15, 1942 in Lomé (in Golfe) and sells bouillie (a hot African breakfast cereal). Her husband, who is retired with a pathetic and irregular pension, finds it difficult to contribute to the needs of the household, and most of the household expenses rest on her shoulders. With things becoming more and more difficult, she has decided to add the business of selling of cereals and sugar to the sale of bouillie.

To do this, she is asking for a loan of $900 to buy and sell cereals. She can thus create a profit margin high enough to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame S. Ahoéfa Célestine est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle est née le 15 Mai 1942 à Lomé (P.Golfe) et revendeuse de bouillie. Son mari, un retraité aux pensions dérisoires et irrégulières arrive très difficilement à contribuer aux besoins du foyer et la plupart des charges du ménage reposent sur elle. Les choses devenant de plus en plus difficile, elle décide d’ajouter le commerce céréales et de sucre à la vente de la bouille.

Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit de $900 pour faire l’achat et la vente de céréales. Elle pourra ainsi dégager une marge bénéficiaire aussi élevée afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Esther would like to buy 3 pigs and 2 dairy goats

loans.name: Luo

texts.en:
Mrs. Luo S., 41-year-old mother of 4 children, lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She runs a butcher stand at a nearby market and typically makes about $3/day in revenue. To help in financing the household, her husband is a motor-taxi driver, while her two daughters (pictured here is one of her daughters because S. is unavailable) help her sell at a market. S. is requesting $500 to purchase more pork, beef, chicken and ducks for her business and to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a business.
In the future, S. would like to expand her business and own another stand at a market for her daughters.

loans.use: To purchase more pork, beef , duck and chicken for her butcher stand

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Mrs. Eunice L. is married with two children. She has spent 7 years as a Lift Above Poverty Organization member. She sells engine oil and motorcycle tyres to people living in her community. She is requesting the above loan in order to expand her business. She has 8 years of experience in her business.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle tyres and oil for sale

loans.name: Sahoba

texts.ru:
Sahoba sells fresh fruits. She started in the business several years ago. Her products include apples, pears, figs, pomegranates, etc. She purchases the fruits wholesale and sells them at retail. Sahoba is 32 years old and she is raising 2 children. Her husband works here and there at several jobs. The profits from the business comprise their family earnings.

Recently Sahoba received a loan from MicroInvest to expand her business. She plans to use the new loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Сахоба продает свежие фрукты. Бизнесом стала заниматься несколько лет назад. Ассортимент ее товаров включает в себя яблоки, груши, инжир, гранаты и т.п. Она покупает фрукты оптом и реализует их в розницу. Сахобе 32 года и она воспитывает двоих детей. Ее муж подрабатывает на разных работах. Полученные доходы являются их семейным доходом. Недавно Сахоба получила займ в Микроинвест на расширение своего бизнеса. Она планирует получить новый займ на дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса.

loans.use: for expansion of business

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
In the "Plaza de Armas" in the district of Pukará, doña Matilde, happy and enthusiastic, is offering a variety of merchandise to the visitors that approach little by little. Matilde owns a small stand where she sells artscrafts which she has been doing for more than eleven years, and today it is the most substantial economic income for her home. Thanks to her work which she carries out diligently and occasionally with the help of her husband, Victor, she covers the family expenses in an acceptable way. Doña Matilde wishes to enlarge her stand and expand the variety of merchandise offered to the customers in order to obtain higher economic benefits and therefore she needs a loan that will allow her to grow. She plans to repay the loan in a period of eight months and promises to be punctual and responsible. With your kind support doña Matilde will be able to reach her goal in a very short period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

En la plaza de armas del distrito de Pukará, encontramos muy alegre y entusiasta a doña Matilde, ofreciendo variedad de mercadería a los visitantes que poco a poco van llegando.Matilde tiene un pequeño puesto de ventas de artesanías, negocio al que se dedica hace más de once años y que hoy en día se ha convertido en el principal ingreso económico de su hogar. Ya que gracias a esta labor que desempeña muy diligentemente en ocasiones con apoyo de su esposo Víctor, solventa satisfactoriamente los gastos de su familia. El deseo de doña Matilde es ampliar su puesto y aumentar la variedad de la mercadería que ofrece a propios y extraños con el fin de obtener mayores beneficios económicos.Para esto requiere obtener un préstamo de dinero que le permitirá crecer mucho más con su oficio; ella se compromete a reembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de ocho meses y promete ser puntual y responsable. Con tu gentil apoyo doña Matilde podrá concretar en muy corto tiempo su propósito.

loans.use: Increase capital to purchase more variety of artscrafts for the tourists visiting her beautiful town.

loans.name: Endah

texts.en: Endah is a 39-year-old woman who has a small shop that provides household goods, food, snacks, kerosene, rice, etc. She can earn US $33.50 per month, which is just enough for their daily needs and her children's education. Her husband, J., has no fixed income. Endah requests a loan to expand her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her shop

loans.name: Gina

texts.es:
For the past 20 years Gina has helped her husband sell fertilizer. Nevertheless, the enormous need for money and her youngest daughter’s illness (she suffers from Downs Syndrome) has made it so that the past 2 years she has been selling wine among her neighbors in the AAHH Sol Naciente neighborhood.

Even though her business is going well (she began selling 1 liter and now sells 7), there are season in which sales fall. She also has to travel every weekend to Chincha (south of Lima) to bring the wine, leaving her daughter alone. It is for this reason that with having the possibility to acquire a loan, she will be able to open a clothing or shoe store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 20 años, Gina ha ayudado a su esposo en la venta de fertilizantes. Sin embargo, la inmensa necesidad de dinero y la enfermedad de su última hija (padece síndrome de Down) han hecho que desde hace 2 años, venda vinos entre sus vecinos del AAHH Sol Naciente.

Aunque le va bien en su negocio (comenzó vendiendo 1 litro y ahora 7) hay temporadas en las que las ventas caen. Además debe viajar todos los fines de semana a Chincha (localidad al sur de Lima) para traer el vino, dejando sola a su hija. Es por esto que de tener la posibilidad de acceder a un mayor crédito, pondría una tienda de ropa o calzado.

loans.use: Open a clothing or shoe store.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos is a man of many talents. Besides being a craftsman (the field that he has been focused on the longest), he also works as a brick-layer and creates sustainable projects for his community. Thanks to his abilities he has a handmade crafts stand, and now he dreams of starting a gastronomic business. He would like to offer well-known rainforest dishes as well as give visitors the best attention and experience with exotic foods and drinks from his native community. In order to realize this dream he needs a sum of money with which to begin the work. He does not have the start-up funds and is asking us to help facilitate his dream by providing the required amount. He hopes to count on your support.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos, es un hombre con mil oficios, porque aparte de ser artesano, labor en el que se desempeña por más tiempo, también presta sus servicios como albañil y elabora proyectos sostenibles en su comunidad.Gracias a su potencial tiene un puesto de productos artesanales y ahora anhela poner un negocio gastronómico en el cual podría difundir los famosos platos de la selva y de igual manera dar a los visitantes la mejor atención y degustación de platos y bebidas exóticas de su comunidad nativa.Para ello tendría que tener una suma de dinero con el cual empezará a trabajar, este dinero precisamente es con el que no cuenta y pide le podamos facilitar la cantidad requerida para su anhelado proyecto.Esperamos contar con vuestra colaboración.

loans.use: Injection of capital in order to begin a gastronomic project

loans.name: Budumbuli West B (Iv) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fisita A.. She is currently in the business of selling local brew and is requesting a loan to add to the business. Fisita is 42 years old and is married with a husband who is a mechanic for work. She has 4 children ranging from ages 7 to 22 and her children go to school. Each week, Fisita makes approximately UGX 210000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her household's needs and save the rest. Fisita has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to use it in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Fisita is joined in her small group by Grace N., Rose A., Joyce M., and Christine O.. Grace N. has a business selling local brew and wants to boost her business. Rose A. is currently operating a local brewery business and wants a loan to buy more ingredients. Joyce M. operates a business selling local brew and wants to add stock. Christine O. is currently in the business of operating a local brewery and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To boost and expand brewery business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 42 years old man. He has six children. He works and lives in the Beirut suburbs. Ali is a car mechanic. This is the sixth time he applies for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to open up a flower shop.

loans.use: To open up a flower shop.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther Alrelumhe is into production of cellophane. This she sells to stores and bakeries for packaging of various items like breads, groundnuts, etc.

Esther is 34 years old and married with four children. She has been a LAPO client for the past seven years and she has been in this business for ten years.

Esther needs a loan of $875 to buy more materials for her cellophane production. This will help her to make more profit and meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more materials for cellophane production.

loans.name: Angelina Fulau

texts.pt:
Angelina is 39 years old and she was born in Vilanculos, province of Inhambane. Angelina is single and she supports a 27-year- old sister who is taking 6th grade classes in the evenings. Angelina completed high school with a professional training and, in 1991, she moved from the province of Inhambane with her older brother before she got married. She continued her education in the district of Boane. Currently, she lives in her own home in zone 7 of the village os Boane. Angelina is a permanent employee of the Joaquim Chissano High School. She works as the principal's secretary since 2003 and her shift is from 7:30am to 3:30pm. She learned the secretary skills at the School of Management and Conduct. This will be the first loan request in her life. Through conversations with friends, she became aware of Hluvuku's existence and decided to contact them to apply for the loan. She wishes to purchase construction material to start building a new room for her house. Angelina plans on requesting another loan in the future to increase her saving and purchase a vehicle.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Angelina tem 39 anos e nasceu em Vilanculos província de Inhambane. Angelina é solteira e sustenta uma irmã de 27 anos de idade que freqüenta o ensino primário na 6ªclasse período noturno. Angelina completou o nível médio profissional, e em 1991 mudou-se da província de inhambane na companhia do seu irmão mais velho, antes de casar. Continuou com os estudos no distrito de Boane, neste momento vive numa casa própria no bairro 7 da vila de Boane. Angelina é funcionaria permanente da escola secundaria Joaquim Chissano, trabalhando como secretaria da Diretora da Escola desde 2003 e trabalha das 7:30h às 15:30h. Aprendeu o secretariado na escola de administração e gestão. Para ela este é o primeiro empréstimo na vida e foi através da conversa com os colegas que tomou conhecimento da existência do Hluvuku e dai contactou e solicitou o seu primeiro empréstimo no qual pretende comprar material de construção para construir uma dependência numa fase inicial da obra. Angelina futuramente pretende solicitar um empréstimo para aumentar o valor que tem guardado para comprar uma viatura.

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: God Tenki Group

texts.en:
Abi K. is the leader for the group "God Tenki". The four members sell their goods in the same market and have been working cohesively as a rotating savings club for a long time. The group joined the SMT program when it was established in Magburaka, Sierre Leone, and are now applying for a loan together to expand their individual businesses.

Abi is 50 years old and married with four children. Her business supplements her husband's meager income as a teacher. She sells utensils and other dishes. Abi would like to build her capital and diversify her business.

Also in the group are: Kadiatu K., who sells peanuts butter and would like to purchase 15 bags of peanuts; Marie L., who sells firewood/fuel; and Saffie K., who sells palm oil.

loans.use: Increase stocks of utensils/dishes, wood/fuel, peanuts and palm oil

loans.name: Kifayat

texts.en: Kifayat is the mother of 2 children.She was born in 1972. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Djabrayil region in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, settled in Baku city. She has been working as a cook in this cafe for 7 years.  Now she needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy the necessary things for improving services to customers so she will get more income from her work.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things for improving services to customers

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is 30 years old and married with three children aged 2, 5 and 7 years old. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $550 from her sales. Zainab now requests a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: Zainab would like to buy more charcoal and firewood for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina baji is a wife of J. M. and lives in the Bund Road area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has lived in this town for the last six years and is the mother of four sons. Her elder son works in a factory. His younger brothers are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Samina baji's husband sells wheels for different types of vehicles. He has been in this business for the last 20 years. Samina baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy more wheels for her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by several members. Samina baji wants a loan to buy animals for her meat-selling business. Bashiran baji and Suraiya baji each want a loan to buy garments to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy various items to sell

loans.name: Frida Esther

texts.es:
Frida es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Frida es separada, tiene 58 años y 8 hijos de los cuales 3 viven con ella, Frida vive en la comunidad de San Jose de Viñaca que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde compra tara, cochinilla que luego de acopiar lo vende a los intermediarios. Además Frida junto a sus hijos se dedican a la agricultura de cereales que luego vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho, también manda hacer leña que reparte según pedido.
Frida necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña, tara.
Frida sueña con mejorar su negocio, tener mas capital y apoyar a sus hijos para que sean mejores.
texts.en:
Frida is a partner in the Sonrisa (Smile) Communal Bank. Frida is 58 years old and separated. She has eight children, three of whom live with her. Frida lives in the San Jose de Viñaca community, 40 minutes outside of Ayacucho. She buys tara and pillbugs in the city, which she stockpiles and sells to intermediary distributors. Frida and her children also grow grains that they sell in Ayacucho, and they chop firewood upon request. Frida needs a loan of 1200 soles which she'll invest in firewood and tara. Frida dreams of improving her business, having more capital and supporting her children to improve themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Frida needs a loan of 1200 soles which she'll invest in firewood and tara.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Dignidad (Dignity) Village Bank. Isabel 32 years old and lives with her partner and their three children. Isabel travels to different regional fairs once a week to buy  small animals, trout, and cheese. She then delivers the products to her clients’ homes (she has a fixed client base). Isabel needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy animals, cheese, and trout. Her dreams are to open a large neighborhood store in her home and to continue to work. 

 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Dignidad. 
Isabel es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Isabel viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región una vez por semana en donde compra animales menores, trucha, queso y todo lo que pueda comprar, sus productos los comercializa de casa en casa a sus clientes ya estable. 
Isabel necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carnero, queso, trucha. 
Los sueños de Isabel son tener una bodega grande en su casa y continuar y trabajando.

loans.use: Buy small animals, trout, and cheese

loans.name: Hanifan M.siddique Group

texts.en:
"I am Hanifan, a 52-year-old widow. I am a citizen of Kot Radha Kishan, which is 24 km from Kasur, Pakistan. I come from a poor family, but I have never felt badly about it." 

"My husband left me alone in this world. He died from a heart attack. I worked hard for my children. I worked as a sweeper for 5 years and then I started knitting clothes." 

"I have four children: three sons and one daughter. My eldest son runs a food business. The others work in a factory. My daughter help me to knit clothes. I am transferring my skills to my daughter so that she will be able to knit clothes indepenedently."

Hanifan has successfully repaid her four previous loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy lentils, cooking oil and spices for her son's food business. 

She is the group leader of a group of five women in her locality. Shamshad baji wants a loan to buy thread to make shawls. Kosar baji and Bashiran baji each want a loan to buy buffalos for their milk-selling businesses. Marzina baji wants a loan to buy an electric sewing machine for her decorative embroidery business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy supplies for food-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her fish-vending business.

loans.name: Lubna Liaquat Ali Group

texts.en:
Lubna baji, 36, a resident of Arifwala, Pakistan, is married to L. A., a jewelry seller for the past decade. The mother of three daughters, all attending school, Lubna baji operates a sewing business in order to pay for their school fees. She is now applying for a loan to expand her husband’s jewelry business.

Lubna is a group leader of two other women in her community: Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy goats for her butcher shop; Nasreen baji is requesting a loan to buy fish for her fish-selling business.

The funds for this group loan will be distributed among the members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one does not repay, the others are responsible.

loans.use: To buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Liz Elizabeth,

texts.es:
Liz empezó a trabajar en el mercado vendiendo ropa y productos cosméticos hace dos años. No obstante, hace seis meses el puesto que alquilaba fue vendido por el dueño, y ella se encontró sin una base para conducir su negocio. Entonces decidió juntarse a su mamá en su negocio de venta de productos naturales y hierbas medicinales.
Aunque desde hace ocho meses está sacando préstamos con EDAPROSPO para invertir en este negocio, sus planes para el futuro no son de seguir vendiendo en el mercado.
Liz tiene veinte años, y además de tener este negocio con su mamá también estudia Inglés y Diseño, y espera en un futuro poder empezar una empresa de diseño y dedicarse por entero a esta profesión.
texts.en:
Two years ago, Liz began working in the market selling clothing and cosmetics. However, six months ago the owner sold the space she rented. She found herself without a base from which to conduct her business. So she decided to join her mother selling natural products and medicinal herbs. Although she has been getting loans to invest in this business from EDAPROSPO for eight months, she does not plan to keep selling in the market in the future. Liz is 20 years old. In addition to having this business with her mother, she also studies English and design. She hopes to be able to start a design business in the future and dedicate herself to this profession full-time.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invirtió en mercancía para su negocio de productos naturales y hierbas medicinales.

loans.name: Tushikamane Group

texts.en:
Mwanaid has been an onion seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 4 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 60. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more onions for re-sale in order to improve her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mwanaid is 45 years old, married, and has seven children: ages 23, 20, 18, 18, 15, 10 and 6. She also cares for two additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Telesia, who has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more onions for re-sale

loans.name: Losivale

texts.en: Losivale M., 52, is married with one child.  She has four years of experience in the Pancake business. She sells to the village people and the general public six days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala.  SPBD loans are Losivale’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to upgrade her business only.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil and a large frying pan

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: El Señor  José Ángel Z., tiene 42 años de edad, acompañado, su esposa le tiene cuatros hijos. Los planes para su familia en ofrecerle mayor comodidad. Se desempeña como conductor de transporte desde hace 6 años. El préstamo  que solicita en Afodenic es para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como: hierro, perlines, láminas, estribos, alambre, clavo y bloques. Con La construcción de una parte de la casa le brindara seguridad a su familia
texts.en:
José Ángel Z. is 42 years old, married, and has four children. His plan is to provide more comfort to his family. He has worked as a transport driver for six years. The loan he is seeking from Afodenic is for the purchase of construction materials like: iron, Perlina, laminates, stirrups, wire, nails and blocks. In constructing a new part of his home, he will provide greater security for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for home improvements

loans.name: Dushaboi

texts.ru: Гафоров Душабой Наврузбойевич 1971 год рождения ,образование выше , национальность узбек .Место жительства Шахристанский район  к/ул. Бураген.Клиент берёт заем для животноводства. Дома имеет 7 голов крупного рогатого скота .Клиент занимается животноводством уже около 12 лет .Он берёт заем 1600 сом. на 5 мес.Дополнительный семейный доход клиент занимается сельским хозяйством и он член ФСХ «Ибрат».На полученный кредит планирует купить дойную корову.
texts.en:
Dushaboi G. was born in 1971. He has a university diploma. He is Uzbek. He resides in Shahristan. For about 12 years he has been involved in cattle farming, and he is going to use his loan for the purchase of a dairy cow. He already has 7 cows at home. He earns additional money in agriculture. He is a member of FSH Ibrat.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Bancomunal  Mar del Plata. 
Elizabeth es conviviente tiene 33 años, dos hijos de 7 y  4 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal. 
Elizabeth empezó vendiendo golosinas en su casa, pero decidió salir a vender salchi-papas por que averiguo que se ganaba mas, y estaba pasando por necesidad económica fuerte, su esposo viajo y ella se hizo cargo de sus hijos, ya tiene tres años en el negocio de la venta de Sanchi-papas.
Desde que esta en Finca Elizabeth ha podido compra varias cosas para su casa y darles educación a sus hijos.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de un toldo para  cubrirse de la lluvia y el arreglo de su carreta donde vende salchi-papas, también va a comprar saco de papas, aceite. 
El sueño de Elizabeth tener un restaurante en un local.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Mar del Plata Community Bank. Elizabeth, 33, is in a common law marriage. She has two children ages seven and four who attend the state school. Elizabeth started selling sweets in her house. But, she decided to leave to sell “salchi-papas” (a fried sausage and potato snack) because she found out that she earned more. Also, she was having severe economic problems. Her husband left, and she took charge of her children. She has been in the business of selling salchi-papas for three years. Since Elizabeth has been in Finca she has been able to buy various things for her house and give her children an education. Elizabeth needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy an awning to keep the rain out and to fix the cart where she sells salchi-papas. She also needs to buy a sack of potatoes and oil. Elizabeth’s dream is to have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an awning to keep the rain out and fix her cart where she sells salchi-papas

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza es socia del Bancomunal Antares.
Maritza es madre soltera, tiene 40 años,  dos  hijos de 11 y 8 años  que están en la escuela estatal.
Maritza   es de Cerro de Pasco, solo estudio primaria,  después de trabajar en casas, junto con su mamá se dedicaron  a dar desayunos por las  mañanas en una playa de estacionamiento  por la avenida Brasil, actualmente Maritza se ha hecho cargo del negocio sus hijos la ayudan, y por las tardes vende panchos y anticuchos en la puerta de su casa. en Villa el Salvador. 
Desde que Maritza esta en Finca, ha sido de mucha ayuda, su economía ha mejorado, su negocio creció.  
Maritza necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de queso, leche, jamonada.  
El sueño de Maritza es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of Bancomunal Antares.

Maritza is a 40-year old single mother of two children, aged 8 and 11, who attend public school.

Maritza is from Cerro de Pasco. She studied at a primary level only. After working in houses with her mother, they started supplying breakfasts in the morning at a car park on Avenida Brasil. Now Maritza is in charge of the business. Her children help, and in the afternoons they sell hot dogs and kebabs out of their home in Villa El Salvador.

Since Maritza has been with Finca, they have been a great support. Her finances have improved, and her business has grown.

Martiza needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy cheese, milk and canned ham.

Maritza’s dream is to have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheese, milk and canned ham

loans.name: Adewomi

texts.en: Adewomi is 52 years old. She is married and has four children. She sells crates of drinks, loaves of bread and other groceries in her shop. She hopes for a loan of N50, 000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Moun

texts.en: Moun S., 52, is married and lives in Battambong Province with her two children. The family's primary source of income is generated by her husband, a construction foreman. Although the current world financial crisis has hit Cambodians hard, his business is still healthy because, with adequate construction tools, he is able to provide good and fast services to his customers. The family is also supported by one of the children who is a construction worker. Moun is asking CREDIT for a loan of $600 to purchase more construction tools for her husband's business. (Her husband is presented in the picture because Moun was not available)

loans.use: To purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Era

texts.en:
Era M. is from the village of Caluya, Sapang Dalaga Mis. Occ.. She is 52 years old. Era is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Era owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling variety of food products in the local community. Era has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Era joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Era has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Era is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Era from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Chinita

texts.en:
According to Mrs. Chinita C., a resident of Sitio Magtalisay, Barangay Cervantes, Escalante City, Negros Occidental, it is very hard to raise seven children if you rely solely on just one source of income. With such a large family, it was almost impossible for them to live on just what her husband earned as a fisherman. Many times, her husbands catch was too small to cover even the most basic needs of the family, such as food for the day, much less provide for the education of her children, medicine for when a family member gets sick, and other expenses. 

She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon and went into the fish-selling business to supplement her husband's income and make her children's future more secure, because she knew that if she did not take the initiative, her children's future would be in jeopardy.

So, armed with her first loan from NWTF, she started selling her husband's catch, bought fish from some of the other fishermen, and sold them around the neighborhood and around the town for the next 10 years. This business enables her to earn an additional PHP 3,000 for her family.

Now she hopes to expand her business by using her 9th loan of Php 15,000 as additional capital so that she can buy a bigger volume of fish from the local fishermen to sell to her growing number of loyal clients. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Kathelini

texts.en:
Kathelini is a member of the Kinanambo borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 18, 16, 14, 9 years old.

Kathelini has owned a business for 8 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 80,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Katelini`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more beans and soap  for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Kathelini hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more soap, Beans for sale

loans.name: Lleny

texts.es:
Lleny tiene 57 años, está divorciada, vive con su hija y sus 3 nietos en su casa propia. Ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno en su pequeño fundo ubicado a dos horas de su casa, cuenta con 80 cabezas de ganado y con dos personas para cuidar de sus animales, pues ella está generalmente en la ciudad buscando clientes para ofrecer y vender sus animales. Adicionalmente, cuenta con algunas tierras de cultivo donde siembra frutas, tales como paltas, limones y naranjas, productos que comercializa en el mercado de su localidad. En la crianza de reses tiene un periodo de 8 años y le va muy bien, pues lo que más le gusta de su labor es ver crecer su fundo poco a poco. Lleny considera que la rentabilidad de su negocio está en que los animales que cría son de muy buena raza, por lo que los vende a mejores precios.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes son unidos y muy solidarios entre sí. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará alambres y madera para cercar una parte de su fundo que se encuentra en mal estado y así evitar que sus animales salgan y perjudiquen otras chacras.

loans.use: Arreglo del cerco de su fundo

loans.name: Rubi Group

texts.es:
Presidenta del B.E. RUBI: Doña Tomasa , vive en la populosa zona de la Av. Buenos Aires, en domicilio propio, tiene 47 años y esta casada con don Martin , su negocio es familiar ya que trabaja junto a su esposo en su taller de cerrajeria, la especialidad es la fabricacion de puertas y ventanas de metal; el crédito que obtuvo lo está destinando a la compra de herramientas.
Tesorera del B.E. RUBI: Doña Maria , vive en la popular zona de Alto Tacagua en casa familiar, tiene 42 años y está casada con don Braulio , la señora se dedica a la venta de calzados que los fabrica su esposo y ella es la que se dedica a venderlos en su puesto propio ubicado en la avenida Los Andes; El lo ha destinado para la compra de material como cuero, pvc y otros.

Secretaria del B.E. RUBI: La señora Gloria , vive en la zona central en casa de sus suegros, tiene 31 años de edad y se encuentra casada con don Efrain , su actividad económica está relacionada con la venta de videos, DVD, C; los mismos que los compra al por mayor del desaguadero (frontera con la republica del Peru)y los comercializa en la zona Norte de la ciudad de La Paz; el crédito lo está destinando al incremento de capital.
texts.en:
Doña Tomasa serves as president of the Rubi Communal Bank. She lives in her own home in the populated district of Av. Buenos Aires. She is 47 years old and married to Don Martin. Doña Tomasa and her husband operate a locksmith shop. Their specialty is manufacturing metal doors and windows. The loan she will receive will be used to purchase tools.

Doña Maria is the treasurer of the Rubi Communal Bank. She lives in the district of Alto Tacagua in her family home. Doña Maria is 42 years old and married to Don Braulio. From her vending booth on Los Andes Avenue, she sells shoes that her husband manufactures. Her loan will be used to purchase materials such as leather, vinyl, and other products.

Sra. Gloria is the secretary of the Rubi Communal Bank. She lives in the central district in the home of her in-laws. She is 31 years old and married to Don Efrain. Gloria sells videos and DVDs. She acquires her products from a wholesale outlet located on the Peruvian border and then sells them in the northern district of La Paz. Her loan will be used to increase her operating capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase merchandise & supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Ecelina Ginoca

texts.pt:
Elina da Ginoca nasceu na cidade de Maputo, capital de Moçambique, tem 31 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 3 e 11 anos, os dois mais crescidos frequentam escola. Elina continua a estudar estando neste momento a frequentar 10 classe. Vive na casa própria no bairro Campoane, no distrito de Boane, com o seu marido professor e sem ninguém mais por sustentar.

Saiu da cidade de Maputo para Matola, onde cresceu em casa dos seus familiares e mais tarde casou se com o professor. Faz comercialização de caprinos que os adquire na província de Gaza e vende na província de Maputo há mais de 2 anos. Com os rendimentos provenientes desta actividade ajuda o marido nas despesas familiares, assim como na construção da casa de alvenaria.

Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através das amigas e outros vizinhos, tendo depois decidido aproximar. Já levantou 2 empréstimos para a mesma actividade de construção de casa de alvenaria nos valores de 10.000,00mt e 12.000,00mt.
Com o presente empréstimo de 15.000,00mt pretende comprar cimento, areia e outros materiais, para dar continuidade com a obra.

Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com o objectivo de terminar a construção da casa de alvenaria.
texts.en:
Elina da Ginoca was born in the city of maputo, the Capital of Mozambique. She is 31 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children with ages between 3 and 11 years old. The two oldest are in school. Elina is continuing her schooling and is, at this moment, attending the 10th grade. She lives in her own home in the Campoane neighborhood in the district of Boane with her husband who is a teacher. They do not support any other people. She left the city of Maputo for Matola where she grew up in the home of her family, and later she married a teacher. She has a business selling goats which she acquires in Gaza and sells in Maputo.
