She has done this for more than 2 years now. With the earnings provided by this activity she helps her husband with the family expenses as well as with the construction of a brick home. She learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through friends and other neighbors, and afterward decided to inquire. She has already had 2 loans for the same purpose of constructing a brick home in the amounts of 10,000MT and 12,000MT. With this current loan of 15,000MT she intends to purchase cement, sand, and other materials to continue the work. She is committed to pay off the loan without problems so that she can receive more credit with the objective of completing her brick home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (cement, stone, and others)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of Chuño Blanco (white potatos typical of the Andes)

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is 35 years old; he sells poultry feed, both retail and wholesale. He will use the loan to stock more feed to increase on his capital. He has been in the business for over six years. With the loan, he hopes for business expansion as in stocking enough poultry feed that he can become one of the largest distributors in Kawempe.

loans.use: To stock more poultry feed

loans.name: Jabino Gilberto

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo del departamento de Chinandega, el señor Jabino Gilberto C. labora a diario con el fin de ver realizado su sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda iniciando a reconstruirla en parte porque ha estado en malas condiciones y ha requerido de mucha inversión para tenerla en mejores condiciones y que preste mayor seguridad.

El crédito que está solicitando lo utilizará para la compra de los materiales de construcción para dar lugar a su obra y así beneficiar directamente tanto a su cónyuge como a sus cuatro hijos que están bajo su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo and the department of Chinandega, Jabino Gilberto C. works daily with the aim to see his dream of improving his living conditions realized. It will begin with reconstructing part of the house because it has been in bad condition and has required a lot of investment to have better conditions and give it greater security. The loan he is asking for will be used to buy the construction materials to allow him to begin the work and will directly benefit his spouse and four children who he is responsible for.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Gulchokhra

texts.en: Gulchokhra A. is 53 years old. She is married with three children. She has worked at the business of buying and selling cattle since 1985. She visits farms and settlements to buy cattle at the lowest price so she can increase her profits. She currently has two cows and two calves. Now that her children are grown, Gulchokhra wants to expand her business as they will be able to help her care for more cattle. She is requesting 1200 AZN in order to buy cows. Gulchokhra expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: purchase four cattle

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda A. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old. Imelda is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Imelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Imelda from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Muy comprometida con el bienestar de su vivienda e hijos, la señora María M. se dedica a trabajar en un centro de labores en el departamento de Chinandega, con el fin de llevar el sustento a su vivienda que hoy en día ha iniciado a reconstruirla para mayor seguridad de sus dos hijos.
Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de zinc, cemento, clavos, alfajillas y ladrillos con el propósito de utilizarlos para la reconstrucción de su vivienda que es el sueño que ella tiene y al hacerlo realidad beneficiará a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Committed to the wellbeing of her children and the security of her home, Mrs. María M. works at a labor center in the department of Chinandega, so that she can support her family and rebuild her home to make it safe for her two children. She requests a loan to buy zinc, cement, nails, wooden beams, and bricks to use in the construction of her house, which is one of her dreams. In making it a reality, she will benefit her children.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying building materials

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Gillermo G. Rodriguez, tiene la edad de 35 años, está casado, y vive con el esposo  y un nieto. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de artículos para su negocio. Desea tener un inventario más amplio y variado de los artículos de su bazar. Tiene varios años de haber empezado con este negocio, y cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad de ofrecer mayor variedad de productos en el negocio, además de aportar mayores ingresos para la economía de su hogar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecido con las facilidades que se le brindaron. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Guillermo Godinez Rodriguez is 35 years old, married, and lives with his wife and their son. He would like this loan for the purchase of items for his business. He wishes to have a larger and more varied inventory of items in his store. He has several years of experience with this business, as well as very good clients. For this reason, he sees the need to offer a greater variety of products, and also to earn a greater income to help with household expenses. This is the first time he has requested a loan through FUDECOSUR, and he is very thankful for the ease that it has provided him. In the future, he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and in this way continue growing as a person and a business owner. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase items for his business

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard was born in 1951. He is a widower and the father of eight children: Marilyn and Lorna (25 and 23 years old respectively, both high school graduates); Bernard (18 years old, Form 1); Kenneth Richard (22 years old, Form 3); Jeptoo (17 years old, Class 8); Christopher (15 years old, Class 6); Brian (6 years old, Class 1); and Silas (14 years old, Class 4).

Richard runs a hotel (restaurant) and is also a farmer. Both of his businesses are one year old and he earns a profit of Ksh 10,000 per month from his businesses. His businesses are in Pemwai village.

Richard was introduced to KADET by a villager who comes from his area. He has no previous credit history. He plans to use his Ksh 40,000 loan to open another hotel while any remaining amount will be used to plant maize.

If this loan boosts his business he will use the extra profit to purchase a dairy cow. He intends to practice zero-grazing (stall-feeding) with the purchase of the cow as he dreams of being a dairy farmer. Richard describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To open another restaurant and to plant maize

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu H. is 48 years old, divorced and has 5 children: 2 boys and 3 girls. The first is in college, three are in secondary school, and the last one is in nursury school. She sells drinks and gara in Wilberforce and lives where she sell her goods. Since joining LAPO, SL, Fatu has taken three previous loans which she used to improve her business, and used the profit to take care of her family. She is asking for a loan of 2,000,000 Leones to buy more goods for sale, which will allow her to make more improvements in her life.

loans.use: To buy drinks and gara

loans.name: Sali

texts.fr:
Madame  Sali  est âgée de 38 ans mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille polygame avec son mari, sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans l’un des plus célèbres quartier, Koko de la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Pour des raisons sociales, Madame Sali n’a pas eu la chance d’étudier, ce qui explique son intérêt pour  le commerce  auprès de sa mère depuis à bas âge. 
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle s’intéressa finalement  l’achat et la vente d’articles divers  depuis 11 ans, tels les tissus.  
Sali est très bien sollicitée par ses clients pour la qualité de ses articles.  
Pour augmenter la taille de son activité et satisfaire sa clientèle, Sali  a décidé de rejoindre  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il  y a 1 an.  Après  2 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous payés correctement elle est à  son  premier prêt individuel.
Elle compte acheter, des pièces de tissus à Cotonou et effectue sa vente dans la ville de Koutiala à une clientèle composée  de femmes et d’ hommes, au comptant ou à crédit.  
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement de son échéance, participer aux charges quotidiennes de la famille et poursuivre son activité avec le reste.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sali is 38 years of age, married and the mother of five children. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, the other wife of her husband and their children in Koko, one of the best-known districts of the town of Koutiala (Sikiasso region). For social reasons, Mrs. Sali did not have an opportunity to get an education, which explains her early interest in helping her mother in commerce. After trying several business activities without success, eleven years ago she finally turned to the purchase and resale of various articles such as fabrics. Sali’s business is very popular with customers because of the quality of her goods. In order to expand her activity and satisfy customer demand, a year ago Sali has decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After two joint (group) loans, she is now seeking her first individual loan. She plans to purchase a supply of fabrics in Cotonou. She sells in the town of Koutiala to a customer base composed of both women and men, for cash or in credit. She hopes to achieve a monthly income of 100,000 West African Francs, which she will use to repay her loan, contribute to the everyday family expenses and reinvest the rest into her business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing of fabrics (for resale)

loans.name: Bayana Group

texts.fr:
Le Groupe de solidarité "BAYANA" est crée en octobre 2002 en même temps que le Banc Villageois qui porte le même nom. Il est composé de 08 femmes toutes issues du même village et ont en moyenne 35 ans et son mère au moins de 4 enfants. 

Elle mènent différentes activités à savoir la vente de fruits, la vente de légumes et la vente de noix d'acajous. 

pour augmenter leur capacité d'investissement afin d'accroître leur revenus financiers, le groupe a décidé d'intégrer l'institution de micro-crédit CAURIE-MF il y a de cela 08 ans et ont pratiquement toutes eu 17 fois a bénéficier de crédit. Leur dynamisme et leur bravoure ont fait qu'elles ont un bon niveau d'épargne, environs 65% de leur encours de prêt. 

La présidente du groupe, Oudé M. est âgée de 41 ans, elle mariée et mère de 09 enfants et tutrice de 04 autres qui lui sont confiés par des proches et parents. Elle est vendeuse de fruits et légumes et son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'augmenter sa capacité d'investissement afin d'avoir plus de bénéfices et pouvoir faire face aux différents besoins de sa famille. 

Les femmes, en plus des remboursements régulier de leurs prêts qu'elles font, des épargnes mensuelles qu'elles versent, participent aux différentes charges de leurs familles respectives.
texts.en:
The « BAYANA » solidarity group was formed in October 2002, at the same time as the « Banc Villageois » that shares its name. It is comprised of eight women from the same village, with an average age of 35 and having at least four children. They run various businesses, such as selling fruit, selling vegetables, and selling cashews. In order to increase their investment capacity and thus their income, the group decided eight years ago to join the microfinance institution CAURIE-MF. Nearly every one of them has received seventeen loans. Their energy and bravery has led to a good amount of savings, approximately 65% of their outstanding loans. The president of the group, Oudé M., is 41 years old, married and mother of nine children. She also takes care of four other children who have been given to her by friends and relatives. She sells fruits and vegetables. Her new loan would allow her to increase her investment capital in order to have more income and meet various family needs. The women, in addition to paying regularly on their loans and making monthly savings deposits, help to pay the various expenses of their respective families.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the group's ability to self-finance

loans.name: Ndatté

texts.fr: Ndatté T. est âgée de 32 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle a une ancienneté de 2 ans dans le Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE-SUD et y a reçu 4 crédits qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés sans aucune difficulté. Elle développe deux activités, la première consiste la vente de chaussures et la seconde la vente de noix d'acajou. Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement, de mieux vendre et de faire des bénéfices qui feront qu'elle participe aux différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Ndatté T. is 32 years old, married and the mother of four children, all under her care. She has two years’ seniority in the MONTAGNE-SUD “Banc Villageois” loan group, and was granted four loans, always well managed and repaid without problems. She is developing two activities: the first consists of selling shoes and the second selling cashew nuts. Her new loan will enable her to increase her level of supplies and consequently her sales, and bring in profits that she will use to participate in various family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her revenue-generating activity

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun Y. (pictured) and her husband, Mr. Phy Phat, have been married for more than thirty years. They have four children. Three of them are married and live outside of the family home and the fourth weaves silk at home. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Saroeun has been a silk weaver since she was young. It’s a skill she learned from her parents. She also started a new business selling finished silk fabric. She buys them from the weavers in the village and transport them to sell in other districts. Saroeun does not have enough capital to operate the business. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of $350 to support her business.

loans.use: To purchase finished silk fabric for resale.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 29 years old, married with 3 children who are 5, 7, and 9 years old.  Epiphanie makes a living by selling a variety of goods in her shop which is open from 6 am to 8 pm every day.

Although Epiphanie has spent 10 years working at her business, her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully so she feels she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  Once she gets this loan, Epiphanie hopes that her sales as well as her customers will increase and this in return will result in a greater profit.  With these profits, Epiphanie will reinvest more in her business and improve the lifestyle of her family.

loans.use: purchasing variety of goods which include cosmetics and foodstuffs

loans.name: Nahybe

texts.es:
La señora Nahybe es soltera, vive con su hermano y su abuela en casa propia de sus padres, quienes se fueron a la Argentina. Nahybe vive en la zona Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Nahybe administra un negocio de comida que sus padres le dejaron, sus tías son las que le ayudan a atender y con lo que gana mantiene su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para ampliar su negocio y comprar un horno más grande para tener mejores ingresos.
Esta es la primera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Miss Nahybe is single and lives with her brother and her grandmother in her parents’ house, who went to Argentina. Nahybe lives in the area of Villa Nuevo Potosí in the city of La Paz. Miss Nahybe runs a catering business that her parents left her. Her aunts help her tend to the business and she maintains the house with what she earns. The requested loan is to increase her business and buy a bigger oven to have a better income. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan and the socioeconomic analysis qualified her favorably so she can receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bigger oven for her catering business

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth C. is from the village of Lantay, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 30 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Janeth owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Janeth has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 9,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Janeth joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Janeth is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan Bautista Rodríguez es un hombre que sabe mucho de las abejas y de producir  miel, eso si bien pura,   y como no,  si se dedica al oficio de apicultor, oficio que aprendió desde muy joven cuando se escapaba del colegio a las fincas para conocer  el comportamiento de las abejas y  de las colmenas;  asì fue como hace 18 años gracias a un funcionario del I.C.A.  (Instituto Colombiano agropecuario)  que llevó este arte a Sabanalarga su pueblo, inició con 10 colmenas, con una inversión de $380.000, y gradualmente fue adquiriendo mas en las poblaciones de Sabanalarga, cascajal, Polonuevo, Caracol, Piojo, Galapa y Manatí, hasta completar  hoy 235,  de dónde saca la pura miel, que él mismo se encarga de empacar en su casa,  ubicada en el municipio de Malambo, en envases de 360 centímetros cúbicos y de 72 respectivamente y las  distribuye en  almacenes de productos naturistas, restaurante vegetarianos , distribuidores mayorista y al granel, a personas que quieren consumirla como parte de su régimen alimenticio .
 Juan Bautista  vende al por mayor mediante el sistema de  consignación y le pagan a los 15 días y al granel  le pagan de contado los frascos de 360 centímetros cúbicos los vende a $8.000 COP y los de 720 centímetros cúbicos  a    $ 16.000  COP. En la actualidad Solicita su credikiva como segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar 4.200 láminas de cera, estampado para los panales  y 1.800 envases de vidrio para empacar la pura miel y prepararse para la cosecha que se inicia en Noviembre.
Juan Bautista aún recuerda como antes sin ninguna protección los apicultores se acercaban a las abejas solo con expeler  un suave humo; esto era, aclara,  cuando no habían abejas africanizadas, hasta que llegaron unos especialistas chinos y los indujeron a ello,  sin importar que fueran abejas criollas o no. Y es que él parte de la premisa que si los humanos no molestamos sus abejas, ellas no atacan pero que de todas maneras él siempre se protege para atender medidas de seguridad. También plantea desde su experiencia como un buen observador y seguidor empírico, que las fugas masivas de abejas en algunas partes del mundo obedecen a que ellas son  muy sensibles a los aparatos electrónicos, celulares y medios modernos que  no lo resisten por su misma naturaleza.
Juan Bautista y su esposa, que trabaja en el arte de confecciones mediante el sistema de maquilas,  con sus esfuerzos han apoyado su hogar y lo han  sacado adelante a sus 3 hijos ya profesionales. Él sueña hoy con    perfeccionar su arte de cultivar abejas para extraer  su rica miel, haciendo el proceso lo más natural posible y convirtiéndolo en un ejemplo internacional.
texts.en:
Juan Bautista Rodríguez is a man who knows a lot about bees and honey production. The honey is very pure, and how could it not be, if he devotes himself to being a beekeeper. He learned this trade when he was very young. He would escape from school and go to the farms to learn about bee behavior and their hives. This was how 18 years ago, thanks to an official from the I.C.A. (Colombian Agricultural Institute) who took this art to his town of Sabanalarga, he started with ten hives with an investment of $380.000. He gradually was acquiring more hives in the towns of Sabanalarga, Cascajao, Polonuevo, Caracol, Piojo, Galapa, and Manatí. He now has 235 from which he takes pure honey. He sees to packing the honey himself. He does this at his home, which is located in the Malambo municipality. He packs the honey in containers that are 360 centimeters by 72 centimeters. He delivers the packages of honey to stores that sell natural products, vegetarian restaurants, wholesale distributors, and in bulk to people who want to eat it as part of their nutritional regimen. Juan Bautista sells wholesale through a consignment system. They pay him every 15 days, and he is paid cash for bulk sales. He sells the bottles that are 360 cubic centimeters for $8.000 COP, and he sells the bottles that are 720 centimeters for $16.000 COP. He is currently requesting his second loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will buy 4.200 sheets of wax, comb foundation for the honeycomb, and 1.800 glass bottles to pack the pure honey and to prepare to start the harvest in November. Juan Bautista still remembers how beekeepers would approach the bees without any protection by just blowing out mild smoke. “This was,” he says, “when there were not African bees.” That was until some Chinese specialists came and introduced them without caring whether or not they were Columbian bees. Aside from the premise that if humans do not bother the bees they will not attack, he always protects himself in order to comply with security measures. Also, from his experience of being a good observer and empirical follower, he states that the massive flight of bees in some parts of the world is due to the fact that they are very sensitive to electronic apparatus, cell phones, and modern media. By nature they cannot resist them. Juan Bautista and his wife work in the art of making textiles in factories. Through their efforts they have supported their household, and they have gotten their three children, who are now professionals, ahead. He now dreams of perfecting his art of cultivating bees in order to extract their delicious honey. He makes the process as natural as possible, and he will turn it into an international example.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4.200 wax sheets, comb foundation for the honeycomb, and 1.800 glass containers to prepare for the November harvest

loans.name: Atta

texts.en:
Atta K. is married to a driver and has two children. She has received senior high school education.

Atta sells gari (cassava flakes) and secondhand clothes at Takoradi and uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of the home. She will use the loan to purchase more bags of gari to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Atta plans to save to revive her secondhand clothes business.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of gari to sell

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE URRACA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Leonarda tiene 47 años de edad y es casada, ella tiene 4 hijos  trabaja como comerciante minorista, La socia compra y vende frutas y verduras en el mercado modelo de ttio, ella ahora solo está vendiendo verduras; La socia tiene su propio stand en el mercado y todos los miércoles y viernes va al terminal de frutas y verduras para comprar de los proveedores lo que venderá en 4 días. Ella necesita el dinero para invertir en la compra de mercadería. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Leonarda, 47, is married and has four children. She is a retail merchant. She sells fruits and vegetables in Ttio’s Modelo Market. Currently she is only selling vegetables. She has her own stand and goes to the fruit and vegetable terminal every Wednesday and Friday to buy from suppliers what she will sell in four days. She needs the loan to buy merchandise and that’s the purpose of the loan. She is a member of the “PADRE URRACA” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this forum to express her gratitude for the loan as well as to pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio E. is from the town of Banga. He is 59 years old. Emilio is married and has a 30-year-old child. To make a living, Emilio owns and operates a business venture growing crops, specifically, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Emilio also owns a sari-sari (general) store that his wife manages. A variety of different products are sold in their store.

Emilio joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emilio has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Emilio is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies and additional store merchandise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business and support his family financially.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and additional store merchandise

loans.name: Las Amistosas 1 Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Amistosas decidió llamarse así porque todas se consideran alegres y sociables entre sí, se llevan todas muy bien, es por eso que decidieron formar el grupo y pedir crédito, el grupo se formó en el Estado de México.
La señora Martha García R.,  tiene una tienda de abarrotes, la cual surgió por la inquietud de tener un trabajo y distraerse, pero al paso del tiempo le fue interesando más el negocio de los abarrotes es por eso que ya tiene cinco años con la tienda, dice sentirse orgullosa por mantenerla tantos años y espera hacerla prosperar más, y con ello tener un futuro asegurado, el crédito que solicitó es para materia prima  y tener más surtida la tienda.
La señora Margarita M. G., tiene un taller de costura desde hace cinco años, menciona le gusta el oficio de costurera desde muy pequeña y de grande decidió dedicarse a este negocio, hace todo tipo de costuras desde la confección hasta una simple reparación de alguna prenda, menciona que gracias a la costura ella ha salido adelante sus vecinos dicen que hace muy buenos trabajos es por eso que mucha gente la busca. Con el crédito dará mantenimiento a sus máquinas para poder seguir dando buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Las Amistosas” (The Friendly Ladies) group decided on this name because all of its members consider themselves to be happy and sociable.  They all get along very well and this is why they decided to form this group and request a loan.  This group is located in the State of Mexico.

Martha García R. has a grocery store, which was born from her restlessness of not having a job, but as time passed, she became more interested in her grocery store business.  She’s been running this store for five years and tells us that she is proud to have had it for so many years and she hopes to make it more successful and secure a better future for herself.  She requested this loan to buy inventory items in order to stock her store better.

Margarita M. G. has had a tailor shop for five years.  She tells us that she has enjoyed this trade since she was a little girl, and as an adult decided to dedicate herself to this business.  She does all kinds of sewing, from making clothing to simple repairs.  She also tells us that she’s been able to get ahead because of this.  Her neighbors say that she does very good work and that many people seek her out.  She will use the money from this loan to perform maintenance on her sewing machines so that she can continue to give good service to her customers.

loans.use: Supplies and inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy materials and tools for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen comes from Chichawatni which is a small city located in Punjab, famous in Pakistan for its agricultural industry. She owns a single room house there and lives in it with her family. She is a housewife but she also operates an animal sales business at her home. She specifically deals with goats, buys from the animal market at cheap rates, raises them, and sells them to customers who need them. Her work gives her good profit which allows her to pay their utility bills. 

She is married to S. who runs a barber shop. He provides his customers with hair cutting, facials, etc. Perveen has given birth to a son who is 15 years old and is studying in 8th class. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will utilize the loan in purchasing items such as face creams, hair gels, shampoos for the improvement of his business. He has been doing this business for over 20 years and Perveen is hopeful that through this loan investment, her husband’s business will improve and will make him more income every month. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah. She hopes it will bring positive changes for her husband. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Perveen.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for barber shop

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años que posee una tienda, instalada en el interior de su casa, desde entonces atiende todas las mañanas, en ocasiones sus hijos la apoyan en la atención hacia los clientes. Procura siempre que su establecimiento este surtido con diversos productos, de esa manera logra captar más clientes. Ella considera que gracias a este negocio pudo mantenerse estable económicamente y ayudar a su esposo con el sustento de los hijos. Ahora su prioridad es ampliar su tienda, para implementar más productos como frutas y artículos de oficina, que sean productos que estén al alcance de la economía de sus clientes. Es su crédito número 9 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en productos de primera necesidad para su tienda.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 40, lives with her husband and their three children in her own house.  She has had a store, which is set up in her house, for ten years.  She tends to her store every morning, and her children occasionally help her wait on the customers.  She always tries to make sure that her establishment is stocked with diverse products.  This is the way that she manages to get more customers.

Thanks to this business she was able to keep herself financially stable and help her husband support the children.  Her priority now is to expand the store.  She will do this in order to carry more products like fruit and office products.  These are products that are within the financial reach of her customers.

This is her ninth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  It pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.  She is grateful to all of the people who will be the lenders of the loan she is requesting.  The loan will be very useful to the progress of her business.  She will use the requested loan to buy more basic needs products for her store.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Tien

texts.en:
Tien T. D. is 28 years old. She lives in Luc Canh village, Xuan Canh commune. She is married with two children. She has a small shop where she sells drinks,confectionery, tobacco and other items. She has been doing this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. 

Tien T. D. has participated in SEDA since 2008, getting loans to invest in her shop and repaying punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8.066.000 VND to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Or

texts.en: Sewing clothes is the main part of 44-year-old Or S.’s daily routine. Mrs. Or S. provides her service to her neighbors--sewing both traditional and modern clothes. She runs her business very well and a lot of customers recognize the good service she provides. Or S. is married to Socheat, 40, a policeman. They have two children who are students studying in public school in Phnom Penh City. Or S. is concerned that her old sewing machine is broken. This machine is the main tool for her business so Or S. is seeking a loan to purchase a new sewing machine in order to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine in order to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Mr. Man M. (pictured here) and his wife have been married since 1980 and have five children - three sons and two daughters. Two are married and live outside the family home and the other three attend school. 

Man is a fisherman. His wife sells the fish that her husband catches in the village. He is applying for his third loan of $450 to purchase a new boat motor because the one he currently has is old and does not work well.

loans.use: To purchase a new boat motor

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a resident of Mian Channu, a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and attend to her household responsibilities. Elizabeth is the mother of a daughter and two sons. All of them are studying at local schools. She is a very supportive lady, always ready to help her family at difficult times.  

She is married to Sarfaraz, who is a painter by profession and paints walls, homes, buildings, etc., on contract. His business doesn’t guarantee that he will get work every day, but when he manages to get work, it continues for a few months and earns him a good income. 

Her husband wants to buy different colors of paint and also paint brushes, so Elizabeth has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. She is hopeful that an investment will help her husband fulfill the demands of his clients and make better profits.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy paint and brushes for her husband's painting business

loans.name: Lonkisa Ole

texts.en:
Lonkisa Ole K. is 44 years old. He is married and blessed with three children. Lonkisa is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last twenty-five years. His farm is in a productive area which has proven to be good for maize farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his 3rd loan, with which he is planning to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming, to increase his maize production and to educate his children.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land for farming. Lonkisa is a scrupulous man who can do more if supported financially

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Presentación

texts.es:
Presentación es un padre de familia de 52 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío La Pala del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores y aves de corral, el cría gallinas, patos, pavos, cabras, etc en un corral ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad la realiza hace dos años y cuenta con clientela establecida.

Presentación desea adquirir alimento balanceado para sus aves ya que la demanda aumenta además realizar unos arreglos en su corral para el mejor desarrollo de sus animales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Presentación is a 52 year-old father who lives with his wife and two children in their own house, located in the La Pala settlement in the Tambogrande region. It is an agricultural area located in the Piura region, more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

He raises and sells young animals and caged birds, such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, goats, etc. He keeps them in a corral in back of his house and when they have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale to merchants who visit the area where he lives. He has been doing this work for two years and has an established clientele.

Presentación would like to acquire a balanced diet for his birds since the demand for them is increasing. He would also like to make some repairs to his corral so that his animals will develop better. For this reason he decided to request a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to provide his animals with a balanced diet

loans.name: Josephine Wanjiru

texts.en:
Josephine Wanjiru is 54 years old and married to James K. who is a farmer and contributes to the family income. She has four children and has been selling rice for a period of 20 years with an income of KES. 10,000 per month.

She has applied for a second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loans well and in good time. She wants to use the loan to buy more rice for sale. 

She hopes to give her children quality education so they will have a bright future and improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy more rice for sale

loans.name: Smas

texts.en:
Smas R., 46, is a humble mother who has three children. All of her children are learning at the local public school. Currently, Smas R. stays at home to do housework and assists in her husband’s business. 

The financial income for this family comes from her husband's business. He sells different kinds of merchandise from province to province. He also buys items in bulk, on credit, from market sellers in Phnom Penh. He then supplies his products to people who are sellers in small markets in each province. Smas R. says that her husband’s enterprise is a very profitable one and he is able to earn enough money to meet her family's needs. She would like to ask for a loan for her husband to buy additional merchandise for resale.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for resale.
